src_text: imposing a nationwide lockdown at very short notice presented several challenges.
tgt_text: ho qobella ho kginwa ha metsamao ya batho le ditshebeletso tseo e seng tsa mantlha ka nako e kgutshwane naha ka bophara, ho bile le diqholotso tse ngatanyana.

src_text: we have had to weigh up the proportionality of the national response and the extent of restrictions we would need to impose.
tgt_text: re ile ra lokela ho sekaseka sekgahla sa karabelo ya naha le hore na ke dithibelo tse toma hakae tseo re tla tshwanela ho di qobella.

src_text: we ultimately chose to err on the side of caution.
tgt_text: qetellong re ile ra kgetha hore re mpe re nke lehlakore la ho ipaballa.

src_text: and as the presentation by the ministry of health indicated recently, enforcing a lockdown at the time we did has slowed down the rate of infection and, more importantly, bought us time to prepare for a probable surge in infections in the coming weeks and months.
tgt_text: jwaloka ha pehelo ya lefapha la bophelo bo botle e sa tswa bontsha, ho qobella ho kginwa ha metsamao ya batho le ditshebeletso tseo e seng tsa mantlha ka nako eo re ho entseng ka yona, ho fokoditse sekgahla sa tshwaetso mme ntho e leng ya bohlokwahlokwa, ke hore ho re file nako e ntle ya ho itokisetsa ho eketseha ha ditshwaetso ho ka nnang ha etsahala dibekeng le dikgweding tse tlang.

src_text: we had to consider the impact on an already floundering economy in both the long and short term, and the impact of this substantial disruption on the livelihoods of millions of people.
tgt_text: re ile ra tshwanela ho e nkela hloohong mabapi le nako e telele le e kgutshwane taba ena ya thefuleho e tla ba teng moruong ona o seng o thekesela, esita le sefutho sa tshitiso ena maphe long a matle a dimilione tsa batho.

src_text: we had to consider what weeks of confinement to the home would mean for the employed not paid regular salaries, for the unemployed and those seeking work, for those in casual or seasonal employment, for those in the informal sector, for the indigent and for the vulnerable.
tgt_text: re ile ra tshwanela ho e nkela hloohong taba ya hore ebe dibekeng tsena tsa ho ikwalla ka malapeng, ho tla bolela eng ho ba sebetsang empa ba sa amohele meputso ya bona ya kamehla, ho ba sa sebetseng ho hang le ba tsomang mesebetsi, ho ba sebetsang mesebetsi ya nakwana kapa ya dihla tse itseng, ho ba lekala la baitshokodi, ho bahloki le bao ba tlokotsing.

src_text: cabinet will finalise a set of measures to respond to the impact of the lockdown on the livelihoods of our people.
tgt_text: kabinete e tla phethela mekgwa ya ho arabela thefulehong ena ya ho kginwa ha metsamao ya batho le ditshebeletso tseo e seng tsa mantlha, maphelong a batho ba habo rona.

src_text: this has been preceded by a range of engagements with a number of stakeholders including business, labour, religious organisations, civil society and the presidential economic advisory council.
tgt_text: sena se ile sa etellwa pele ke letoto la dipuisano hammoho le ba bangatanyana ba amehang, ho akga ba dikgwebo, bosebetsi, mekgatlo ya bodumedi, setjhaba ka kakaretso esita le lekgotla la boeletsi ba moruo la moporesidente.

src_text: the social partners have put forward a number of proposals on interventions that could address the immediate vulnerability of the poorest of the poor, most of whom rely on social assistance to survive.
tgt_text: balekane ba kahisanong ba tlile le ditshisinyo tse ngata mabapi le bokenadipakeng bo ka thusang ho rarolla tlokotsi e renang ya ba kojwana di mahetleng, bao boholo ba bona bo tshepetseng dithusong tsa mmuso hore ba phele.

src_text: we will scale up welfare provision during this period to help households living below the poverty line.
tgt_text: re tla ntlafatsa phano ya thekolohelo nakong ena, e le ho thusa malapa a kollang ntsi hanong.

src_text: even when the nationwide lockdown is lifted, its effects will continue to be felt for some time to come.
tgt_text: leha ho kginwa hona ha metsamao ya batho le ditshebeletso tseo e seng tsa mantlha ho ka emiswa, ditlamorao tsa teng di tla nne di tswelepele ho utlwahala ka nako e telele e tlang.

src_text: those fortunate to have a steady income will be able to return to their jobs; but for millions of others this will be a lost month where they would otherwise have found temporary work, done business in the informal sector or saved money earned to meet their family responsibilities.
tgt_text: bao ba nang le lehlohonolo la hore ba na le lekeno le tsitsitseng ba tla kgona ho kgutlela mesebetsing ya bona; empa bakeng sa dimilione tse ding ena e tla ba kgwedi ya ho qetela moo ka mohlomong ho yona ba neng ba ka iphumanela mesebetsi ya nakwana, ba iketsetsa dikgwebo lekaleng la baitshokodi kapa ba boloke tjhelete eo ba e amohetseng e neng e tla ba thusa ka maikarabelo a malapa a bona.

src_text: food support is a shortterm emergency measure.
tgt_text: tshehetso ya ho fana ka dijo ke tharollo ya nako e kgutshwane ya tshohanyetso.

src_text: it will need to be matched by sustainable solutions that help our most vulnerable citizens weather the difficult times that are still to come.
tgt_text: e tla tshwanela ho nyalanngwa le ditharollo tsa nako e telele tse thusang baahi ba habo rona ba tlokotsing ka ho fetisisa, hore ba lebahanye thebe le dinako tse boima tse ntseng di tla latela.

src_text: i wish to thank the many ngos, religious groups and ordinary citizens who are donating money and volunteer ing to help feed the hungry and destitute.
tgt_text: ke batla ho leboha mekgatlo e mengata eo e seng ya mmuso (dingo), mekgatlo ya bodumedi le baahi ka kakaretso ba nyehelang ka tjhelete le boithaopo ba ho thusa ho fepa bao maphako a bona a ubang esita le ba kojwana di mahetleng.

src_text: alleviating hunger is not an act of charity.
tgt_text: ho fedisa tlala ha se ketso ya thekolohelo.

src_text: it is an imperative for any society that is founded on respect for human rights.
tgt_text: ke tshwanelo bake ng sa setjhaba sefe kapa sefe se bopelletsweng ka tlhompho ya ditokelo tsa botho.

src_text: we are at a point in our battle with the pandemic where complacency could prove disastrous.
tgt_text: re mothating oo kgotsofalo ya rona e ka bang masisapelo ntweng ena ya rona le sewa sena.

src_text: i call on each and every one to remain vigilant, to continue to abide by the regulations, and to keep safe and keep others safe.
tgt_text: ke etsa kgoeletso ho e mong le e mong hore a dule a fadimehile, a tswelepele ho ikobela melawana, a ipoloke a bolokehile a be a boloke le ba bang ba bolokehile.

src_text: as government we will be providing information on the direct interventions we are taking to shield our most vulnerable citizens from the grim prospect of starvation.
tgt_text: re le mmuso re tla dula re ntse re fana ka lesedi le mabapi le bokenadipakeng boo re bo etsang ka kotloloho ho sireletsa baahi ba bo rona ba tlokotsing ka ho fetisisa kgahlanong le sekoboto.

src_text: among the many difficulties our people face at this time, wondering where their next meal will come from should not be one of them.
tgt_text: thuso bakeng sa baahi ba habo rona ba tlokotsing vukuzenzele unnamed dinaha tse ngata lefatsheng ka bophara di qobelletse ho kginwa ha metsamao ya batho le ditshebeletso tseo e seng tsa mantlha, ka sepheo sa ho pholosa maphelo a baahi ba tsona.

src_text: let us unite in our fight against covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed the entire world is in the unrelenting grip of the coronavirus pandemic, whose spread has been rapid.
tgt_text: ha re ipopeng ngatana ntweng ya rona kgahlanong le covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed lefatshe lohle le kakatletswe ke sewa se hanang ho fela sa kokwanahloko ya corona , e atileng ka potlako.

src_text: a vaccine has yet to be found.
tgt_text: ho ntse ho batlanwa le ente ya pheko.

src_text: across the world, over 3.4 million people are known to be infected and more than 240,000 have died.
tgt_text: ho phatlalla le lefatshe, ke batho ba fetang 3.4 milione ba tsejwang ba tshwaeditswe mme ba fetang 240 000 ba hlokahetse.

src_text: these are indeed desperate times.
tgt_text: ruri tsena ke dinako tsa tsitsipano.

src_text: when the national state of disaster was declared six weeks ago, south africa only had 61 confirmed coronavirus infections.
tgt_text: ha ho ne ho tsebahatswa maemo a naha a koduwa dibekeng tse tsheletseng tse fetileng, afrika borwa e ne e na le ditlaleho tse tiiseditsweng tse 61 tsa tshwaetso ya kokwanahloko ya corona .

src_text: despite the relatively low number, expert opinion and international experience indicated that infec tions would rise exponentially.
tgt_text: ho sa natswe palo e batlang e le tlase, mmono wa ditsebi le boiphihlelo ba matjhabeng di bontshitse hore ditshwaetso di tla eketseha ka matla.

src_text: i said that urgent and drastic measures would need to be taken.
tgt_text: ke boletse hore mehato e potlakileng le e matla e tla nkuwa.

src_text: those measures – which included a nationwide lockdown and the closure of our borders – have proved to be effective in delaying the spread of the disease.
tgt_text: mehato eo – e neng e kenyeletsa ho kginwa ha ditshebeletso le metsamao ya batho hammoho le ho kwalwa ha madiboho a rona – e bonahetse e beha ditholwana mabapi le ho fokotsa ho ata ha lefu lena.

src_text: this has been possible because most south africans have adhered to the lockdown provisions, practising social distancing and wearing face masks.
tgt_text: sena se kgonahetse hobane boholo ba maafrika borwa bo ikobetse dipehelo tsa ho kginwa ha ditshebeletso le motsamao wa batho, ho sielana sebaka le ho kenya dimaske tsa sefahleho.

src_text: i applaud you for this and for all the other sacrifices you have made.
tgt_text: ke a le thoholetsa ka sena le ka maitelo ao le a entseng.

src_text: at this stage in the progress of the pandemic, other countries had far more infections than we do.
tgt_text: nakong ena ka hara kgatelopele ya sewa sena, dinaha tse ngata di na le ditshwaetso tse fetang tsa rona.

src_text: as of now – which is 46 days since we recorded our 100th coronavirus case – we have 6,783 confirmed cases.
tgt_text: ho fihlela hajwale – e leng matsatsi a 46 esale re rekota tlaleho ya rona ya bo100 ya kokwanahloko ya corona – re na le ditlaleho tse 6 783 tse tiiseditsweng.

src_text: italy, which has a similar size population to ours, had more than 140,000 cases and the united states had around 700,000 confirmed cases at the 46day mark.
tgt_text: italy, e nang le palo e lekanang le ya setjhaba sa bo rona, e bi le le ditlaleho tse 140 000 mme amerika e bile le ditlaleho tse ka bang 700 000 tse tiiseditsweng letsatsing la bo46.

src_text: but this does not mean that the danger has passed.
tgt_text: feela sena ha se bolele hore kotsi e fetile.

src_text: we have not nearly reached the peak of infections in south africa.
tgt_text: nnete ke hore ha re so fihlelle sehlohlolo sa ditshwaetso afrika borwa.

src_text: all the scientific models show that the infection rate will continue to rise at a much faster rate in the next few months.
tgt_text: dimotlolo tsohle tsa saense di bontsha hore sekgahla sa tshwaetso se tla tswella ho phahama ka lebelo le ka matla dikgweding tse mmalwa tse tlang.

src_text: however, the speed with which the virus spreads and the number of people who are ultimately infected will be determined by what we do now.
tgt_text: leha ho le jwalo, lebelo leo kokwanahloko e atang ka lona le palo ya batho ba tla tshwaetswa e itshetlehile hodima seo re se etsang hajwale.

src_text: that is why the easing of the lockdown needs to be gradual and cautious.
tgt_text: ke kahoo ho theolwa ha ho kginwa ha ditshebeletso ho lokela hoetswa butlebutle le ka hloko.

src_text: it is for this reason that many regulations need to remain in place and why it is absolutely essential that people observe them.
tgt_text: ke ka lebaka lena melawana e mengata e lokelang ho dula e ntse e sebetsa le hore hobaneng ho le bohlokwa hore batho ba ikobele yona.

src_text: i know how difficult this is and i understand the concern that many of our compatriots have about how these regulations are interfering and limiting their rights.
tgt_text: ke a tseba hore ho boima hakae le ho utlwisisa matshwenyeho a boholo ba batho ba bo rona ba nang le ona a kamoo melawana ena e sitisang le ho ngotla ditokelo tsa bona.

src_text: but all this is necessary.
tgt_text: feela sena kaofela se a hlokahala.

src_text: our overriding objective is the preservation of life.
tgt_text: morero o moholo ke paballo ya bophelo.

src_text: social distancing and proper hygiene are still our best and only defences in this struggle.
tgt_text: ho sielana sebaka le bohlweki bo nepahetseng e sa le tsona tsa bohlokwahadi le boitshireletso ntweng ena.

src_text: this is what informs the regulations we have put in place for level 4 of our response.
tgt_text: sena ke lebaka le entseng hore re theohele ho mohato wa bone wa karabelo ya rona.

src_text: our considerations are based on empirical evidence, scientific and economic data and international best practice.
tgt_text: mabaka a rona a itshetlehile hodima bopaki bo tshwarehang, ba saense le lesedi la tsa moruo le ditlwaelo tse hlwahlwa ka ho fetisisa tsa matjhaba.

src_text: in the 1995 judgment of the constitutional court that outlawed capital punishment, jus tice arthur chaskalson wrote: "the rights to life and dignity are the most important of all human rights and the source of all other personal rights.
tgt_text: ka selemo sa 1995 kahlolo ya lekgotla la molaotheo e ile ya e ba ho fedisa kahlolo ya lefu, moahlodi arthur chaskalson o ile a ngola hore: "tokelo ya ho phela le seriti ke tsa bohlokwahadi tsa ditokelo tsa botho le mohlodi wa ditokelo tse ding tsa motho.

src_text: by committing ourselves to a society founded on the recognition of human rights we are required to value these two rights above all others.
tgt_text: ka boitlamo ba rona bakeng sa setjhaba se thehilweng hodima kananelo ya ditokelo tsa botho, re loketse ho nkela ditokelo tsena tse pedi hloohong ho feta tse ding.

src_text: "the regulations we have put in place are founded on that commitment to life and dignity, and which justify – in these extreme circumstances – temporary restrictions on other rights, like freedom of movement and association.
tgt_text: "melawana eo re e behileng e thehilwe hodima boitlamo boo ba bophelo le seriti, mme e le se tiisetsang – maemong ana a sa tlwaelehang ka ho fetisisa – a ho thibelwa nakwana ha ditokelo tse ding, tse kang bolokolohi ba motsamao le ba boipapiso.

src_text: in doing this, south africa is not unlike many other countries.
tgt_text: ka ho etsa sena, afrika borwa ha e ya fapana le boholo ba dinaha tse ding.

src_text: an estimated onefifth of the world’s population is under quarantine or nationwide lockdown, with this number growing rapidly in response to rising infections.
tgt_text: ho akanngwa hore nngwe bohlanong ya setjhaba sa lefatshe e ka tlasa ho kwallwa kapa ho kginwa ho phatlaletseng ha ditshebeletso, moo palo ena e holang ka potlako mabapi le karabelo ho ditshwaetso tse ntseng di phahama.

src_text: this includes countries with substantially larger populations than ours, like india with its 1.5 billion people.
tgt_text: sena se kenyeletsa dinaha tse nang le setjhaba se sengata haholo ho feta sa bo rona, se kang sa india ka batho ba 1.5 bilione.

src_text: dozens of countries have imposed curfews such as the one that is now in place here.
tgt_text: dinaha tse ngata tsa lefatshe di behile dithibelo tsa motsamao tse tshwanang le tse teng hajwale mona.

src_text: limitations on movement are in place in a number of countries.
tgt_text: dithibelo tsa motsamao di teng dinaheng tse ngata.

src_text: in the uk and the french capital, paris, public exercise is limited to certain hours and within a certain distance of one’s home.
tgt_text: engelane le motsemoholo wa fora, paris, ho ikwetlisa ha batho ho kginnwe bakeng sa dihora tse itseng le bakeng sa bohole bo itseng ho tloha lapeng la motho.

src_text: containment and prevention measures similar to ours are in place in a number of countries.
tgt_text: mehato ya ho kginwa le thibelo e tshwanang le ya rona e teng dinaheng tse ngata.

src_text: for example, alcohol sales during lockdown have been either restricted or banned in a number of territories and by local governments, including parts of mexico, hong kong and greenland, which last month imposed a ban on alcohol sales during lockdown to limit infection but also ‘to curb violence against women and children.’there has been much public comment on government’s decision to extend the prohibition on the sale of tobacco products into level 4. a decision like this is bound to be controversial, but it is wrong to suggest that there are ministers or a president doing and saying whatever they want on this matter.
tgt_text: mohlala, thekiso ya tahi nakong ya ho kginwa ha ditshebeletso le metsamao ya batho e thibetswe dibakeng tse ngata le ke mebuso ya lehae, ho kenyeletswa dikarolo tsa mexico, hong kong le greenland, tseo kgweding e fetileng di kentseng thibelo ya thekiso ya tahi nakong ya ho kginwa ha ditshebeletso ho fokotsa ditshwaetso empa hape le ‘ho thibela dikgoka kgahlanong le basadi le bana.’ho bile le dipuopuo ho tswa setjhabeng mabapi le qeto ya mmuso ya ho atolosa thibelo ya dihlahiswa tsa kwae ho ya ho mohato wa bone.

src_text: on 23 april, i announced that cigarette sales would be permitted during level 4. this was based on the view of the national coronavirus command council (nccc), and which was contained in the draft framework that was published for consulation.
tgt_text: qeto e tshwanang le ena e tshwanetse ho baka dikgang, empa ho fosahetse ho sisinya hore ho na le matona a etsang le ho bua seo a se ratang tabeng ena kapa moporesidente ya etsang jwalo.

src_text: after careful consideration and discussion, the nccc reconsidered its position on tobacco.
tgt_text: ka la 23 mmesa 2020, ke ile ka tsebisa hore thekiso ya sakerete e tla dumellwa nakong ya mohato wa bone.

src_text: as a result, the regulations ratified by cabinet and announced by minister nkosazana dlaminizuma on 29 april extended the prohibition.
tgt_text: sena se ne se itshetlehile hodima mohopolo wa lekgotla la naha la taolo ya kokwanahloko ya corona (nccc), le o neng o le teng ka hara moralo o neng o phatlaladitsweng bakeng sa ditherisano.

src_text: this was a collective decision and the public statements by both myself and the minister were done on behalf of, and mandated by, the collective i lead.
tgt_text: kamora tshekatsheko e tebileng le dipuisano, nccc e ile ya sheba botjha qeto ya yona e mabapi le kwae.

src_text: every regulation we have put in place has been carefully considered.
tgt_text: ka lebaka leo, melao e ileng ya amohelwa ke kabinete le letona nkosazana dlaminizuma ka la 29 mmesa e ile ya atolosa thibelo ena.

src_text: along the way there has been consultation with medical experts, various constituencies and different industries.
tgt_text: ena e bile qeto e kopanetsweng mme dipehelo tsa setjhaba tsa ka bobedi nna le letona di entswe lebitsong la, le ka thomo ya boetapele bo kopanetsweng.

src_text: we have been guided by international bodies and the experience of other countries.
tgt_text: molawana ka mong oo re o behileng o shebilwe ka hloko.

src_text: the reality is that we are sailing in unchartered waters.
tgt_text: ka ho le leng ho bile le ditherisano le ditsebi tsa bongaka, bankakarolo ba fapafapaneng le diindaseteri tse fapaneng.

src_text: there is still a great deal about the epidemiology of the virus that is unknown.
tgt_text: re tataisitswe ke mekgatlo ya matjhaba le boiphihlelo ba dinaha tse ding.

src_text: it is better to err on the side of caution than to pay the devastating price of a lapse in judgment in future.
tgt_text: nnete ke hore re iphumana re le ka hara ntho eo re qalang ho e bona.

src_text: while there are differing views on some of the decisions we have taken – and in some instances these have polarised opinion – government is making every effort to act in a way that advances the rights to life and dignity of all our people.
tgt_text: ho sa na le ho hongata ho sa tsejweng ka nalane ya kokwanahloko ena.

src_text: listening to our people and their concerns during this period has been one of the distinguishing features of how we as government have managed this pandemic.
tgt_text: ho betere ho etsa phoso o itlhokemetse ho e na le ho lemala ka lebaka la ho iphapanya kotsi kamoso.

src_text: we continue to listen to the concerns of our people and are prepared to make adjustments that balance people’s concerns about the challenges they face with the need to save lives.
tgt_text: leha ho e na le mehopolo e fapanang mabapi le diqeto tse ding tseo re di nkileng – mme mabakeng a mang mehopolo e ba e hananang – mmuso o etsa boiteko bohle ho sebetsa ka tsela e ntlafatsang tokelo ya ho phela le seriti sa batho ba bo rona kaofela.

src_text: at this difficult time, our collective energies must be focused on ensuring that health and life is preserved, that the delivery of food, water, health care, social security and social support is not disrupted.
tgt_text: ho mamela le ho utlwa dingongoreho tsa batho ba bo rona nakong ena e bile le leng la matshwao a ikgethang a kamoo rona jwaloka mmuso re kgonneng ho laola sewa sena.

src_text: under these extraordinary circumstances, as government, as individuals and as society we will at times make mistakes.
tgt_text: re tswella ho mamela dingongoreho tsa batho ba bo rona mme re ikemiseditse ho etsa ditokiso tse tsitsisang dingongoreho tsa bona tse mabapi le diphephetso tseo ba di tobileng mabapi le tlhokeho ya ho baballa maphelo.

src_text: when these occur, we will correct them.
tgt_text: nakong ena e boima, re lokela ho kopanela ho tsepamisa maikutlo tabeng ya ho netefatsa hore boitekanelo le bophelo di a baballwa, hore phano ya dijo, metsi, tlhokomelo ya kalafo, tshireletso ya setjhaba le tshehetso ya sona ha di sitisehe.

src_text: but we must carry on, losing neither our nerve nor our resolve.
tgt_text: tlasa maemo ana a sa tlwaelehang, re le mmuso, re le batho ka bo mong le setjhaba ka nako e nngwe re tla etsa diphoso.

src_text: the situation in which we find ourselves demands courage and patience.
tgt_text: ha tsena di etsahala, re tla di lokisa.

src_text: it requires goodwill and trust between you, the citizen, and your government, and between each other.
tgt_text: feela re lokela ho hahamalla pele, re sa lahlehelwe ke tjantjello kapa maikemisetso a rona.

src_text: from the union buildings 3 vuk’uzenzelehelp for our vulnerable citizensmany countries around the world have imposed coronavirus lockdowns with a view to saving the lives of their citizens.
tgt_text: maemo ao re iphumanang ka hara ona a batla sebete le mamello.

src_text: we have done the same in our country, but our lockdown has revealed a very sad fault line in our society that reveals how grinding poverty, inequality and unemployment is tearing the fabric of our communities apart.
tgt_text: ha re ipopeng ngatana ntweng ya rona kgahlanong le covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed lefatshe lohle le kakatletswe ke sewa se hanang ho fela sa kokwanahloko ya corona , e atileng ka potlako.

src_text: our democracy will help us overcome covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed we often take our healthy and robust democracy for granted.
tgt_text: demokerasi ya rona e tla re thusa ho hlola covid 19 vukuzenzele unnamed hangata re nka demokerasi ya rona e hlwahlwa le e matla hanyane.

src_text: yet it is probably our greatest asset in our momentous struggle to overcome the coronavirus pandemic.
tgt_text: feela e batla e le sesebediswa sa rona se seholo ka ho fetisisa mabapi le ntwa ya rona ya ho hlola sewa sa kokwanahloko ya corona.

src_text: we have among the most politicallyengaged citizenry in the world.
tgt_text: re na le baahi ba tsebang haholo ka dipolotiki lefatsheng.

src_text: a poll in 2018 by the pew research center shows south africans are strongly inclined to take political action about issues they feel most strongly about, such as health care, education, freedom of speech and corruption.
tgt_text: diphuputso tse entsweng ke setsi sa diphuputso sa pew ka 2018 se bontsha hore maafrika borwa a kgona ho nka kgato ya sepolotiki ka matla mabapi le dintlha tse ba ngongorehisang haholo, tse kang tlhokomelo ya kalafo, thuto, bolokolohi ba puo le bobodu.

src_text: the poll confirms much that we already know about ourselves.
tgt_text: diphuputso di thathiselletsa haholo ka seo re seng re se tseba ka rona.

src_text: we enjoy nothing more than robust engagement with our government and among ourselves on the burning issues of the day.
tgt_text: re thabela ho buisana ka matla le mmuso wa rona le ka bo rona mabapi le ditaba tse tjhesang tsa letsatsi.

src_text: we have an active civil society ever ready to safeguard our fundamental freedoms and rights.
tgt_text: re na le setjhaba se itahlelang ka setotswana ditabeng tsa letsatsi ka leng, se dulang se ikemiseditse ho sireletsa ditokoloho le ditokelo tsa rona tsa mantlha.

src_text: one of the triumphs of our democracy is that every south african believes the constitution protects them and that the courts are a fair and impartial arbiter of their interests.
tgt_text: e nngwe ya ditlholo tsa rona tsa demokerasi ke hore moafrika borwa e mong le e mong o dumela hore molaotheo o a mo sireletsa le hore makgotla a dinyewe a hloka leeme le ho ba moahlodi ya sa nkeng lehlakore mabapi le dikgahlehelo tsa bona.

src_text: i got thinking on these matters during a recent visit to the eastern cape to assess the province’s coronavirus state of readiness.
tgt_text: ke ile ka nahana ka ditaba tsena moraorao tjena ha ke ne ke etetse kapa botjhabela ho ya lekola boemo ba boitokisetso ba provense eo mabapi le kokwanahloko ya corona.

src_text: i was asked by a journalist whether i was concerned at the pending litigation challenging certain provisions of the disaster management act.
tgt_text: moqolotsi wa ditaba o ile a mpotsa haeba ke tshwenyehile ka qoso e motjheng ya ho phephetsa dipehelo tse ding tsa molao wa taolo ya dikoduwa.

src_text: this law is the basis for all the regulations promulgated under the national state of disaster we declared to combat coronavirus.
tgt_text: molao ona ke motheo wa melawana yohle e phatlaladitsweng tlasa maemo a koduwa ya naha ao re a tsebahaditseng ho lwantsha kokwanahloko ya corona.

src_text: since the start of this crisis, a number of people have exercised their right to approach the courts.
tgt_text: esale koduwa ena e qala, batho ba bangata ba sebedisitse tokelo ya bona ya ho leba makgotleng a dinyewe.

src_text: the lockdown regulations were challenged in the very first week of the lockdown by a private citizen from mpumalanga who wanted an exemption from the travel prohibition to attend a funeral.
tgt_text: melawana ya ho kginwa ha ditshebeletso le metsamao ya batho e ile ya phephetswa bekeng ya pele feela ya ho kginwa ha ditshebeletso ke moahi wa mpumalanga ya neng a batla ho kotelwa thibelong ya ho ya lepatong.

src_text: in the seven (7) weeks that have followed, there have been legal challenges from a number of individuals, religious bodies, political parties, ngos and from business organisations against one measure or more of the lockdown provisions they were unhappy with.
tgt_text: dibekeng tse supileng tse latelang, ho bile le diphephetso tsa semolao ho tswa bathong ba bangata, mekgatlong ya bodumedi, mekgeng ya dipolotiki, mekgatlong eo e seng ya mmuso (dingo) le mekgatlong ya dikgwebo kgahlanong le tsela e le nngwe kapa ho feta ya dipehelo tsa ho kginwa ha ditshebeletso tse neng di sa ba thabisi.

src_text: some have succeeded in their legal challenges and some have not.
tgt_text: ba bang ba atlehile diphephetsong tsa bona tsa semolao mme ba bang ha ba a atleha.

src_text: some had approached the courts on the basis of the urgency of their cases had their urgency arguments dismissed and others have found other avenues for the relief they sought.
tgt_text: ba bang ba ile ba leba kgotla ka le reng mabaka a bona a potlakile mme diphephetso tsa mabaka a bona a potlakileng di ile tsa qhalwa mme ba bang ba ile ba fumana metjha e meng bakeng sa thuso eo ba neng ba e batla.

src_text: others have subsequently withdrawn their applications following engagement with government.
tgt_text: ba bang ba qetelletse ba hutse dikopo tsa bona ho latela dipuisano tsa bona le mmuso.

src_text: while we would prefer to avoid the need for any legal action against government, we should accept that citizens who are unhappy with whatever action that government has decided on implementing have a right to approach our courts for any form of relief they seek.
tgt_text: leha re ne re rata ho phema tlhokeho ya diqoso kgahlanong le mmuso, re lokela ho amohela hore baahi ba sa kgotsofalang ke mohato ofe kapa ofe oo mmuso o entseng qeto ya ho o kenya tshebetsong ba na le tokelo ya ho leba makgotleng bakeng sa thuso leha e le efe eo ba e batlang.

src_text: this is a normal tenet of a constitutional democracy and a perfectly acceptable practice in a country founded on the rule of law.
tgt_text: sena ke tokelo e tlwaelehileng ya demokerasi ya molaotheo mme ke tlwaelo e amohelehang ka ho phethahala naheng e thehilweng hodima tshebetso ya molao.

src_text: we have checks and balances in place to ensure that every aspect of governance is able to withstand constitutional scrutiny.
tgt_text: re na la ditsela tsa tekolo le tlhahlobo ya ho netefatsa hore ntlha leha e le efe ya puso e kgona ho emela ho shebisiswa ha molaotheo.

src_text: where we are found wanting, we will be held to account by our courts and, above all, by our citizens.
tgt_text: moo re nang le dikgaello, re tla lebellwa ho ikarabella makgotleng a rona a dinyewe mme, hodima tsohle, ke baahi ba rona.

src_text: besides our courts, our chapter 9 institutions exist to advance the rights of citizens, as do the bodies tasked with oversight over the law enforcement agencies.
tgt_text: ntle le makgotla a rona a dinyewe, ditheo tse tshehetsang puso tsa rona di teng bakeng sa ho matlafatsa ditokelo tsa baahi, jwalo feela ka ha ho etswa ke makala a fuweng mosebetsi wa ho beha leihlo makala a qobello ya molao.

src_text: as i told the journalist, every south african has a right to approach the courts and even i, as president, could never stand in the way of anybody exercising that right.
tgt_text: jwaloka ha ke ile ka jwetsa moqolotsi eo wa ditaba, moafrika borwa e mong le e mong o na le tokelo ya ho leba makgotleng a dinyewe mme le nna, jwaloka moporesidente, nkeke ka ema tseleng ya mang kapa mang ya sebedisang tokelo eo.

src_text: there has been, and will continue to be, robust and strident critique of a number of aspects of our national response to coronavirus, from the data modelling and projections, to the economic effects of the lockdown, to the regulations.
tgt_text: ho bile le, mme ho tla dula ho na le, ditlhaselo le ho se utlwane ho matla ka dintlha tse ngata tsa karabelo ya rona ya naha ho kokwanahloko ya corona, ho tloha ho dimotlolo le bolepi tsa tlhahisoleseding, ho ya ho ditlamorao tsa moruo tsa ho kginwa ha ditshebeletso le ho ya melawaneng.

src_text: as government we have neither called for such critique to be tempered or for it to be silenced.
tgt_text: re le mmuso ha re so ka re thibela hore ho be le ditlhaselo mme di sitiswe kapa di kgutsiswe.

src_text: to the contrary, criticism, where it is constructive, helps us to adapt and to move with agility in response to changing circumstances and conditions.
tgt_text: ka nqae nngwe, tlhaselo, ha e le e ahang, e re thusa ho amohela le ho nka mehato ka potlako karabelong ya maemo a fetohang.

src_text: it enriches public debate and gives us all a broader understanding of the issues at play.
tgt_text: e matlafatsa dingangisano tsa phatlalatsa le ho re neha kutlwisiso e batsi ya maemo a ditaba.

src_text: we have consistently maintained that we rely on scientific, economic and empirical data when it comes to making decisions and formulating regulations around our coronavirus response.
tgt_text: esale re ikema ka hore re tshepetse hodima tlhahisoleseding ya saense, moruo le e tshwarehang ha re tla tabeng ya ho etsa diqeto le ho bopa melawana e mabapi le karabelo ho kokwanahloko ya corona.

src_text: to the greatest extent possible under these challenging circumstances, we aim for consultation and engagement.
tgt_text: re leka ka matla kahohle kamoo re ka kgonang tlasa diqholotso tsena tse boima, ho kena ditherisanong le dipuisanong.

src_text: we want all south africans to be part of this national effort.
tgt_text: re batla hore maafrika borwa kaofela e be karolo ya boiteko bona ba naha.

src_text: the voices of ordinary citizens must continue to be heard at a time as critical as this.
tgt_text: maikutlo a moahi e mong le e mong a lokela ho mamelwa nakong e hlokolosi jwaloka ena ho sa natswe maemo a hae.

src_text: the coronavirus pandemic and the measures we have taken to combat it have taken a heavy toll on our people.
tgt_text: sewa sa kokwanahloko ya corona le mehato eo re e nkileng ya ho e lwantsha se thefutse batho ba bo rona haholo.

src_text: it has caused huge disruption and hardship.
tgt_text: se bakile tshitiso le mathata a maholo.

src_text: although we can point to the progress we have made in delaying the transmission of the virus, there is still a long way to go.
tgt_text: leha re ka supa kgatelopele eo re e entseng mabapi le ho diehisa ho nama ha kokwanahloko ena, tsela ya rona e sa le telele.

src_text: the weeks and months ahead will be difficult and will demand much more from our people.
tgt_text: dibeke le dikgwedi tse tlang e tla ba tse boima mme ho tla batleha hore batho ba bo rona ba sebetse haholo ho feta.

src_text: the pandemic will therefore continue to place an enormous strain on our society and our institutions.
tgt_text: kahoo sewa sena se tla dula se behile kgatello hodima setjhaba le ditheo tsa bo rona.

src_text: even as we gradually open up the economy, the impact on people’s material conditions will be severe.
tgt_text: leha re ntse re bula moruo butlebutle, kgahlamelo ya sona hodima maemo a ditlhoko tsa batho e tla ba e bohloko.

src_text: for as long as this is the case, the potential for conflict, discord and dissatisfaction will remain.
tgt_text: ha feela maemo a ntse a le tjena, kgonahalo ya diqhwebeshano, ho se utlwane le ho se kgotsofale e tla ba dintho tsa kamehla.

src_text: as we navigate these turbu lent waters, our constitution is our most important guide and our most valued protection.
tgt_text: ha re ntse re lwantshana le maqhubu ana a matla, molaotheo wa rona ke ona motataisi wa rona wa bohlokwa le tshireletso e babatsehang.

src_text: our robust democracy provides the strength and the resilience we need to overcome this deep crisis.
tgt_text: demokerasi ya rona e matla e fana ka matla le boitseko boo re bo hlokang bakeng sa ho hlola koduwa ena.

src_text: just as government appreciates that most court appli cants are motivated by the common good, so too should we recognise that the decisions taken by government are made in good faith and are meant to advance, and not to harm, the interests of south africans.
tgt_text: jwalo feela kaha mmuso o ananela hore bongata ba ba hlahlelang dinyewe kgotla ba etsa seo molemong wa bohle, le rona re lokela ho ananela hore diqeto tse nkuweng ke mmuso di entswe ka maikemisetso a matle mme di reretswe ho ntshetsapele, mme e seng ho thunthetsa, dikgahlehelo tsa maafrika borwa.

src_text: our foremost priority remains to save lives.
tgt_text: taba ya rona e ka sehlohlolong ke ho baballa maphelo.

src_text: our every decision is informed by the need to advance the rights to life and dignity as set out in our constitution.
tgt_text: qeto ka nngwe ya rona e bakwa ke tlhokeho ya ho ntshetsapele ditokelo tsa bophelo le seriti jwaloka ha di tekilwe ka hara molaotheo wa rona.

src_text: we will continue to welcome different – even dissenting – viewpoints around our national coronavirus response.
tgt_text: re tla tswella ho amohela mehopolo – leha e fapana – e mabapi le karabelo ya rona ya naha ho kokwanahloko ya corona.

src_text: all viewpoints aid us and help us to work better and smarter.
tgt_text: mehopolo kaofela e re thusa ho sebetsa betere le ka bokgabane.

src_text: the exercise of the fundamental freedoms of expression, association and speech is a barometer of the good health of our democracy.
tgt_text: ho sebedisa ditokelo tsa mantlha tsa ho itseka, tsa boikamahanyo le puo ke sekala sa boitekanelo ba demokerasi ya rona.

src_text: but much more than that, these rights are essential to the success of our national and collective struggle to overcome the coronavirus.
tgt_text: demokerasi ya rona e tla re thusa ho hlola covid 19 vukuzenzele unnamed hangata re nka demokerasi ya rona e hlwahlwa le e matla hanyane.

src_text: sa moves to alert level 3 vukuzenzele unnamed president cyril rama phosa has announced that south africa has moved to level 3 with effect from 1 june with more sectors of the economy opening and the removal of a number of restrictions on the movement of people.
tgt_text: afrika borwa e fetela mokgahlelong wa 3 vukuzenzele unnamed mopresidente cyril ramaphosa o phatlaladitse hore afrika borwa e fetetse mo kgahlelong wa 3 ho tloha ka la 1 phuptjane 2020 – mme dikarolo tse ngata tsa moruo di tla bula esita le ho fedisa dithibelo tse ngata tsa me tsamao ya batho.

src_text: addressing the nation re cently on the developments in south africa’s riskadjusted strategy to manage the spread of the coronavirus (covid19), the president says the country will have a differentiated approach to deal with areas that have far higher levels of infection and transmission.
tgt_text: ha a ne a bua le setjhaba haufinyana mabapi le tse etsahalang ka hara afrika borwa mabapi le mokgwa o hlophiseditsweng ho thibela kotsi tse ka hlahang e le ho thibela ho ata ha covid19, mopresidente o re naha e tla ba le mokgwa ona o ikgethileng ho sebetsana le dibaka tse nang le sekgahla se phahameng sa tshwaetso le katiso ya yona.

src_text: covid19 hotspotsthese areas have been de clared as coronavirus disease hotspots.
tgt_text: dibaka tse kotsing e kgolo ya covid19dibaka tsena di phatlaladitswe e le dibaka tse kotsing e kgolo ya tshwaetso ya kokwanahloko ya corona.

src_text: they include the following metros: city of tshwane city of johannesburg ekurhuleni ethekwini nelson mandela bay buffalo city cape town.
tgt_text: di kenyeletsa metsemeholo ena e latelang: motsemoholo wa tshwane motsemoholo wa johannesburg ekurhuleni ethekwini nelson mandela bay buffalo city le motse kapa dibaka tse ding tse hlwailweng e le dibaka tse kotsing e kgolo ke west coast, overberg le cape winelands ditereke tsa mmasepala mane kapa bophirimela, setereke sa chris hani se kapa botjhabela, le setereke sa ilembe se kwazulunatala.

src_text: other areas that have been identified as hotspots are the west coast, overberg and cape winelands district municipalities in the western cape, chris hani district in the eastern cape and ilembe district in kwazulunatal.
tgt_text: sebaka se kotsing e kgolo se hlaloswa e le sebaka se nang le palo e fetang bohlano ya batho ba tshwaeditsweng hara batho ba 100 000 ba bang le ba bang kapa moo ditshwaetso tse ntjha di eketsehang ka potlako.

src_text: a hotspot is defined as an area that has more than five infected people per every 100 000 people or where new infections are increasing at a fast pace.
tgt_text: ho laola kokwanahloko dibakeng tsena, mmuso o tla sebedisa mekgwa e matla e hlwahlwa ho fokotsa palo ya ditshwaetso tse ntjha.

src_text: to deal with the virus in these areas, government will implement intensive interventions aimed at decreasing the number of new infections.
tgt_text: mopresidente o re: "re sebedisa mekgwa e matlafaditsweng ya tekolo, taolo ya tshwaetso esita le bolaodi.

src_text: "we are putting in place enhanced measures of surveillance, infection control and management.
tgt_text: re tla sebedisa sehlopha sa basebetsi ba nako tsohle ba nang le boiphihlelo bo hlwahlwa sebakeng ka seng se nang le kotsi e phahameng ya tshwaetso.

src_text: we will assign a fulltime team of experienced personnel to each hotspot," the president says.
tgt_text: "sehlopha sena se tla kenyeletsa ditsebi tsa ho ata ha malwetse, dingaka tsa malapa, baoki, basebeletsi ba tsa setjhaba ba tsa bophelo bo botle, ditsebi tsa bophelo bo botle ba setjhaba le ditshebeletso tsa bongaka tsa tshohanyetso, mme bona ba tshehetswe ke ditsebi tsa naha ya cuba.

src_text: this team will include epidemiologists, family practition ers, nurses, community health workers, public health experts and emergency medical services, to be supported by cuban experts.
tgt_text: re tla hokela sebaka ka seng se kotsing le ditshebeletso tsa ho etsa diteko, disebediswa tsa pehellothoko ya ba tshwaeditsweng, pehellothoko ya ba nahanelwang hore ba tshwaeditswe, kalafo, dibethe tsa sepetlele esita le ho batlana le ba bang bao ba kopaneng le ba ho fihletsweng ba kula.

src_text: "we will link each hotspot to testing services, isolation facilities, quarantine facilities, treatment, hospital beds and contact tracing.
tgt_text: o re: "haeba ho hlokeha, karolo efe kapa efe ya naha e ka kgutlisetswa mokgahlelong wa 4 kapa wa 5 haeba ho ata ha tshwaetso ho sa laolehe ho sa natswe thuso ya rona mme ho na le kgonahalo ya kotsi ya tshubuhlellano ditsing tsa rona tsa bophelo bo botle."

src_text: "should it be necessary, any part of the country could be returned to alert levels 4 or 5 if the spread of infection is not contained despite our interventions and there is a risk of our health facilities being overwhelmed," he says.
tgt_text: lenane la dibaka tse nang le kotsi e kgolo ya tshwaetso le tla boela le lekolwa ka diveke tse ding le tse ding tse pedi ho ya ka tswelopele ya kokwanahloko ena.

src_text: the list of hotspot areas will be reviewed every two weeks depending on the progression of the virus.
tgt_text: ho bulwa ha dikgweboho sebediswa ha mokgahlelo wa 3 ho qadileng qalong ya kgwedi ya phuptjane, ho kenyeleditse ho kgutla ha tshebetso ya dikarolo tse ngata tsa kgwebo, empa sena se tla etsuwa ka ho ikobela melao e thata ya bophelo bo botle esita le melawana ya ho sielana sebaka pakeng tsa batho.

src_text: opening the economythe implementation of alert level 3 which started at the beginning of june, involved the return to operation of most sectors of the econo my, subject to observance of strict health protocols and social distancing rules.
tgt_text: basebetsi ba bang ba bangata haholwanyane le bona ba kgutletse mesebetsing ho ya ka dipehelo tsa molao wa bophelo bo botle mesebetsing esita le boipaballo esita le ditaelo tsa lefapha la mesebetsi ya setjhaba le botsamaisi, ka ho sebetsa hammoho le mafapha ohle a mmuso.

src_text: more public servants have also returned to work in accordance with provisions of the occupational health and safety act and as guided by the department of public service and administration, working together with all other departments in government.
tgt_text: melao le meralo ya sebaka sa tshebetsoha e le mona dikarolo tse ngata tsa moruo di bulwa, mmuso o tla itshetleha ka dikamano tse tiileng tsa setjhaba le bankakarolo ba baholo e le ho sebetsana le dintlha tsa sehlooho tsa kgonahalo ya kotsi dibakeng tsa tshebetso esita le kamano pakeng tsa basebetsi le setjhaba.

src_text: protocols and workplace plansas more sectors of the econ omy open, government will rely on social compacts with all key role players to address the key risk factors at the workplace and in the interface between employees and the public.
tgt_text: o re: "ka lebaka leo, re tla qetela melao e mengata ya mekga mme re tla batla hore khamphani ka nngwe e iketsetse moralo wa sebaka sa tshebetso pele e bula.

src_text: "we will therefore be finalising a number of sector protocols and will require every company to develop a workplace plan before they reopen," he says.
tgt_text: "ho ya ka meralo ena, dikhamphani di tla tshwanela ho hlwekisa, ho sebedisa dinyanyatsi tsa thibelo esita le ho hlokomela ho arohana ha batho esita le disebediswa, ba tla be ba hlwele basebetsi ha ba fihla mosebetsing ka letsatsi le letsatsi, ba behelle thoko ba nahanelwang hore ba tshwaeditswe mme ba etse ditlhophiso tsa hore ba etswe diteko.

src_text: according to these plans, companies will need to put in place sanitary and social distancing measures and facilities; they will need to screen workers on arrival each day, quarantine those who may be infected and make arrangements for them to be tested.
tgt_text: mopresidente o re: "ba bile ba loketse ho thusa ka ho fuputsa le ho fumana batho ba ileng ba kopana le basebetsi ba bona haeba basebetsi bana ba fumanwa ba na le tshwaetso.

src_text: "they also need to assist with contact tracing if employees test positive.
tgt_text: ka lebaka la bofokodi ba bona, batho ba nang le dilemo tse fetang 60 esita le bao ba nang le mafu a tshiretseng jwaloka malwetse a pelo, lefu la tswekere, malwetse a sa foleng kapele a phefumoloho esita le kankere, ba lokela hore ba hle ba mpe ba itulele lapeng.

src_text: because of their vulnerability, all staff who are older than 60 years of age and those who suffer from underlying conditions such as heart disease, diabetes, chronic respiratory disease and cancer should ideally stay at home," the president says.
tgt_text: "basebetsi ba ka sebeletsang lapeng ba lokela ho dumellwa ho etsa jwalo.

src_text: employees who can work from home should be allowed to do so.
tgt_text: ho ya ka dipehelo tsena, ditshebeletso tsohle tsa tlhahiso, merafo, kaho, ditshebeletso tsa ditjhelete, tsa seprofeshenale esita le tsa kgwebo, theknoloji ya dintlha tsa tsebo, dikgokahano, ditshebeletso tsa mmuso esita le ditshebeletso tsa bophatlalatsi di boetse di butswe ka la 1 phuptjane 2020. ho qala ka nepo esita le ho qala ka mekgahlelo ya ditlhophiso ho tla lokela ho sebetsa bakeng sa sebaka se seng le se seng sa tshebetso.

src_text: subject to these measures, all manufacturing, mining, construction, financial services, professional and business services, information technology, com munications, government services and media services, reopened from 1 june.
tgt_text: o re: "mabenkele a maholo a phepelo le a thekiso a tla bulwa ka botlalo, ho kenyeletswa le mabenkele, mabenkele a manyenyane a dispaza esita le baithekisetsi.

src_text: the appropriate restart and phasing in arrangements will need to be put in place for every workplace.
tgt_text: kgwebo ka dikgokahano tsa mehala e tla tswela pele e ntse e butswe.

src_text: "wholesale and retail trade will be fully opened, including stores, spaza shops and informal traders.
tgt_text: mekga e meng e butsweng esale pele, jwaloka temo le meru, disebediswa, ditshebeletso tsa bongaka, tlhahiso ya dijo esita le tlhahiso ya dihlahiswa tsa tlhokomelo ya bohlweki, di tla dula di butswe ka botlalo.

src_text: ecommerce will continue to remain open.
tgt_text: "mesebetsi ya kgwebo e nang le kgonahalo e phahameng ya kotsi ha e a dumellwamesebetsi ya kgwebo e nang le kgonahalo e phahameng ya kotsi ha e a dumellwa.

src_text: other sectors that opened previous ly, such as agriculture and forestry, utilities, medical services, food production and manufacture of hygiene products, will remain fully opened," he says.
tgt_text: mesebetsi ena e kenyeletsa: mabenkele a dijo, dibara le ditamene, ntle le ha ho tlisitswe kapa ho ilo latwa dijo.

src_text: highrisk economic activities prohibitedhighrisk economic activi ties will remain prohibited.
tgt_text: bodulo le maeto a difofane tsa lehae, ka ntle le ho tsamaya ka mabaka a mosebetsi, e leng tse tla kena ka matsatsi a tla bolelwa.

src_text: these include: restaurants, bars and taverns, except for delivery or collection of food.
tgt_text: diboka, diketsahalo, mesebetsi ya boithabiso le dipapadi.

src_text: accommodation and domestic air travel, except for business travel, which will be phased in on dates to be announced.
tgt_text: ditshebeletso tsa boitlhokomelo, ho kenyeletswa ho loha moriri le ditshebeletso tsa bointlafatso.

src_text: conferences, events, entertainment and sporting activities.
tgt_text: metsamao ya batho le thekiso ya tahibatho ba tla dumellwa ho etsa dihlakiso tsa mmele ka nako efe kapa efe nakong yohle ya letsatsi, haese ha di sa etswe ka dihlopha.

src_text: personal care services, including hairdressing and beauty services.
tgt_text: nako e itseng e baletsweng motsamao wa batho e tla fediswa.

src_text: movement of people and sale of alcoholpeople will be able to exer cise at any time during the day, provided this is not done in groups.
tgt_text: mopresidente o re: "tahi e ka rekiswa bakeng sa ho nwella feela lapeng ka tlasa maemo a ditaelo tse thata, ka matsatsi a itseng le ka dihora tse itseng.

src_text: the curfew on the movement of people will be lifted.
tgt_text: ditsebiso tsa sena di tla etswa hang ha re se re qetile ka dipuisano le mokga mabapi le maemo ana a fapaneng.

src_text: "alcohol may be sold for home consumption only under strict conditions, on specified days and for limited hours.
tgt_text: "thekiso ya dihlahiswa tsa kwae e tla dula e thibetswe mokgahlelong ona wa 3, ka lebaka la kotsi ya ho tsuba mmeleng.

src_text: announcements in this regard will be made once we have concluded discussions with the sector on the various conditions," the president says.
tgt_text: o re: "dikopano tsohle di tla dula di thibetswe, ntle le mapatong moo batho ba tlamehileng hore ba se ke ba feta palo ya 50 kapa dikopano tsa mesebetsi mererong ya mosebetsi.

src_text: the sale of tobacco products will remain prohibited in alert level 3, due to the health risks associated with smoking.
tgt_text: "lebella ho phahama ha ditshwaetsomopresidente ramaphosa o re, bakeng sa boitokisetso bakeng sa ho eketseha ho lebeletsweng ha ditshwaetso tsa covid19 ka hara naha, ekaba tsa dibethe tse 20 000 tsa dipetlele tse seng kapa tse ntseng di lokisetswa diketsahalo tsa tshwaetso ya covid19, le dipetlele tse hojana le moo batho ba dulang teng tse 27 di se dintse di ahwa ho potoloha naha.

src_text: "all gatherings will remain prohibited, except for funerals with no more than 50 people or meetings in the workplace for work purposes," he says.
tgt_text: "palo e kgolo ya dipetlele tsena e se e loketse bakudi ba kokwanahloko ya corona.

src_text: expect rise in infectionspresident ramaphosa says, in preparation for the expected increase in covid19 infections in the country, around 20 000 hospital beds have been, and are being, repurposed for covid19 cases, and 27 field hospitals are being built around the country.
tgt_text: "mopresidente o re mmuso o babatsa mosebetsi o ntseng o tswela pele ho etswa ke basebeletsi ba setjhaba, haholoholo bao ba leng moleng o ka pele twantshong ya covid19.

src_text: "a number of these hospitals are ready to receive coronavirus patients."
tgt_text: "polokeho ya basebetsi bohle, ho kenyeletswa le basebeletsi ba setjhaba, ke taba e re tshwenyang haholo.

src_text: the president says government appreciates the work that continues to be done by public servants, especially those in the front line in the fight against covid19.
tgt_text: re tla tswela pele ho etsa mekutu yohle bakeng sa ho fana ka thepa ya boitshireletso ba motho e le ho etsa bonnete ba polokeho ya motho e mong le e mong ha a le mosebetsing.

src_text: "the safety of all workers, including public servants, is a matter of concern to us.
tgt_text: "o re: "taba ya pele ya bohlokwa ho rona ke ho fokotsa menyetla bakeng sa ho fetisa kokwanahloko le ho theha tikoloho e bolokehileng bakeng sa motho e mong le e mong."

src_text: we will continue to make all efforts for the adequate provision of personal protection equipment to ensure safety for everyone while at work.
tgt_text: dikeletso tseo o lokelang ho di latela e le ho qoba ho tshwaetswa ke bolwetse ba kokwanahloko ya corona »dula lapeng haholo kamoo o ka kgonang ka teng.

src_text: "our priority is to reduce the opportunities for the transmission of the virus and create a safe environment for everyone," he says.
tgt_text: »hopola ho arohana, ho ema thokwana le batho ba bang.

src_text: tips to follow to avoid being infected by the coronavirus disease.
tgt_text: »ithwalle maske ya hao.

src_text: »stay at home as much as you can.
tgt_text: »hlatswa matsoho a hao ka sesepa ka botlalo.

src_text: »remember to social distance.
tgt_text: hlatswa bokahodimo ba matsoho a hao, pakeng tsa menwana le ka tlasa manala.

src_text: »wear your face mask.
tgt_text: kamehla hlatswa matsoho a hao ka sesepa pele o ja le kamora ho ba bathong.

src_text: »wash your hands with soap thoroughly.
tgt_text: »kwahela molomo wa hao ka thishu ha o kgohlela leha ho thimola.

src_text: wash the back of your hands, between the fingers and under the nails.
tgt_text: qoba ho tshwara sefahleho sa hao ka matsoho a ditshila ka nako tsohle.

src_text: always wash your hands with soap before you eat and after being out in public.
tgt_text: »batla thuso ya bongaka ha o ikutlwa o sa phela hantle.

src_text: »cover your mouth with a tissue paper when you cough and sneeze.
tgt_text: matshwao a tlwaelehileng a covid19 mmeleng a kenyeletsa ho kgohlela, nko e dutlang mamina, feberu le ho sokola ho phefumoloha.

src_text: avoid touching your face with dirty hands at all times.
tgt_text: haeba o na le a mang a matshwao ana, batla thuso ya bongaka ka potlako.

src_text: »seek medical help if you feel unwell.
tgt_text: bakeng sa dintlha tse ding tse ngatanyana letsetsa mohala o sebetsang bosiu le motshehare wa national institute of communicable disease ho 0800 029 999 kapa o hokele ho www.

src_text: if you are experiencing any of these symptoms, seek medical attention promptly.

tgt_text: afrika borwa e fetela mokgahlelong wa 3 vukuzenzele unnamed mopresidente cyril ramaphosa o phatlaladitse hore afrika borwa e fetetse mo kgahlelong wa 3 ho tloha ka la 1 phuptjane 2020 – mme dikarolo tse ngata tsa moruo di tla bula esita le ho fedisa dithibelo tse ngata tsa me tsamao ya batho.

src_text: sa youth are a source of inspiration and hope vukuzenzele unnamed the words of frantz fanon that ‘each generation must discover its mission’ come to mind every time i have an opportunity to speak with young south africans.
tgt_text: batjha ba afrika borwa ke mohlodi wa kgothatso le tshepo vukuzenzele unnamed ka dinako tsohle ha ke fumana monyetla wa ho bua le batjha ba maafrika borwa ke hopola mantswe a frantz fanon ha a re ‘moloko ka mong o tlameha ho utolla sepheo sa ona'.

src_text: no matter where they live and no matter what they do, they each have a burning desire to change the world.
tgt_text: ho sa natsehe hore na ba dula hokae le hore na ba etsa eng, batjha ka bomong ba na le tjheseho ya ho fetola lefatshe.

src_text: while they certainly want to improve their own lives, they also want to achieve a better society and a better world.
tgt_text: leha jwang kapa jwang ba batla hore ba ntlafatse maphelo a bona, ba boetse ba batla ho ﬁ hlella boemong ba setjhaba se betere le lefatshe le betere.

src_text: they see themselves as agents for fundamental transformation.
tgt_text: ba ipona e le bona balwanedi ba diphetoho tsa bohlokwa.

src_text: throughout history young people have been a driving force for change.
tgt_text: nalaneng yohle ya rona haesale batjha e le bona ba susumetsang diphetoho.

src_text: in just the last few decades, young people have waged numerous struggles against injustice, from the 1968 student uprising in paris, to the antiwar movement in the united states in the 1960s, to the anticolonial struggle in many african and asian countries, to the fight against apartheid, to the arab spring.
tgt_text: dilemong tse mashome a mmalwa tse fetileng, batjha ba ile ba lwana dintwa tse ngatanyana kgahlanong le tlhokeho ya toka, ho tloha boipelaetsong ba baithuti ba paris ka 1968, ho ya ntweng e kgahlanong le bokoloniale dinaheng tse ngata tsa afrika le asia, e be ntwa e kgahlanong le kgethollo, hammoho le mehwanto e kgahlanong le mebuso ya maarab.

src_text: most recently, young people have been at the forefront of the #blacklivesmatter movement that has gained global support in the wake of the killing of george floyd in the united states.
tgt_text: haufinyane, batjha ba ne ba di hula pele mohwantong wa #blacklivesmatter o fumaneng tshehetso lefatsheng lohle kamora ho bolauwa ha george floyd dinaheng tse kopaneng tsa amerika.

src_text: over the past few weeks, activists around the world have also been demanding the removal of symbols that glorify the barbarity and violence of the slave trade and colonialism.
tgt_text: dibekeng tse mmalwa tse fetileng, baitseki ba lefatshe ka bophara ba ne ba tseka hore ho tloswe matshwao a tlotlang bohanyapetsi le botlatlapi ba thekisetsano ya makgoba le bokoloniale.

src_text: at an oxford university demonstration recently a protestor carried a placard with the words ‘rhodes must fall’, the rallying cry of students in our own country five years ago.
tgt_text: dipontshong tsa nyatso tsa moraorao tsa yunivesithi ya oxford, moipelaetsi e mong o ne a tshwere polakathe e ngotsweng mantswe a reng ‘rhodes must fall’, e le ho tshehetsa seboko sa baithuti ba naheng ya habo rona sa dilemong tse hlano tse fetileng.

src_text: young people across the world have found common cause.
tgt_text: batjha ba fumane mabaka a tshwanang lefatsheng ka bophara.

src_text: they are tearing down statues and symbols of racism, demanding the decolonisation of educational curricula, and calling for institutions to address racism and social exclusion.
tgt_text: ba heletsa diemahale le matshwao a semorabe, e le ho tseka hore ho tloswe bokoloniale dikharikhulamong tsa thuto, ba bile ba etsa kgoeletso ditheong tsa thuto hore di rarolle bothata ba semorabe le ho kotelwa ha setjhaba se itseng.

src_text: and so, as we paid tribute to the generation of 1976 on 16 june 2020, we also salute the youth of postapartheid south africa, the worthy inheritors of this noble legacy.
tgt_text: jwale, ha re hlompha moloko wa 1976 ka la 16 phuptjane 2020, re boela re tlotla batjha ba kamorao ho puso ya kgethollo afrika borwa, bao e leng bona bajalefa ba bohlokwa ba lefa lena le kgabane.

src_text: the mission of 1976 generation was to dismantle bantu education; that of today’s youth is to take forward the project of national reconciliation and transformation.
tgt_text: sepheo sa moloko wa 1976 e ne e le ho fedisa thuto e neng e reretswe batho ba batsho feela; mme sepheo sa batjha ba kajeno ke ho ntshetsa pele letsema la naha la poelano le diphetoho tsa bohlokwa.

src_text: in time to come it will be said that this year, 2020, marked the start of a new epoch in human history.
tgt_text: mengwaheng e tlang ha ho buuwa ka selemo sena sa 2020, ho tla thwe e bile letshwao la qaleho ya sehla se setjha nalaneng ya botho.

src_text: not only has coronavirus had a momentous impact on people’s lives and livelihoods, it has also shaken up the global social order.
tgt_text: kokwanahloko ya corona ha e a thefula maphelo a batho le mesebetsi ya bona feela, empa e boetse e hlokotse botsitso ba kahisano ya lefatshe lohle.

src_text: the manner in which the pandemic has taken hold has been a reminder of the interconnectedness of the human race and of the deep inequalities that exist between countries and within countries.
tgt_text: mokgwa oo sewa sena se ropohileng ka wona ebile sehopotso sa ho amana ha batho bohle, le botebo ba ho se lekane ho teng dipakeng tsa dinaha tse fapaneng esita le kahare ho dinaha ka botsona.

src_text: the pandemic presents an opportunity to ‘reset’ a world that is characterised by crass materialism, selfishness and selfabsorption not just on the part of individuals but whole societies.
tgt_text: sewa sena se fana ka monyetla wa ho ‘hlophabotjha’ lefatshe lena le kgurumeditsweng ke bowatla ba maruo, boikgohomoso le boikakaso e seng lehlakoreng la batho ka bomong feela, empa le la ditjhaba tsohle.

src_text: young people are telling us that the essential values of integrity, compassion and solidarity must be the hallmarks of the new society that will emerge, and that they are determined to be the champions of this new, better world.
tgt_text: batjha ba re bolella hore makgabane a mantlha a seriti, kutlwelanobohloko le tshehetsano di tlameha ho ba matshwao a boitsebahatso a setjhaba se setjha se tla bitoha, mme bona ba ikemiseditse ho ba bopulamadiboho ba lefatshe leo le letjha le betere.

src_text: in the discussions i have had with young people i have said that we should never underestimate the power of an idea, because ideas can and have changed the world.
tgt_text: metshetshethong eo ke bileng le yona le batjha, ke ile ka re ha re a tshwanela ho hang ho nyatsa matla a maikutlo, hobane maikutlo a ka fetola ebile a se a kile a fetola lefatshe.

src_text: ideas have spurred human progress and they are what will enable us to chart a new path in the postcoronavirus era.
tgt_text: maikutlo a ne a susumetse kgatelopele ya batho mme ke ona a tla re thusa ho kutla tsela ya rona ka nqane ho sehla sa kokwanahloko ya corona.

src_text: these young people have turned their ideas into action.
tgt_text: batjha bana ba kgonne ho fetola maikutlo a bona hore e be diketsahalo.

src_text: they have not let a lack of resources hinder them.
tgt_text: ha ba a dumella kgaello ya mehlodi hore e ba sitise.

src_text: they have carved a niche for themselves in a number of sectors from hightech to environmental sustainability.
tgt_text: ba ikgahetse diqhobosheane makaleng a mangatanyana, ho tloha boitjarong ba nako e telele ho tsa theknoloji ya maemo a hodimo hammoho le tsa tikoloho.

src_text: now more than ever we will look to the innovative and pioneering spirit of our youth to come up with solutions to the unemployment crisis that benefit them, their communities and society.
tgt_text: mothating wa jwale, ho feta neng kapa neng, re tla lelaletsa mahlo a rona tjantjellong ya bosibolli le botshwarateu ba batjha ba habo rona hore ba tle le ditharollo dikoduweng tsena tsa leqeme la mesebetsi tse tla thusa bona, dibaka tsa habo bona esita le setjhaba sa habo bona.

src_text: at the same time, i challenge our country’s youth to craft and design programmes that will enable us to meet our developmental goals.
tgt_text: ka ho tshwanang, ke qholotsa batjha ba naha ya habo rona hore ba rale mananeo a tla re thusa ho ﬁ hlella dipheo tsa rona tsa dintshetsopele.

src_text: in 1961, revolutionary cuba sent legions of young student volunteers into the mountains and villages to construct schools, teach literacy and train new educators.
tgt_text: ka 1961, cuba e neng e fetotse puso e ile ya romela matshweletshwele a batjha ba baithuti ba baithaopi dithabeng le metsaneng hore ba ilo aha dikolo, ba ilo ruta ho bala le ho ngola ba be ba rupelle le dititjhere tse ntjha.

src_text: it is still held up as one of the most successful literacy campaigns in modern history.
tgt_text: le kajeno letsholo leo le ntse le nkuwa e le lona le atlehileng ka ho fetisisa matsholong a ho bala le ho ngola nalaneng ya moraorao.

src_text: our young people must develop social upliftment initiatives and they must lead them.
tgt_text: batjha ba habo rona ba tlameha ho ntshetsa pele mehato ya ntlafatso ba be ba e etelle pele.

src_text: just as they took up the struggle for equality in higher education, the considerable energies of our youth must also be brought to bear to fight for equitable access to health care, for the transformation of land ownership and, most importantly, for gender justice.
tgt_text: jwaloka ha ba ile ba e nkela matsohong a bona ntwa ya tekano thutong e phahameng, makgabane a mangatanyana a batjha ba habo rona a tlameha ho tataisetswa ho lwaneleng phihlello e lekanang tlhokomelong ya tsa bophelo bo botle, diphetohong tsa bohlokwa boithuelong ba mobu, esita le ya bohlokwahlokwa, e leng bakeng sa toka ya bong.

src_text: like all south africans, i have been deeply disturbed by a surge in the murder of young women at the hands of men.
tgt_text: jwaloka maafrika borwa a mang ohle, ke tshwenyehile haholo ke sekgahla sa diphenetho tsa basetsana ba fenethwang ke banna.

src_text: these are shocking acts of inhumanity that have no place in our society.
tgt_text: tsena ke diketso tse nyarosang tsa bosoto tse sa batleheng ho hang setjhabeng sa habo rona.

src_text: youthled civic activism, awareness raising and peer counselling are vital tools in our efforts to eradicate genderbased violence from society.
tgt_text: boitseki ba setjhaba bo etelletsweng pele ke batjha, ho etsa tlhokomediso le tlhabollano, ke disebediswa tsa bohlokwa mawaleng a rona a ho fedisa ditlhekefetso tse amanang le bong (gbv) setjhabeng sa habo rona.

src_text: at the same time, we must strengthen our justice system, ensuring that perpetrators are brought to book, bail and parole conditions are tightened and that those sentenced to life spend the rest of their lives behind bars.
tgt_text: ka ho tshwanang, re tlameha ho matlafatsa tsamaiso ya rona ya toka, re netefatse hore babolai ba a tshwarwa, ho be ho thatafatswe maemo a beili le parola, le hore bao ba ahloletsweng lefu ba qete dilemo tsohle tsa bophelo ba bona ba le tjhankaneng.

src_text: while this needs societywide action, i call on young men in particular to take up the struggle against genderbased violence.
tgt_text: leha taba ena e hloka hore setjhaba sohle se nke dikgato, ke etsa kgoeletso haholoholo ho bahlankana, hore ba e nkele ho bona ntwa e kgahlanong le gbv .

src_text: unless we end the war that is being waged against south african women, the dream of a new society will remain elusive.
tgt_text: ho ﬁ hlela re fedisa ntwa e latilweng letailana kgahlanong le basadi ba afrika borwa, tabatabelo ya rona ya hore ho be teng kahisano e ntjha e tla dula e le lelea.

src_text: those of us who were part of student movements during the apartheid era are often asked what we think of the young people of today.
tgt_text: bao ba rona ba neng ba le karolo ya mekgatlo ya baithuti nakong ya puso ya kgethollo, ba atisa ho botswa hore na ba nahana eng ka batjha ba kajeno.

src_text: there is a temptation to retreat into nostalgia about ‘the glory days’ of student politics and youth struggle, never to be replicated.
tgt_text: ho na le takatso ya hore eke ho ka kgutlelwa morao ‘matsatsing a tlotla’ ya dipolotiki tsa baithuti le ntwa ya batjha, empa tseo di ke ke tsa hlola di phetwa hape.

src_text: but just as the youth of yesteryear defined their mission, today’s youth have defined theirs.
tgt_text: empa he, jwaloka ha batjha ba maoba ba ile ba talola sepheo sa bona, le batjha ba kajeno ba talotse sa bona.

src_text: south african youth of 2020 more than meet the high standard set by their predecessors.
tgt_text: maemo a batjha ba afrika borwa ba 2020 a ka nqane ho maemo a hodimo a siilweng ke batjha ba tlileng pele ho bona.

src_text: they are optimistic, resilient and courageous, often in the face of the harshest of circumstances.
tgt_text: ba na le tshepo, ba matla ebile ba sebete, hangata ba tobana le maemo a boima ka ho fetisisa.

src_text: they are a source of inspiration and hope.
tgt_text: ke bona mohlodi wa kgothatso le tshepo.

src_text: through their actions, they are building a world that is more just, equal, sustainable and at peace.
tgt_text: ka diketso tsa bona, ba aha lefatshe le nang le toka e tomanyana, tekano, boitjaro ba nako e telele le bile le na le kgotso.

src_text: young people across the world are calling on institutions to stop racism and social exclusion.
tgt_text: batjha ba afrika borwa ke mohlodi wa kgothatso le tshepo vukuzenzele unnamed ka dinako tsohle ha ke fumana monyetla wa ho bua le batjha ba maafrika borwa ke hopola mantswe a frantz fanon ha a re ‘moloko ka mong o tlameha ho utolla sepheo sa ona'.

src_text: mom with comorbidity beats covid19 silusapho nyanda insaaf mohammed says it is very important for south africans, especially those with comorbidities, to take responsibility for their health.
tgt_text: mme ya nang le lefu la diqebo o hlola covid19 silusapho nyanda insaaf mohammed o re ho bohlokwa haholo hore maafrika borwa, haholoholo ao a nang le mafu a diqebo, a nke boikarabelo ka maphelo a bona.

src_text: people with comorbidities – such as asthma, hypertension, chronic kidney disease and diabetes – could experi ence more severe coro navirus (covid19) symptoms, and may even die as a result of the strain the virus puts on their bodies.
tgt_text: batho ba nang le mafu a diqebo a kang letshweya, kgatello e hodimo ya madi, lefu la diphio le sa foleng le lefu la tswekere, ba ka nna ba ba le matshwao a kokwanahloko ya corona (covid19) a mpefetseng le ho feta, ebile ba ka nna ba shwa ka lebaka la kgatello eo kokwanahloko ena e e etsang mebeleng ya bona.

src_text: fortunately, when cape townbased occupational therapist and mother of three insaaf mohammed (40) tested positive for covid19 while ill with asthma, she was able to manage both conditions and did not become seriously ill. mohammed contracted covid19 from her husband, who works at the groote schuur hospital’s laboratory.
tgt_text: ka lehlohonolo, ha mohlabolli wa motse kapa eo e leng mme wa bana ba bararo insaaf mohammed (40) a fumana sephetho sa diteko se re o na le covid19 mme e le motho ya kulang ke letshweya, o ile a kgona ho laola maemo ao ka bobedi ba ona mme a se ke a kula haholo.

src_text: mohammed’s sevenyearold son also tested positive.
tgt_text: mohammed o fumane tshwaetso ya covid19 monneng wa hae, ya sebetsang laboratoring ya sepetlele sa groote schuur.

src_text: after testing positive, all three selfisolated at home.
tgt_text: mora wa mahommed ya dilemo di supileng le yena diteko di mo fumane a tshwaetsehile.

src_text: "we selfisolated in our bedroom, while my motherinlaw – who has diabetes and hypertension and thankfully didn’t contract the virus – took care of our other two children," says mohammed.
tgt_text: kamora hore diteko di ba fumane ba tshwaetsehile, ba ile ba itsheka thajana ka boraro ba bona lapeng.

src_text: according to the western cape department of health, people with hypertension, diabetes and chronic kidney disease are among the most common comorbidity sufferers of covid19.
tgt_text: "re ile ra itsheka thajana ka phaposing ya rona ya ho robala, ha ka ho le leng mme matsale wa ka, ya nang le lefu la tswekere le kgatello e hodimo ya madi empa ka lehlohonolo ha a ka a tshwaetseha ke kokwanahloko ena, o ile a hlokomela bana ba bang ba rona ba babedi," ho rialo mohammed.

src_text: as of 25 may, people with the following comorbidities showed serious symptoms of covid19; hypertension, 58 percent diabetes, 56 percent chronic kidney disease, 17 percent hiv , 16 percent asthma or chronic respiratory disease, 15 percent cardiac disease, 11 percent obesity, 13 percent tb, 13 percent cancer, two percent other chronic illnesses, 16 percent.
tgt_text: ho ya ka lefapha la bophelo bo botle la kapa bophirimela, batho ba nang le kgatello e hodimo ya madi, lefu la tswekere le lefu la diphio le sa foleng, ke ba bang ba bakudi ba nang le mafu a diqebo ba tlwaelehileng ka ho fetisisa ho covid19.

src_text: mohammed says her worst fear was experiencing serious respiratory complications from covid19.
tgt_text: ho tloha mohla la 25 motsheanong, batho ba nang le mafu a diqebo a latelang ba bontshitse matshwao a mpefetseng: kgatello e hodimo ya madi, ke 58% lefu la tswekere, ke 56% lefu la diphio le sa foleng, ke 17% hiv , ke 16% letshweya kapa lefu le sa foleng le amanang le ho phefumoloha, ke 15% lefu la pelo, ke 11% botenya bo fetisisang, ke 13% lefuba, ke 13% mofetshe, ke 2% mafu a mang a diqebo, ke 16%.

src_text: "i experienced tiredness, coughing and tightness of the chest, which my asthma pump resolved.
tgt_text: mohammed o re ntho eo a neng a e tshaba ka ho fetisisa e ne e le ya ho thatafallwa ke ho phefumoloha ka lebaka la covid19.

src_text: my symptoms were not as severe as my husband’s, who had body aches, nausea, a tight chest, shortness of breath, blocked sinuses, thick phlegm on his chest and a fever.
tgt_text: "ke ile ka ba le mokgathala, ka hohlola ka ba ka bipetsana sefuba, e leng mathata a ileng a rarollwa ke peipi ya ka ya letshweya.

src_text: my son had a fever for three days, but recovered quite fast once he overcame his symptoms," she says.
tgt_text: matshwao a ka a ne a se mabe jwaloka a monna wa ka, ya neng a opelwa ke mmele, a nyekelwa ke pelo, a bipetsane sefuba, a fellwa ke moya, a kwalehile dinko, a na le leleta ka sefubeng esita le feberu.

src_text: mohammed’s family had been following protocols at work and home, to avoid contracting the virus.
tgt_text: mora wa ka yena o bile le feberu ka matsatsi a mararo, empa a hlaphohelwa ka potlako hang ha a se a hlotse matshwao ana," o rialo.

src_text: "my family was understanding, caring and supportive, and brought us supper every evening, but sometimes your community can be uncaring and the harm caused on social media is scary," says mohammed.
tgt_text: ba lelapa la mahommed ba ne ba tsitlallela ditsamaiso tsohle tsa bohlweki ha ba le mosebetsing le lapeng, e le ho qoba ho tshwaetseha ke kokwanahloko ena.

src_text: the western cape department of health says that keeping hydrated and monitoring your blood glucose, blood pressure and temperature are key to managing covid19, especially for patients with comorbidities.
tgt_text: "ba leloko ba ne ba utlwisisa, mme ba re tsotella ba bile ba re tshehetsa, ebile ba ne ba re tlisetsa selallo phirimaneng enngwe le enngwe, empa ka dinako tse ding setjhaba sa heno se ka nka dintho hanyane mme tshenyo e etswang ho marangrang a dikgokahano tsa setjhaba e a tshosa," ho rialo mohammed.

src_text: in addition, the department advises people with comorbidities to: take medication correct ly, as prescribed by your healthcare practitioner.
tgt_text: lefapha la bophelo bo botle la kapa bophirimela le re ho nwa metsi a lekaneng le ho alosa tswekere e mading, kgatello ya madi le motjheso ke dintho tsa bohlokwa taolong ya covid19, haholoholo bakuding ba nang le mafu a diqebo.

src_text: wash your hands with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, before you touch any medication.
tgt_text: ho eketsa moo, lefapha le eletsa batho ba nang le mafu a diqebo: ho nwa dipidisi le meriana ka nepo, jwaloka ha o laetswe ke ngaka.

src_text: do not stop taking medication unless a healthcare practitioner tells you to and never share medication with anyone.
tgt_text: ho hatlela matsoho a hao kgafetsa ka sesepa le metsi ka metsotswana e 20 bonnyane, pele o tshwara dipidisi kapa meriana.

src_text: try to do physical exercise for 30 minutes a day.
tgt_text: ho se tlohele ho nwa dipidisi le meriana, ntle le ha ngaka e o laela jwalo, mme o se ke wa arolelana dipidisi le meriana le mang kapa mang.

src_text: the department says that people with diabetes face a higher chance of experiencing serious complications from covid19, but the risk of getting very sick is lower if one’s diabetes is well managed.
tgt_text: ho leka ho kwetlisa mmele ka metsotso e 30 ka letsatsi.

src_text: "in general, people with diabetes are more likely to experience severe symptoms and complications when infected with a virus.
tgt_text: lefapha le re batho ba nang le lefu la tswekere ba kotsing e kgolo ya ho ba le matshwao a mpefetseng a covid19, empa kotsi ya hore ba kule haholo e a fokola haeba lefu la bona la tswekere le le taolong e ntle.

src_text: as diabetic individuals are at increased risk of severe covid19, ongoing social or physical distancing is recommended where possible.
tgt_text: "ka kakaretso, batho ba nang le lefu la tswekere ke bona ba kotsing e kgolo ya ho ba le matshwao a mpefetseng haeba ba tshwaetsehile ke kokwanahloko ena.

src_text: being overweight is also a risk factor for severe covid19.
tgt_text: jwaloka ha batho ba nang le lefu la tswekere ba le kotsing e kgolo ya covid19 e mpefetseng, ho kgothalletswa hore ba tsitlallele ho qaqolohana le batho ba bang moo ho kgonehang.

src_text: weight loss, if possible, is therefore recommended.
tgt_text: ho nona haholo ke enngwe ntho e kotsi bakeng sa covid19 e mpefetseng.

src_text: "clean bill of healthafter being in isolation for 14 days, mohammed returned to work.
tgt_text: ho kgothalletswa hore ho fokotswe mmele, haeba ho kgoneha.

src_text: she says recovering from the virus changed her thought processes and perspective on life.
tgt_text: "bopaki ba ho phela hantlekamora boitsheko ba matsatsi a 14, mohammed o ile a kgutlela mosebetsing.

src_text: "you appreciate your family and the small things in life even more.
tgt_text: o re ho hlaphohelwa kokwanahlokong ena ho ile ha fetola mokgwa oo a nahanang ka wona le oo a shebang bophelo ka wona.

src_text: i want people in any working environment to take responsibility for their health and to educate their families and children, especially now that kids are back at school.
tgt_text: "o bo bona hantle le ho feta bohlokwa ba lelapa la hao esita le dintho tse nyane bophelong.

src_text: "help your child find creative ways to show affection to their friends, without going close and touching each other.
tgt_text: ke batla hore batho ba tikolohong efe kapa efe ya mosebetsing ba nke boikarabelo ka maphelo a bona ba be ba rute ba malapa a bona le bana, haholoholo nakong ena hobane bana ba kgutletse dikolong.

src_text: get your family to sterilise themselves before entering the home, leave your shoes in the garage if you can, take all your clothes off and shower before greeting your family and be more health conscious to protect them," she says.
tgt_text: "thusa ngwana wa hao hore a fumane mekgwa e hlamaselang ya ho bontsha mosa metswalleng ya hae, ntle le ho atamelana kapa ho thetsana le bona.

src_text: the department advises people with comorbidities to eat healthily, get regular exercise, manage their stress, adhere to their medical treatment plan and follow all necessary preventative measures.
tgt_text: kgothalletsa ba lelapa la hao ho bolaya dikokwanahloko pele ba kena ka tlung, siya dieta ka karatjhe haeba o kgona, hlobola diaparo tsohle mme o itlhatswe pele o dumedisa ba lelapa la hao mme o be sedi le ho feta e le ho ba tshireletsa," o rialo.

src_text: insaaf mohammed who suffers from asthma, has beaten covid19.
tgt_text: lefapha le kgothalletsa batho ba nang le mafu a diqebo hore ba je dijo tse nang le phepo e ntle, ba ikwetlise kgafetsa, ba laole dikgatello tsa bona maikutlo, ba tsitlallele tshebediso ya dipidisi le meriana ya bona ka nepo, ba be ba ipapise le mehato yohle e hlokehang ya boipaballo.

src_text: if you are showing any symptoms, such as a fever, cough, or shortness of breath, contact the covid19 hotline on 0800 029 999 or whatsapp the word ‘hi’ to 0600 123 456.
tgt_text: mme ya nang le lefu la diqebo o hlola covid19 silusapho nyanda insaaf mohammed o re ho bohlokwa haholo hore maafrika borwa, haholoholo ao a nang le mafu a diqebo, a nke boikarabelo ka maphelo a bona.

src_text: a special tribute to our healthcare vukuzenzele unnamed the number of deaths from coronavirus recently passed the 2000 mark.
tgt_text: tlotlo e kgethehileng ho basebetsi ba habo rona ba tlhokomelo ya bophelo bo botle vukuzenzele unnamed lenane la batho ba bolailweng ke kokwanahloko ya corona le sa tswa feta ho 2 000. ho bao ba hlokahetseng, ho teng basebetsi ba tlhokomelo ya bophelo bo botle, le baporofeshenale ba tswileng matsoho ba neng ba hlokomela bakudi, bao e neng e le batshehetsi le batshedisi ho bao ba dipetlele ba tshekilweng ho ba malapa a bona.

src_text: among those who have lost their lives are healthcare workers, consummate professionals who cared for the ill, and were a support and comfort to those in hospital isolated from their families.
