tgt_text: taba ya hore banna le basadi ba sebetsang mosebetsi ona o babatsehang ba qetella ba kula ba be ba shwe, ke ntho e thefulang haholo.

src_text: that the men and women carrying out this most noble and sacred of duties are themselves falling ill and dying is a devastating blow.
tgt_text: ke bona ba tshwereng teu twantshong ya sewa sena.

src_text: they are on the frontline of fighting this pandemic.
tgt_text: ba sebetsa tlasa kgatello e kgolo ba bile ba tlameha le ho jara morwalo o boima maikutlong a bona, morwalo wa ho tseba hore ba kotsing ya ho tshwaetswa ke kokwanahloko ena.

src_text: they are working under great pressure and must carry the psychological strain of knowing they are at risk of contracting the virus.
tgt_text: ba fela e le bahale ba sebele lepatlelong la twantsho ya kokwanahloko ena ya corona .

src_text: they are the true heroes and heroines of our battle against coronavirus.
tgt_text: re a rolela kgaebana maafrika borwa a sebete a siyang metse ya ona, ba malapa le baratuwa ba bona e le hore ba ilo itlaleha mesebetsing kamehla ditleliniking, dipetlele le ditsing tse ding tsa kokelo ntle le tikatiko.

src_text: we salute these brave south africans who leave their homes, families and loved ones to report without fail for duty every day in clinics, hospitals and other health facilities.
tgt_text: dibakeng tseo ba sebetsang ho tsona ba fana ka tlhokomelo ya bongaka, tshehetso ya botsamaisi le ditshebeletso tse ding tse kang tsa tlhwekiso le mepheo.

src_text: there they provide medical care, administrative support and other services like cleaning and catering.
tgt_text: jwaloka ha ba phetha mesebetsi ya diporofeshene tsa bona, le rona re na le boikarabelo ba rona ho bona le ba malapa a bona.

src_text: just as they perform what is their professional duty, we too have a duty to them and to their families.
tgt_text: bophelo ba bona le polokeho ya bona di tlameha ho bewa ka sehlohlolong.

src_text: their health and their safety must be paramount.
tgt_text: re a ba tlotla ebile re a ba tshehetsa e le banna le basadi ba bontshitseng hore ba ikemiseditse ho bea maphelo a bona kotsing ho etsetsa hore rona re phele.

src_text: we honour them and uphold them as the men and women who have demonstrated they are prepared to risk their lives so that we may live.
tgt_text: bakeng sa hore ba phethe mosebetsi ona wa bona o boimahadi, ba hloka tshehetso ya rona esita le tshireletso ka hore ba fuwe disebediswa tsa boitshireletso (dippe).

src_text: for them to do their herculean work they need our support as well as protection through the provision of personal protective equipment (ppe).
tgt_text: ka tshehetso ya letlole la tshe hetsano le dinyehelo tse tswang ho maafrika borwa a mangata ka bomong, dikgwebong, matloleng a ikemetseng le mebusong e meng, re kgonne ho reka dippe bakeng sa basebetsi bana ba sebete ba tshwereng teu.

src_text: with the support of the solidarity fund and donations from many individual south africans, businesses, foundations and other governments, we have been able to procure personal protective equipment for these brave frontline workers.
tgt_text: moo ho bileng le kgaello ya dippe, dipetlele tsa rona di phahametse mapoqo ho netefatsa hore di a fumaneha.

src_text: where there have been shortages of ppe our hospitals are urgently attending to ensuring that they are available.
tgt_text: re a tseba hore phihlello ya dippe ha se yona feela qholotso eo basebetsi ba habo rona ba bophelo bo botle ba tobaneng le yona.

src_text: we know that access to ppe is not the only challenge our healthcare workers face.
tgt_text: ditleliniki le dipetlele naha ka bophara di tobane le kgaello ya basebetsi.

src_text: across the country clinics and hospitals are facing staff shortages.
tgt_text: ho se ho ntse ho henahenanwa le bothata bona.

src_text: this problem is being attended to.
tgt_text: e le ho tshehetsa mosebetsi oo basebetsi ba habo rona ba tshwereng teu ba o etsang naha ka bophara, re romela matona le batlatsi ba matona seterekeng ka seng naheng ena hore ba ilo inwesa ka nkgo ka diqholotso tse qollehileng tse teng diterekeng tseo, esita le ho sebetsa le ba apesitsweng matla ho tsa bophelo bo botle diprovenseng.

src_text: to support the work that our frontline workers are performing around the country we are deploying ministers and deputy ministers to each of the districts in the country to get a line of sight of specific challenges in these districts and to work with provincial health authorities.
tgt_text: re tshwanela ho sebetsa mmo ho hore re tshireletse bophelo bo botle e seng ba basebetsi ba habo rona ba tshwereng teu feela, empa ba basebetsi ka kakaretso.

src_text: we need to work together to safeguard the health of not just our frontline workers but the entire workforce.
tgt_text: ho se ho e na le mosebetsi o kgabane o entsweng ke mekgatlo ya basebetsi, wa ho ruta ditho tsa yona ka taolo ya kokwanahloko ena le thibelo ya yona le bohlweki.

src_text: there has already been sterling work done by unions in educating members around infection control and prevention and hygiene.
tgt_text: mekgatlo ena e boetse e tshehetsa mosebetsi wa lefapha la kgiro le bosebetsi ho phetheng bohlahlobi dibakeng tsa tshebetso, e le ho netefatsa hore ditsamaiso tsa bophelo bo botle le polokeho di kentswe tshebetsong molemong wa basebetsi ba kgutlelang mesebetsing.

src_text: they are also supporting the work of the department of employment and labour in conducting workplace inspections to ensure health and safety protocols are in place for returning workers.
tgt_text: boholo ba mekgatlo ya basebetsi bo boetse bo fana ka lesedi le amanang le kokwanahloko ya corona ho ditho tsa yona, athe le basebetsi le bona ba etsa matsholo a tlhokomediso.

src_text: many of our trade unions are also providing coronavirus information to their members and employers are running awareness campaigns.
tgt_text: enngwe ya diqholotso tse ropohileng naheng ya rona ke ya ho bewa sepha ha batho ba nang le tshwaetso ya kokwanahloko ya corona .

src_text: one of the challenges that has emerged in our country is the stigmatisation of people who have proven positive with coronavirus.
tgt_text: re le setjhaba re na le boikarabelo ka kopanelo, ba ho fedisa ho bewa sepha ha batho ba tshwaetsehileng ke kokwanahloko ya corona .

src_text: as a society, we have a collective responsibility to stamp out the stig matisation of people infected with the coronavirus.
tgt_text: ho bile le ditlaleho tse nyarosang tsa batho ba hoboswang dibakeng tseo ba dulang ho tsona, esita le tsa setjhaba se ipelaetsang kgahlanong le bakudi ba kokwanahloko ya corona ba amohelwang dipetleleng le ditleliniking.

src_text: there have been disturbing reports of individuals being ostracised from their communities and of communities protesting against coronavirus patients being admitted to local hospitals and clinics.
tgt_text: ntho ena e tlameha ho fela.

src_text: this must stop.
tgt_text: jwaloka ha re ile ra ipopa ngatana nngwe ho kgothaletsa kamohelo ya batho ba nang le hiv ra ba ra lomahanya meno kgahlanong le hore batho ba etswe diphofu, re tshwanela ho bontsha kutlwisiso, mamello, mosa le kutlwelanobohloko ho bao ba tshwaetsehileng ke kokwanahloko ena le bakeng sa malapa a bona.

src_text: just as we came together to promote acceptance of people living with hiv and stood firm against victimisation, we must show understanding, tolerance, kindness, empathy and compassion for those who are infected with this virus and for their families.
tgt_text: ho utlwisa bohloko ho tseba hore taba ena ya ho bewa sepha e susumetswa ke tshabo ya ho tshwaetswa ke lefu lena esita le ke kgaello ya kutlwisiso.

src_text: it is said that this stigmatisation is driven by fear of con tracting the disease and lack of understanding.
tgt_text: mokgwa o motle ka ho fetisisa wa ho fenya tlholeho ya rona ya ho tshaba mafu le ditshwaetso, ke ho ikobela ditsamaiso tse teng tsa bohlweki.

src_text: the best way to overcome our instinctive fear of illness and contagion is to observe the hygiene protocols that are in place.
tgt_text: tshabo ya tshwaetso e na le mabaka a utlwahalang ebile ke nnete.

src_text: the fear of infection is wellfounded and real.
tgt_text: ka ho tshwanang, re tseba seo re tshwanelang ho se etsa hore re itshireletse re be re sireletse le ba bang.

src_text: at the same time, we know what we have to do to protect ourselves and others.
tgt_text: re a tseba hore na kokwanahloko ena e bakwa ke eng, esita le seo re ka se etsang ho itshireletsa hore re se ke ra tshwaetseha.

src_text: we know what causes the virus and what we can do to protect ourselves from becoming infected.
tgt_text: re a tseba hore re tshwanela ho dula re qaqolohane re le batho, le hore re itsheke thajana haeba re ile ra atamelana le bao ba tshwaetsehileng esita le hore re itlalehe dipetlele haeba re na le matshwao.

src_text: we know we have to maintain social distancing, to selfisolate if we have come into contact with those infected and to present to a hospital if we have symptoms.
tgt_text: re tlameha hore re nne re tswele pele ho tataiswa ke nnete, e seng ke hlokwana la tsela.

src_text: we must continue to be guided by facts and not rumours.
tgt_text: e fetile nako eo ka yona mang kapa mang a neng a ka re ha ho motho eo a mo tsebang ya tshwaetsehileng kapa ya anngweng ke kokwanahloko ya corona .

src_text: the time when anyone could say they do not know anyone who is infected or affected by coronavirus has long passed.
tgt_text: mothating wa jwale, ho feta neng kapa neng pejana, metswalle ya rona, ba leloko, basebetsimmoho le baahisane, ba hloka kutlwelobohloko le tshehetso ya rona.

src_text: now, more than ever, our friends, families, colleagues and neighbours need our empathy and support.
tgt_text: matsatsing a tlang, dibekeng tse tlang le dikgweding tse tlang, ka dinako tse ding re tla iphumana re nyahame re bile re tshohile ha re ntse re bona manane a batho ba tshwaetsehang le ba shwang a ntse a tswelapele ho eketseha.

src_text: in the days, weeks and months that lie ahead, we will at times find ourselves despondent and fearful as we see the numbers of people infected and dying continue to rise.
tgt_text: ho ka nna ha etsahala hore jwale dintho di mpefetse le ho feta, empa re na le bonnete ba hore di tla boela di ntlafala.

src_text: it may be that things have gotten worse, but we are certain that they will get better.
tgt_text: baeletsi ba rona ba tsa saense le tsa bongaka ba re bolelletse hore sekgahla sa ditshwaetso se tla nyoloha ha re ntse re atamela qhoweng ya rona.

src_text: our scientists and medical advisers told us that the rate of infections will go up as we move towards our peak.
tgt_text: empa qetellong se tla boela se theoha.

src_text: but it will certainly come down.
tgt_text: re tlotla basebetsi ba tsa bophelo bo botle ba lahlehetsweng ke maphelo a bona ka lebaka la ho hlokomela bakudi.

src_text: we pay tribute to the healthcare workers who lost their lives caring for the sick.
tgt_text: e le ho ba hopola, ha re ipolokeng re be re boloke le baahi ba habo rona ka ho nka boikarabelo.

src_text: in their memory, let us keep ourselves and our fellow citizens safe by playing our part.
tgt_text: re tla e fenya kokwanahloko ena re be re se ahe botjha setjhaba sa habo rona.

src_text: we shall overcome this virus and rebuild our society.
tgt_text: re ile ra feta dinakong tsa lefifi la bonkantjana empa re ile ra di hlola.

src_text: we have seen darker times and we have prevailed.
tgt_text: tlotlo e kgethehileng ho basebetsi ba habo rona ba tlhokomelo ya bophelo bo botle vukuzenzele unnamed lenane la batho ba bolailweng ke kokwanahloko ya corona le sa tswa feta ho 2 000. ho bao ba hlokahetseng, ho teng basebetsi ba tlhokomelo ya bophelo bo botle, le baporofeshenale ba tswileng matsoho ba neng ba hlokomela bakudi, bao e neng e le batshehetsi le batshedisi ho bao ba dipetlele ba tshekilweng ho ba malapa a bona.

src_text: young farmer receives covid19 support vukuzenzele unnamed nomagcinandile suduka (27) is growing her family’s legacy and wealth by investing in agriculture.
tgt_text: motjha wa sehwai o fumana tshehetso ya covid19 silusapho nyanda sehwai se thuthuang sa kapa botjhabela ke e mong wa ba fotseng molemo letloleng la mmuso la kimollo ya kokwanahloko ya corona.

src_text: the o wner of 4 u and 4 me primary cooperative in mooiplaas village received support from the department of agriculture, land reform and rural development’s coronavirus (covid19) relief fund for her egg, livestock and vegetable farm.
tgt_text: nomagcinandile suduka (27) o hodisa lefa le maruo a habo ka ho itahlela ka setotswana temothuong.

src_text: the department has awarded r1.2 billion worth of vouchers to farmers in need.
tgt_text: monga 4 u and 4 me primary cooperative motsaneng wa mooiplaas o fumane tshehetso letloleng la kimollo ya kokwanahloko ya corona (covid19) la lefapha la temothuo, tlha bollo ya mobu le ntshetsopele ya mahae bakeng sa temothuo ya hae ya mahe, diphoofolo le meroho.

src_text: suduka says her vouchers will help her grow the egg producing side of her business.
tgt_text: lefapha le nanabeditse divaotjhara tsa boleng ba r1.2 bilione ho dihwai tse hlokang ka sebele.

src_text: "i received three vouchers totalling r19 000. a voucher for r12 000 to buy layer egg chickens, a voucher for r6 500 to buy feed and a r500 voucher to buy medicines.
tgt_text: suduka o re divaotjhara tsa hae di tla mo thusa ho hodisa karolo ya tlhahiso ya mahe kgwebong ya hae.

src_text: "she started her egg production farm by feeding her family’s traditional chickens with layer grower feed, which enables them to produce eggs without mating.
tgt_text: "ke fuwe divaotjhara tse tharo tse etsang r19 000 ha di kopane.

src_text: her chickens now produce 50 eggs a day, which she sells weekly.
tgt_text: ke vaotjhara ya r12 000 ya ho reka dikgoho tsa mahe tse 100, ebe vaotjhara ya r6 500 ya ho reka dijo tsa dikgoho le vaotjhara ya r500 ya ho reka meriana".

src_text: suduka, who also farms with 73 goats, 25 sheep and 25 cows, started farming in 2015 after obtaining a public management n6 certificate from ikhala training and vocational education and training college.
tgt_text: o qadile kgwebo ya hae ya tlhahiso ya mahe ka ho fepa dikgoho tsa habo tsa setho ka phepokgodiso e ntlafatsang ho behela, e di thusang hore di behele mahe le ha di sa kopana le mekoko.

src_text: after realising that there were not a lot of job opportunities out there, she decided to take over the family’s then subsistence farm and turn it into a profitable business.
tgt_text: dikgoho tsa hae tse 50 jwale di behela mahe a 50 ka letsatsi mme o a rekisa ka beke le beke.

src_text: suduka says: "we grew up practising farming, so after graduating i decided to farm rather than look for a job."
tgt_text: suduka, ya ruileng le dipodi tse 73, dinku tse 25 le dikgomo tse 25, o qadile thuo ena ya hae ka 2015 kamora ho phethela dithuto tsa public management n6 certificate kholejeng ya thupelo le thuto ya mesebetsi ya matsoho (tvet) ya ikhala.

src_text: this proved to be an inspired decision, as she has grown the number of goats and cows.
tgt_text: kamora ho elellwa hore ho na le leqeme la menyetla ya mesebetsi, o ile a qeta ka hore a nke temothuo ya habo ya ho jela hanong mme a e fetole hore e be kgwebo e nang le phaello.

src_text: suduka’s sixhectare vegetable farm produces maize, potatoes, peas and beans.
tgt_text: suduka o re: "re hotse re sebetsa mesebetsi ya temo thuo, kahoo, kamora ho qeta dithuto ke ile ka qeta ka hore ke kene temothuong ho e na le ho tsoma mosebetsi."

src_text: the maize is planted on four hectares, the potatoes on one hectare and the peas and beans share the last hectare.
tgt_text: ena e ile ya bonahala e le qeto e kgothatsang hobane jwale o se a ekeditse lenane la dipodi le la dikgomo.

src_text: suduka has learnt a lot from covid19, especially that her best assets are her hands and hard work.
tgt_text: polasi ya suduka ya dihekthara tse tsheletseng e hlahisa poone, ditapole, dierekisi le dinawa.

src_text: tips on how to start a garden: make sure you know which plants your soil will support.
tgt_text: poone e lengwa dihekthareng tse nne, ebe ditapole hekthareng e lenngwe mme dinawa le dierekisi di kopantswe hekthareng ya ho qetela.

src_text: ready your garden by first ploughing the land more than once without planting.
tgt_text: suduka o ithutile boholo ka covid19 , haholoholo ka hore matlotlo a hae a bohlokwahlokwa ke matsoho a hae esita le ho sebetsa ka thata .

src_text: add fertiliser.
tgt_text: motjha wa sehwai o fumana tshehetso ya covid19 silusapho nyanda sehwai se thuthuang sa kapa botjhabela ke e mong wa ba fotseng molemo letloleng la mmuso la kimollo ya kokwanahloko ya corona.

src_text: south africa acts to address ventilator shortage silusapho nyanda a locally developed ventilator will help patients with mild covid19 symptoms to breathe easier.
tgt_text: afrika borwa e nka dikgato tsa ho rarolla qaka ya kgaello ya dithusaphefumoloho silusapho nyanda sethusaphefumoloho se entsweng kwano lapeng se tla thusa bakudi ba nang le matshwao a fokolang a covid19 ho phefumoloha habobebe.

src_text: the fight against the coronavirus disease (covid19) in south africa has been boosted with the production of the first ventilator made in the country.
tgt_text: twantsho ya lefu la kokwanahloko ya corona (covid19) afrika borwa e matlafaditswe ke sethusaphefumoloho sa pele se entsweng kahara naha.

src_text: the continuous positive airway pressure (cpap) ventilator helps patients with mild symptoms of covid19 to breathe easier by providing a mild level of oxygenated air pressure to keep their airways open.
tgt_text: sethusaphefumoloho sa continuous positive airway pressure (cpap) se thusa bakudi ba nang le matshwao a fokolang a covid19 ho phefumoloha habobebe, ka ho fana ka kgatello e tlase ya moya o nang le oksijene e le ho boloka dipeipi tsa bona tsa moya di bulehile.

src_text: the ventilator was designed by the council for scientific and industrial research (csir) in collaboration with a number of local partners and will be rolled out nationwide to patients showing respiratory distress in the early phase of covid19 infection.
tgt_text: sethusaphefumoloho sena se radilwe ke lekgotla la diphuputso tsa saense le indasteri (csir) ka kopanelo le balekane ba bangatanyana ba kwano lapeng, mme se nanabetswa naha ka bophara ho bakudi ba bonahalang ba na le mathata a phefumoloho qalehong ya tshwaetso ya covid19.

src_text: "the air a person normally breaths has a 23 percent concentration of oxygen.
tgt_text: "moya oo ka tlwaelo motho a o phefumolohang o na le sekepele sa dipheresente tse 23 tsa oksijene.

src_text: the cpap ventilator can pump a higher amount of oxygen, helping a person breathe.
tgt_text: sethusaphefumoloho sa cpap se ka pompa sekepele se phahameng sa oksijene e le ho thusa motho hore a phefumolohe.

src_text: the cpap pumps continuous concentrated oxygen.
tgt_text: cpap e pompa motswako wa oksijene motjhaotjhele.

src_text: you can increase or decrease the amount of oxygen one is breathing in," says executive manager of csir future production: manufacturing martin sanne.
tgt_text: o ka eketsa kapa wa fokotsa sekgahla sa oksijene eo motho a e phefumolohang," ho rialo molaodi wa phethahatso wa tlhahiso ya kamoso ya csir: manufacturing martin sanne.

src_text: patients using the ventilator are connected via a face mask.
tgt_text: bakudi ba sebedisang sethusaphefumoloho ba hokahantswe ke sekwahelasefahleho.

src_text: oxygen is drawn from an oxygen gas tank and is mixed with natural air in the ventilator, from where it is transmitted to the mask and breathed in by the patient.
tgt_text: oksijene e hulwa tankeng ya gase ya oksijene mme e tswakwa le moya wa tlhaho o kahara sethusaphefumoloho ebe ho tloha moo e fetisetswa ho sekwahelasefahleho mme mokudi o e phefumolohelwa kahare.

src_text: sanne says that in addition to pumping oxygenated air, the cpap also helps patients exhale.
tgt_text: sanne o re kahodimo ho ho pompa moya o nang le oksijene, cpap e boela e thusa bakudi ho phefumolohela ka ntle.

src_text: the cpap device can be used in both hightech clinical environments and temporary settings, such as field hospitals and quarantine facilities.
tgt_text: "sesebediswa sa cpap se ka sebediswa ditikolohong tsa bongaka ba botekgeniki bo phahameng esita le dibakeng tsa nakwana, tse kang dipetlele tse thokwana le metse esita le ditsheng tsa tshekeho.

src_text: sanne says the csir will have produced 10 000 ventilators by the end of august.
tgt_text: sanne o re csir e tla be e se e hlahisitse dithusaphefumoloho tse 10 000 mafelong a phato.

src_text: working with siemens, simera, akacia, gabler, umoya and the university of cape town, the csir produced the cpap according to world health organisation standards.
tgt_text: ka ho sebedisana hammoho le siemens, simera, akacia, gabler, umoya le yunivesithi ya cape town, csir e hlahisitse cpap ho ya ka maemo a beilweng ke mokgatlo wa lefatshe wa bophelo bo botle.

src_text: the first batch of ventilators will be given to state hospitals experiencing pressure due to the unavailability of equipment to deal with covid19.
tgt_text: lefupe la pele la dithusaphefumoloho le tla abelwa dipetlele tsa mmuso tse nang le kgatello ka lebaka la kgaello ya disebediswa tsa ho lwantsha covid19.

src_text: the csir started working on the cpap after the world began experiencing an extreme shortage in ventilators.
tgt_text: csir e qadile ho sebetsana le cpap kamora hore lefatshe lohle le qale ho ba le kgaello e kgolo ya dithusaphefumoloho.

src_text: "around march and april, there suddenly became a short supply of ventilators from our international suppliers.
tgt_text: "e ne e ka ba nakong ya tlhakubele le mmesa moo ka tshohanyetso ho bileng le phepelo e fokolang ya dithusaphefumoloho ho tswa ho bafepedi ba rona ba matjhaba.

src_text: where you could get them, they were very expensive so government issued a tender for the production of ventilators," says sanne.
tgt_text: moo o neng o ka di fumana teng, di ne di le theko e phahameng haholo mme ka hona mmuso wa ntsha thendara ya tlhahiso ya dithusaphefumoloho," ho rialo sanne.

src_text: the tender was part of the government’s national ventilator project within the department of trade, industry and competition.
tgt_text: thendara e ne e le karolo ya projeke ya naha ya dithusaphefumoloho kahare ho lefapha la kgwebisano, indasteri le tlhodisano.

src_text: the csir is also working on a bilevel positive airway pressure ventilator aimed at helping patients with more severe symptoms of covid19.
tgt_text: csir e boetse e sebetsana le ho fumana sethusaphefumoloho sa bilevel positive airway pressure, se reretsweng ho thusa bakudi ba nang le matshwao a mpefetseng a covid19.

src_text: the ventilator will assist with both inhalation and exhalation, either in fixed pressure modes or by sensing the oxygen supply required by a patient and adjusting the pressure accordingly.
tgt_text: afrika borwa e nka dikgato tsa ho rarolla qaka ya kgaello ya dithusaphefumoloho silusapho nyanda sethusaphefumoloho se entsweng kwano lapeng se tla thusa bakudi ba nang le matshwao a fokolang a covid19 ho phefumoloha habobebe.

src_text: help stop the spread of covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed our nation is con fronted by the gravest crisis in the history of our democracy.
tgt_text: thusa ho thibela ho ata ha covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed setjhaba sa habo rona se hlahetswe ke koduwa e kgolo ka ho fetisisa nalaneng ya demokrasi ya rona.

src_text: for more than 120 days, we have succeeded in delaying the spread of a virus that is causing devastation across the globe.
tgt_text: ka matsatsi a kahodimo ho 120, re ile ra atleha ho diehisa ho ata ha kokwanahloko ena e bakang qomatsi lefatsheng lohle.

src_text: but now, the surge in infections that we had been advised by our medical experts would come, has arrived.
tgt_text: empa jwale nako ya ho eketseha ha ditshwaetso tseo re ileng ra eletswa ka tsona ke ditsebi tsa rona tsa bongaka hore e tla fihla, jwale e fihlile.

src_text: more than a quarter of a million south africans have been infected with coronavirus, and we know that many more infections have gone undetected.
tgt_text: maafrika borwa a kahodimo ho kotara ya milione a se a tshwaeditswe ke kokwanahloko ya corona, mme re a tseba le hore ditshwaetso tse ding tse ngata ha di a utollwa.

src_text: we are now recording over 12,000 new cases every day.
tgt_text: ha jwale re ba le ditshwaetso tse ntjha tse kahodimo ho 12 000 letsatsi le letsatsi.

src_text: since the start of the outbreak in march, at least 4,079 people have died from covid19.
tgt_text: haesale lefu lena le ne le qale ho ropoha ka tlhakubele, ke bonnyane ba batho ba 4 079 ba shweleng ka lebaka la covid19.

src_text: like the massive cold fronts that sweep into our country from the south atlantic at this time of year, there are few parts of the country that will remain untouched by the coronavirus.
tgt_text: jwaloka maqhubu a mangata a mohatsela a parolang naha ya rona a hlaha ka borwa ho atlantic nakong ena ya selemo, ho na le dikgutlwana tse mmalwa naheng ya rona tseo kokwanahloko ya corona e sa tlo fihla ho hang ho tsona.

src_text: the coronavirus storm is far fiercer and more destructive than any we have known before.
tgt_text: sefefo sa kokwanahloko ya corona se kotsi ebile se ruthutha le ho feta kokwanahloko efe kapa efe eo re kileng ra e tseba.

src_text: it is stretching our resources and our resolve to their limits.
tgt_text: e monyolla mehlodi le ditjhelete tsa rona ho isa moo di fellang teng.

src_text: the surge of infections that our experts and scientists predicted over 3 months ago has now arrived.
tgt_text: keketseho ya ditshwaetso tseo ditsebi le boramahlale ba rona ba ileng ba e lepa dikgweding tse kahodimo ho tse tharo tse fetileng, jwale e fihlile.

src_text: it started in the western cape and is now underway in the eastern cape and gauteng.
tgt_text: e qadile kapa bophirimela mme jwale e ntse e ata kapa botjhabela le gauteng.

src_text: yet, while infections rise exponentially, it is important to note that our case fatality rate of 1.5 percent is among the lowest in the world.
tgt_text: empa leha ditshwaetso di eketseha ka potlako hakaalo, ho bohlokwa ho tseba hore sekgahla sa ho shwa ha batho ba habo rona sa 1.5% ke se seng sa tse tlase ka ho fetisisa lefatsheng.

src_text: this is compared to a global average case fatality rate of 4.4 percent.
tgt_text: sena ke papisong le sekgahla se tlwaelehileng lefatsheng lohle sa 4.4% ya batho ba shwang.

src_text: we owe the relatively low number of deaths in our country to the experience and dedication of our health professionals and the urgent measures we have taken to build the capacity of our health system.
tgt_text: re na le palo ena e tlase ya mafu naheng ya rona ka lebaka la boiphihlelo le boikitlaetso ba diporofeshenale tsa rona tsa bophelo bo botle, esita le mehato ya tshohanyetso eo re e nkileng ho aha bokgoni ba tsamaiso ya rona ya bophelo bo botle.

src_text: even as most of our people have taken action to prevent the spread of the virus, there are others who have not.
tgt_text: leha boholo ba batho ba habo rona ba nkile dikgato tsa ho thibela ho ata ha kokwanahloko ena, ho na le ba bang ba sa itshwenyang ka ho etsa jwalo.

src_text: there are some among us who ignore the regulations that have been passed to combat the disease.
tgt_text: ho na le ba bang kahara rona mona ba sa natseng melawana e beilweng ya ho kgina lefu lena.

src_text: in the midst of such a pandemic, getting into a taxi without a face mask, gathering to meet friends, attending parties or even visiting family, can too easily spread the virus and cost lives.
tgt_text: setsiketsing sa sewa sena, ho kena ka tekesing ho sa kenngwa sekwahelanko le molomo, mmoka wa ho teana le metswalle, ho ya meketjaneng kapa hona ho etela ba leloko, ho ka akofisa ho ata ha kokwanahloko ena habobebe ho be ho fete le maphelo a batho.

src_text: this may be a disease that is caused by a virus, but it is spread by human conduct and behaviour.
tgt_text: lena e ka nna ya eba lefu leo sesosa sa lona e leng kokwanahloko, empa lona le ata ka lebaka la boitshwaro ba batho.

src_text: through our own actions – as individuals, as families, as communities – we can and we must change the course of this pandemic in our country.
tgt_text: ka diketso tsa rona, re le batho ka bomong, re le malapa, re le setjhaba, re ka kgona ebile re tlameha ho fetola ho ata ha sewa sena naheng ya rona.

src_text: we need to wear a cloth mask that covers our nose and mouth whenever we leave home.
tgt_text: re lokela ho rwala sekwahelanko le molomo sa lesela se kwahelang nko le molomo kgafetsa ha re tloha malapeng.

src_text: we must continue to regularly wash our hands with soap and water or sanitiser.
tgt_text: re lokela ho tswela pele ho hatlela matsoho a rona ka metsi le sesepa kapa ka sebolayadikokwanahloko kgafetsa .

src_text: we must continue to clean and sanitise all surfaces in all public spaces.
tgt_text: re tlameha ho tswela pele ho hlwekisa le ho nyanyatsa bokahodimo ba dibaka tsohle, dibakeng tsohle tseo ho phetheselang setjhaba ho tsona.

src_text: most importantly, we must keep a safe distance – of at least 2 metres – from other people.
tgt_text: taba ya bohlokwa ka ho fetisisa ke ya hore re tlameha ho siya sebaka se bolokehileng sa bonyane ba dimithara tse pedi dipakeng tsa rona le batho ba bang.

src_text: there is now emerging evidence that the virus may also be carried in tiny particles in the air in places that are crowded, closed or have poor air circulation.
tgt_text: jwale ho na le bopaki bo botjha ba hore kokwanahloko ena e ka nna ya fetiswa ka dikarolwana tse nyenyane haholo tse moyeng dibakeng tseo ho tsona ho subuhlellaneng batho, tse kwalehileng kapa tse nang le lephallo le fokolang la moya.

src_text: for this reason we must immediately improve the indoor environment of public places where the risk of infection is greatest.
tgt_text: ka lebaka lena, re tlameha ho ntlafatsa bokahare ba tikoloho ya dibaka tse phetheselang batho, moo kotsi ya tshwaetso e leng kgolo ka ho fetisisa.

src_text: our decision to declare a nationwide lockdown prevented a massive early surge of infections when our health services were less prepared, which would have resulted in a far greater loss of lives.
tgt_text: qeto ya rona ya ho phatlalatsa ho kginwa ha metsamao ya batho le ditshebeletso tseo e seng tsa mantlha naha ka bophara, e ile ya thibela sekgahla se hodimo sa keketseho ya ditshwaetso di sa tloha ha ditshebeletso tsa rona tsa bophelo bo botle di ne di so loke hantle, e leng ntho e neng e ka baka ho shwa ha batho ba bangata le ho feta.

src_text: in the time that we had, we have taken important measures to strengthen our health response.
tgt_text: ka nako eo re bileng le yona, re nkile mehato ya bohlokwa ya ho matlafatsa karabelo ya rona mabapi le bophelo bo botle.

src_text: we have conducted more than two million coronavirus tests and community health workers have done more than 20 million screenings.
tgt_text: re se re entse diteko tsa kokwanahloko ya corona tse kahodimo ho dimilione tse pedi mme basebeletsi ba setjhaba ba tsa bophelo bo botle ba se ba entse ditlhahlobo tse kahodimo ho dimilione tse 20. re fumane dibethe tse ka bang 28 000 tsa dipetlele bakeng sa bakudi ba covid19 ra ba ra aha dipetlele tse sebetsang tse thokwana le metse ho pharalla le naha.

src_text: we have made available almost 28,000 hospital beds for covid19 patients and have constructed functional field hospitals across the country.
tgt_text: jwale re na le dibethe tsa tshekeho tse kahodimo ho 37 000 ditsing tsa kokelo tsa poraefete esita le tsa setjhaba ho pharalla le naha, mme di malalaalaotswe ho tsheka bao ba sa kgoneng ho itsheka malapeng a bona.

src_text: we now have over 37,000 quarantine beds in private and public facilities across the country, ready to isolate those who cannot do so at home.
tgt_text: re ile ra fumana ra ba ra fana ka dimilione tsa thepa ya boitshireletso dipetleleng, ditleliniking le dikolong ho pharalla le naha ho basebetsi ba habo rona ba tshwereng teu.

src_text: we have procured and delivered millions of items of personal protective equipment to hospitals, clinics and schools across the country to protect our frontline workers.
tgt_text: re thaothile ebile re ntse re tswela pele ho thaotha baoki ba tlatsetso, dingaka le basebetsi ba ditshebeletso tsa tshohanyetso tsa bophelo bo botle.

src_text: we have recruited and continue to recruit additional nurses, doctors and emergency health personnel.
tgt_text: re tswela pele ho etsa kgatelopele mekutung ya rona ya ho lwantsha covid 19, empa phephetso ya rona e kgolo e sa ntse e tla.

src_text: we continue to make progress in our efforts to deal with covid 19, but our greatest challenge still lies ahead.
tgt_text: diprovenseng tsohle, re sebeletsa hore re boele re eketse lenane la diphaposi tse akaretsang tsa bakudi esita le hore dibethe tsa bohlokwa di fumanehe bakeng sa bakudi ba covid19.

src_text: across all provinces, we are working to further increase the number of general ward and critical beds available for covid19 patients.
tgt_text: bokgoni ba diphaposi tsa bakudi bo ekeditswe dipetleleng tse ngata ka hore ho diehiswe tlhokomelo e sa potlakang hakaalo, le ho fetola dikarolo tse ding tsa sepetlele hore e be diphaposi tse ding tsa bakudi esita le ho aha kapa ho atolosa dipetlele tse thokwana le metse.

src_text: ward capacity is being freed up in a number of hospitals by delaying nonurgent care, the conversion of some areas of hospitals into additional ward space and the erection or expansion of field hospitals.
tgt_text: re sebetsana le ho eketsa phepelo ya oksijene, ya dithusaphefumoloho le thepa e nngwe bakeng sa bao ba tla hloka tlhokomelo e hlokolotsi, ho akga le ya ho faposwa ha phepelo ya oksijene e reretsweng mabaka a mang.

src_text: we are working to increase supplies of oxygen, ventilators and other equipment for those who will need critical care, including by diverting the supply of oxygen from other purposes.
tgt_text: re sebedisa mekgwa ya theknoloji ya dijithale ho matlafatsa boitsebahatso, ho fofonela le ho kgethela ba ileng ba atamelana le batshwaetsuwa, esita le hona ho fana ka tshehetso ho bao diteko di reng ba fela ba na le tshwaetso.

src_text: we are deploying digital technologies to strengthen the identification, tracing and isolation of contacts, and to provide support to those who test positive.
tgt_text: ha e le mona re atamela sehlohlolong sa ditshwaetso, re lokela ho ba sedi haholo re be re tiise mehato e seng e le teng ya ho sisithehisa sekgahla sa tshwaetsano.

src_text: as we now approach the peak of infections, we need to take extra precautions and tighten existing measures to slow down the rate of transmission.
tgt_text: melawana ya ho kenya dikwahelanko le molomo e tla matlafatswa.

src_text: regulations on the wearing of masks will be strengthened.
tgt_text: bahiri, beng ba mabenkele le baokamedi, balaodi ba dipalangwang tsa setjhaba, le baokamedi kapa beng ba moaho ofe kapa ofe oo ho phetheselang setjhaba ho ona, jwale ba tlangwa ke molao hore ba etse bonnete ba hore mang kapa mang ya kenang meahong kapa makoloing a bona, o tlameha ho kenya sekwahelanko le molomo.

src_text: employers, shop owners and managers, public transport operators, and managers and owners of any other public building are now legally obliged to ensure that anyone entering their premises or vehicle must be wearing a mask.
tgt_text: ditekesi tse potolohang haufinyane jwale di tla dumellwa ho eketsa sekepele sa bapalami hore di tlale tswete, ha ditekesi tsa maeto a malelele tsona di sa tlo dumellwa ho palamisa bapalami ba kahodimo ho lenane le etsang 70%, ha feela ho latelwa ditsamaiso tse ntjha tsa thibelo ya kotsi tse amanang le dikwahelanko le molomo, ho nyanyatsa makoloi ka dibolayadikokwanahloko le ho bula difenstere.

src_text: taxis undertaking local trips will now be permitted to increase their capacity to 100 percent, while long distance taxis will not be allowed to exceed 70 percent occupancy, on condition that new risk mitigation protocols related to masks, vehicle sanitising and open windows are followed.
tgt_text: jwale ho na le bopaki bo totobetseng ba hore ho bulelwa ha thekiso ya jwala ho bakile kgatello e matla dipetleleng, ho kenyeletswa le diyuniting tsa dikotsi le tsa ba kulang haholo tsa icu, ka lebaka la dikotsi tsa makoloi, dikgoka le dikotsi tse amanang le tseo.

src_text: there is now clear evidence that the resumption of alcohol sales has resulted in substantial pressure being put on hospitals, including trauma and icu units, due to motor vehicle accidents, violence and related trauma.
tgt_text: kahoo re entse qeto ya hore, hore re boloke bokgoni ba dipetlele, thekiso, le thomello le kanetso ya jwala e tla kwalwa hanghang.

src_text: we have therefore decided that in order to conserve hospital capacity, the sale, dispensing and distribution of alcohol will be suspended with immediate effect.
tgt_text: e le mohato o ekeditsweng wa ho fokotsa kgatello dipetleleng, ho tla ba le thibelo ya motsamao dipakeng tsa hora ya borobong bosiu le hora ya bone hoseng.

src_text: as an additional measure to reduce the pressure on hospitals, a curfew will be put in place between the hours of 9pm and 4am.
tgt_text: re nka mehato ena re tseba hantle hore e qobella dithibelo tse sa amohelehang maphelong a batho.

src_text: we are taking these measures fully aware that they impose unwelcome restrictions on people’s lives.
tgt_text: empa leha ho le jwalo, mehato ena e a hlokeha hore re ipone re fetile sehlohlolong sa lefu lena.

src_text: they are, however, necessary to see us through the peak of the disease.
tgt_text: ha ho kamoo re ka se qobang kateng sefefo sena sa kokwanahloko ya corona.

src_text: there is no way that we can avoid the coronavirus storm.
tgt_text: empa re ka e fokotsa tshenyo eo se ka e bakang maphelong a rona.

src_text: but we can limit the damage that it can cause to our lives.
tgt_text: re le setjhaba re ikentse kgokanyana phiri ka sepheo sa ho tshehetsana, ho tshedisa bao ba kulang esita le ho kgothaletsa kamohelo ya batho ba seng ba tshwaeditswe ke kokwanahloko ena.

src_text: as a nation we have come together to support each other, to provide comfort to those who are ill and to promote acceptance of people living with the virus.
tgt_text: hona jwale, ho feta neng kapa neng, re na le boikarabelo ka maphelo a bao ba mathokong a rona.

src_text: now, more than ever, we are responsible for the lives of those around us.
tgt_text: re tla atleha ho a hlola maemo ana a boima.

src_text: we will weather this storm.
tgt_text: re tla kgutlisetsa naha ya habo rona bophelong bo botle le katlehong.

src_text: we will restore our country to health and to prosperity.
tgt_text: thusa ho thibela ho ata ha covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed setjhaba sa habo rona se hlahetswe ke koduwa e kgolo ka ho fetisisa nalaneng ya demokrasi ya rona.

src_text: celebrating women through economic inclusion vukuzenzele unnamed in august south africa celebrates women’s month.
tgt_text: re keteka basadi ka kenyeletso re keteka basadi ka kenyeletso ya bona moruongya bona moruong vukuzenzele unnamed ka phato afrika borwa e keteteka kgwedi ya basadi.

src_text: this occasion marks the anniversary of the day in 1956 when 20,000 women marched to the union buildings – a great sea of womankind speaking many languages, from different places and of all races.
tgt_text: keteko ena e tshwaya sehopotso sa letsatsi la 1956 ha basadi ba 20 000 ba ne ba hwanta mane union buildings – phallo e kgolokgolo ya batho ba basadi ba neng ba bua dipuo tse fapaneng, ba tswa dibakeng tse fapaneng mme e le ba merabe e fapaneng.

src_text: they were united in their demand for an end to the dreaded pass laws and for their right to live in freedom.
tgt_text: ba ile ba kopana boitsekong ba bona ba ho fedisa melao ya dipasa e nyarosang le ho fumana tokelo ya bona ya ho phela tokolohong.

src_text: the status and position of women in south africa today is vastly different to that faced by our mothers and grandmothers in 1956. we have come a long way in realising a south africa that is nonracial, nonsexist, democratic, prosperous and free.
tgt_text: boemo le maemo a basadiafrika borwa kajeno a se a fapane haholo ha o a bapisa le ao a neng a tobane le bomme le bonkgono ba rona ka 1956. re tswa hole hore re fihlelle afrika borwa e hlokang kgethollo ya merabe, kgethollo ya bong, e nang le demokrasi, e nang le katleho mme e lokolohile.

src_text: there has been real progress in improving the lives of south african women in the economy, in the political sphere and in public life.
tgt_text: ho bile le kgatelopele ya nnete ntlafatsong ya maphelo a basadi ba afrika borwa moruong, lekaleng la dipolotiki le phedisanong ya setjhaba.

src_text: at the same time, we know there is so much further we still have to go.
tgt_text: le ha ho ntse ho le jwalo, re a tseba hore ho ntse ho ena le tse ngata tseo re tlamehang ho di fihlella.

src_text: women still face discrimination, harassment and violence, and bear the greatest brunt of poverty.
tgt_text: basadi ba ntse ba tobana le kgethollo, tlhekefetso le ho ketekwa, mme ke bona ba futsanehileng ka ho fetisisa.

src_text: if we are to truly realise the promise of our constitution we have to tackle the economic and financial exclusion that makes women more vulnerable to abuse and violence.
tgt_text: haeba ka nnete re batla fihlella tshepiso ya molaotheo wa rona re tlameha ho lwantshana le dikgato tse etsang hore basadi ba se kgone ho iketsetsa lekeno le dijthelete e leng tsona etseng hore basadi ba iphumane ba mamelletse tlhekefetso ho ketekwa.

src_text: we have joined a groundbreaking campaign that links us to global efforts to achieve gender equality by 2030. generation equality is an ambitious and transformative agenda to end discrimination and violence against women and for their equal participation in political, social and economic life.
tgt_text: re kene letsholong le itlhommeng pele le re kopantshang le maiteko a matjhabeng a ho fihlella tekatekano ya bong ka 2030. tekatekano ya moloko ke tabatabelo le phethoho ya ajenda ya ho fedisa kgethollo le dikgoka kgahlano le basadi le ho ba le seabo se tshwanang dipolotiking, le maphelong a bona le moruong.

src_text: as part of this campaign, we have joined two ‘action coalitions’, one for economic justice and rights and another against genderbased violence.
tgt_text: jwalo ka karolo ya letsholo lena, re kopantshitse ‘diketso tsa tshebedisano’ tse pedi, ya pele e leng ya tokoloho ya moruo le ditokelo mme enngwe ke e kgahlano le dikgoka ho basadi (gbv).

src_text: both of these themes are critical to our own national agenda.
tgt_text: bobedi mekotaba ena e hlokolotsi ho ajenda ya naha ya rona.

src_text: eleven months since the emergency response action plan to combat genderbased violence and femicide was implemented we have made progress in expanding support and care to survivors, and progress is being made in legal reforms to afford them greater protection.
tgt_text: dikgwedi tse 11 esale re phethahaditse moralo wa ketso tsa karabelo ya tshohanyetso ho lwantsha dikgoka tsa bong le dipolao tsa basadi (gbvf) re se re bile le kgatelopele ho atoloseng tshehetso le ho tsotella mahlatsipa, mme kgatelopele e entsweng ho tsa tlhabollo ya molao e ba nehela tshireletso e ngata haholo.

src_text: during the month of august, we begin the implementation of the national strategic plan to combat genderbased violence and femicide.
tgt_text: kgwedi ya phato, re qala ka phethahatso ya moralo wa lewa la naha la ho lwantsha gbvf.

src_text: a key aspect of the plan is on ensuring greater women’s financial inclusion.
tgt_text: ntlha e ka sehlohlolong ya moralo ona ke ho netefatsa hore basadi ba bangata ba kenyeletswa boholo mo moruo.

src_text: this is because economic inequality and social inequality are interconnected.
tgt_text: sena ke hobane tlhokeho ya tekatekano ya moruo le tlhokeho ya tekatekano ya phedisano di a nyallana.

src_text: the economic status of women in south africa makes them more vulnerable to abuse.
tgt_text: maemo a ditjhelete a basadi afrika borwa a ba beha kotsing e kgolokgolo ya tlhekefetso.

src_text: we must therefore scale up support for women to enable them to become financially independent.
tgt_text: ka hoo, re tlameha ho tshehetsa basadi ho etsa hore ba kgone ho ikemela le ho iketsetsa tjhelete ya bona.

src_text: we have made a number of commitments under generation equality that will be given effect to through the national strategic plan.
tgt_text: re entse boitlamo bo mmalwa tlasa tekatekano ya moloko e tla phethahatswang ka moralo wa lewa la naha.

src_text: firstly, we are going to drive women’s economic inclusion through public procurement.
tgt_text: ya pele, re tlo kenyeletsa seabo sa basadi moruong ka diphu mantsho tsa mmuso.

src_text: we have set the target of ensuring that at least 40 percent of goods and services procured by public entities are sourced from womenowned businesses.
tgt_text: re entse boipehelo ba ho netefatsa hore bonyane 40% ya dihlahiswa le ditshebeletso tse fumantshwang ke dikgwebo tsa mmuso di tswa dikgwebong tsa basadi.

src_text: secondly, we are going to scale up support for womenowned smmes and for women who work in the informal sector or are unemployed.
tgt_text: ya bobedi, re tlo eketsa tshehetso ya dikgwebo tse nyanyane, tse bohareng le tse kgolo (dismme) tse laolwang ke basadi mmoho le dikgwebo tse thuthuhang tse laolwang ke basadi kapa tsa basadi ba sa sebetseng.

src_text: this will include engagement with the financial sector to make financial services accessible and affordable for women.
tgt_text: hona ho tla kenyeletsa dipuisano le lekala la ditjhelete ho etsa hore ditshebeletso tsa ditjhelete di fumanehe ha bobebe ka theko e tlase ho basadi.

src_text: thirdly, we want to ensure more women have access to productive assets such as land.
tgt_text: ya boraro, re batla ho netefatsa hore basadi ba bangata ba fumana thepa ya bohlokwa e jwalo ka lefatshe.

src_text: it is essential that women are beneficiaries of the accelerate land reform programme.
tgt_text: ho bohlokwa hore basadi ba fumane molemo ho tswa potlakisong ya ho kgutlisetswa lefatshe.

src_text: it is significant that of the r75 million in covid19 relief earmarked for farming input vouchers 53 percent of the beneficiaries will be rural women.
tgt_text: ho tshwanehile hore karolo ya r75 milione ya divaotjhara tsa matlole a dithuso a covid19 a tshwaetsweng tlhahiso ya temo 53% e be molemong wa basadi ba mahaeng.

src_text: we must ensure that women subsistence and smallscale farmers continue to receive support beyond the pandemic.
tgt_text: re tlameha ho netefatsa hore tshehetso ya basadi le rapolasi/mmapolasi ba ithuthuhang ba tswella ho fumantshwa tshehetso le ka mora sewa sena.

src_text: fourthly, we want to ensure that women are protected from genderbased violence in the workplace.
tgt_text: ya bone, re batla ho netefatsa hore basadi ba tshireletsehile kgahlano le gbv mesebetsing.

src_text: in this regard, we will be working at a national and regional level towards the ratification of the ilo convention on violence and harassment in the workplace.
tgt_text: ntlheng ena, re tla tswella ho sebetsa boemong ba naha le lebatowa ho tshwaela monwana seboka sa mokgatlo wa matjhaba (ilo) wa mosebetsi sadikgako le tlhekefetso mesebetsing.

src_text: it is said that freedom is not given, but taken.
tgt_text: ho thwe tokoloho ha e nehelwe, e ya nkwa.

src_text: the emancipation of women is only words on paper unless it is matched by commitment from all sectors of society.
tgt_text: tokollo ya basadi ke mantswe feela a pampering ntle le haeba e tsamaelana le boitlamo bo tswang ho makala ohle a setjhaba.

src_text: as we prepare for the reconstruction of our economy in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic, we have said that we cannot simply return to where we were before the outbreak of the virus.
tgt_text: ha re itukisetsa kahobotjha ya moruo wa rona hara sewa sa kokwanahloko ya corona , re itse ha ho sa kgonanahale hore re ka kgutlela setlwaeding sa pele kokwanahloko e phahlalla.

src_text: we must build a fundamentally different economy which, among other things, substantially improves the material position of women.
tgt_text: re tlameha ho theha moruo o motheo wa ona o fapaneng ka, ho tse ding tsa dintho, ho ntlafatsa boemo ba leruo la basadi.

src_text: this means that our investment in infrastructure must support not only the development of local industry, but also womenowned businesses.
tgt_text: hona ho bolela hore botsetedi ba moralo wa motheo bo tlameha ho tshehetsa eseng feela ntshetsopele ya indastri ya lehae, empa le dikgwebo tsa basadi.

src_text: it must deliberately create employment opportunities for women in all stages of planning, financing, building and maintaining infrastructure.
tgt_text: e tlameha ho ikemisetsa ho theha menyetla ya mesebetsi molemong wa basadi mekgahlelong kaofela ya ho rala, ya ditjhelete, ya kaho le ya ho disa meralo ya motheo.

src_text: by the same measures, as we scale up our public employment programmes, we must ensure that young women in particular are identified as participants.
tgt_text: ka mekgwa e tshwanang, re tla phahamisa mananeo a rona a khiro makaleng a mmuso, re tlameha ho netefatsa hore boholo ba dikgarabe e ba tsona tse thongwang.. hodima lekeno, mananeo ana a tla ba nehela monyetla wa ho fumana boitsebelo le boiphihlelo bo hlokehang ho kena moruong wa sehlohlolo.

src_text: in addition to an income, these programmes will provide them with an opportunity to acquire some of the skills and experience necessary to enter the mainstream economy.
tgt_text: le ha feela e le maikarabelo a mmuso ho nehela ka menyetla ya moruo ho basadi ho theha leano la tshebetso le tla bakang hore ho ntlafatswe tekatekano ya bong, bohle setjhabeng ba tlameha ho bapala karolo ya bona.

src_text: as much as it is government’s responsibility to provide economic opportunities for women and create an enabling framework for advancing gender equality, everyone in society needs to play their part.
tgt_text: dikgwebo di tlameha ho tshehetsa dikgwebo tsa basadi ka ho reka dihlahiswa le ditshebeletso dikgwebong tsa bona.

src_text: businesses must support womenowned enterprises in the procurement of goods and services.
tgt_text: ba tlameha ho hira basadi ba bangata le ho thonya basadi ba bangata maemong a bolaodi.

src_text: they should employ more women and appoint more women to management positions.
tgt_text: sena se bohlokwa haholoholo ha o sheba direkoto tsa lekala la poraefete boemong ba kemedi ya bong e saletseng morao ha o bapisa le lekala la mmuso.

src_text: this is all the more important considering that the private sector’s record on genderrepresentation at management level lags behind that of the public sector.
tgt_text: bona ke bothata bo hlahellang kgafetsa dipuisanong tseo ke bileng le tsona le boholo ba mekgatlo ya dikgwebo tsa basadi.

src_text: this is an issue that is repeatedly raised in engagements i have had with a number of women’s business organisations.
tgt_text: hore ho be le tekatekano re tshwanetse ho fedisa setlwaedi sa mekgolo e e sa lekalekaneng ho ya ka hore motho ke monna kapa mosadi, mme re itlwaetse ho lefa batho ba entseng mosebetsi o tshwanang ka ho lekalekana jwalo ka ho totobaditswe molaong wa tekatekano ya mese betsing.

src_text: by equal measure, we must eliminate gender disparities in pay for men and women, and give effect to the principle of equal pay for equal work contained in the employment equity act.
tgt_text: basadi ba tlameha ho tshireletswa kgahlano le tlhekefetso le kgethollo mosebetsing.

src_text: women must also be protected from harassment and discrimination in the workplace.
tgt_text: ke boikarabelo ba batsamaisi ba dipalangwang, ba tsamaiso ya diyunivesithi, makgotla a taolo ya dikolo le mekgatlo ya tumelo ho theha maemo a tshireletsehileng molemong wa basadi le bananyana ha ba le maetong, dithutong le dikerekeng.

src_text: it is up to transport operators, university administrators, school governing bodies and religious organisations to create conditions for women and girls to travel, study and worship in safety.
tgt_text: re tlameha ho hatelapele ka maiteko a rona a ho qeta kgatello ka banna, kgethollo ya basadi le ho fa banna maemo a ho ba dihloho.

src_text: we must forge ahead with our efforts to eradicate chauvinism, sexism and patriarchy.
tgt_text: ke mehopolo ena e bakang kgatello ya basadi.

src_text: it is these attitudes that enable the oppression of women.
tgt_text: ho ho rona – banna le basadi bobedi – ho netefatsa hore boleng ba mosadi, boemo le maikutlo a hae ha a ka tlase ho a monna.

src_text: it is up to us – both men and women – to affirm that a woman’s value, position and opinions are no less than that of a man.
tgt_text: ke boikarabelo ba rona jwalo ka batswadi le bonkgono le bontatemoholo ho tshwarwa le ho hodisa bara le baradi ka mokgwa o tshwanang.

src_text: it is up to us as parents and grandparents to treat and raise our sons and our daughters the same.
tgt_text: ho ho rona jwalo ka banna ho hana le ho bua kgahlano le diketso tsa gbv moo re di bonang, le haeba ke kgahlano le metswalle, bontate le boabuti ba rona.

src_text: it is up to us as men to reject and speak out against genderbased violence wherever we see it, even if it is against our friends, fathers or brothers.
tgt_text: ha re beng moloko o tla fedisang kgatello ya basadi ka tsela efe kapa efe, nakong ya rona.

src_text: let us be the generation that ends the oppression of women in all its forms, in our lifetime.
tgt_text: moloko wa 1956 o ile wa itseka molemong wa rona bohle.

src_text: the brave generation of 1956 marched for us all.
tgt_text: re keteka basadi ka kenyeletso re keteka basadi ka kenyeletso ya bona moruongya bona moruong vukuzenzele unnamed ka phato afrika borwa e keteteka kgwedi ya basadi.

src_text: back to work after covid19 a full guide allison cooper when can you return to work if you have tested positive for the coronavirus (covid19)?
tgt_text: ho kgutlela mosebetsing ka mora ho tshwarwa ke covid19 allison cooper ka kgutlela mosebetsing neng ka mora ho tshwarwa ke kokwanahloko ya corona (covid19)?

src_text: the national institute for communicable diseases has the answers you need.
tgt_text: institjhuti ya naha ya mahlo ko a tshwaetsanang e na le dikarabo tseo o di hlokang.

src_text: when i test positive for covid19, how long do i have to stay in isolation?
tgt_text: ha ke fumana sephetho se ha ke fumana sephetho se reng ke na le reng ke na le covid19covid19 , ke , ke tlamahe ho dula boikgethotlamahe ho dula boikgethollong nako e kae?

src_text: people who test positive for covid19, but don’t have any symptoms, must remain in isolation at home or in a government isolation facility for 10 days, from the day they receive their positive test result.
tgt_text: llong nako e kae?

src_text: those who have mild symptoms must remain in isolation at home or in a government isolation facility for 10 days, from the day their symptoms start.
tgt_text: batho ba fumanang sephetho se reng ba na le covid19 , empa ba sena matshwao ho hang, ba tlameha ho dula boikgethollong lapeng kapa ditsing tsa boikge thollo tsa mmuso ka matsatsi a 10, ho tloha ka letsatsi leo ba fumaneng sephetho sa bona se reng ba tshwaetsehile.

src_text: those who have severe disease, who have to go to hospital, must remain in isolation for 10 days, from when they are stable and don’t need oxygen anymore.
tgt_text: bao ba nang le matshwao mahareng ba tlameha ho tswella ho dula boikgethollong lapeng kapa setsing sa boikgethollo ba mmuso ka matsatsi a 10, ho tloha ka letsatsi leo matshwao a bona a qalang ho bonahala.

src_text: how can a covid19 positive people transfer the disease to others?
tgt_text: bao ba nang le tshwaetso e mpehadi, ba tlamehang ho ya sepetlele, ba tlameha ho dula boikgethollong ka matsatsi a 10, ho tloha ha ba se ba ena le botsitsa mme ba se ba sa hloke ho fepelwa oksejene.

src_text: according to health minister zweli mkhize, most people who have a mild infection can spread the virus for between seven to 12 days.
tgt_text: batho ba nang le batho ba nang le covid19covid19 ba ka tshwaetsa ba bang ka ba ka tshwaetsa ba bang ka lefu lena jwang?

src_text: however, people who become very sick could be infectious and be able to transmit the virus to others for a longer period of time.
tgt_text: lefu lena jwang?

src_text: do i have to have another covid19 test, proving that i am negative, before i return to work?
tgt_text: ho ya ka letona la bophelo bo botle ngaka zweli mkhize, boholo ba batho ba nang le tshwaetso e mahareng ba ka atisa kokwanahloko dipakeng tsa matsatsi a supileng ho ya ho a 12. empa, batho ba kulang haholo ba ka tshwaetsa ba bang le ho kgona ho fetisetsa kokwanahloko ho ba bang ka nako e telele.

src_text: no.
tgt_text: na ke tlameha ho etsa teko na ke tlameha ho etsa teko enngwe hape ya enngwe hape ya covid19covid19 , , ho bontsha hore ha ke sana ho bontsha hore ha ke sana tshwaetso, pele nka kgutlela tshwaetso, pele nka kgutlela mosebetsing?

src_text: retesting people who have experienced mild illness and have recovered is not recommended.
tgt_text: mosebetsing?

src_text: a person is considered safe to return to work and come out of isolation if they are no longer infectious.
tgt_text: tjhe.

src_text: this means they developed their first symptoms more than 10 days ago and have not had any symptoms for at least three days.
tgt_text: ho hlahloba lekgehlo la bobedi batho ba neng ba ena le bohloko bo mahareng mme ba fodile ha ho kgothaletswe.

src_text: in most cases, employees can return to work without testing again if: they have completed 10 days of mandatory quarantine or selfisolation.
tgt_text: motho o nkwa a bolokelehile ho kgutlela mosebetsing le ho tswa boikgethollong haeba a se a sena tshwaetso.

src_text: those who had moderate or severe symptoms undergo a medical evaluation.
tgt_text: hona ho bolela hore ba bile le matshwao a bona a pele matsatsing a fetang a 10 a fetileng mme ha ba soka ba eba le matshwao afe kapa afe ka matsatsi a mararo bonyane.

src_text: they continue to practice personal hygiene and social distancing.
tgt_text: boholo ba nako, basebetsi ba ka kgutlela mosebetsing ntle le ho etsa diteko lekgehlo la bobedi haeba: ba phethetse matsatsi a 10 a setlamo a khwarantine kapa a boikgethollo.

src_text: the employer monitors the worker to ensure they do not regress.
tgt_text: bao ba bileng le matshwao a mahareng kapa a mpehadi mme ba kena tlasa tekolo ya bongaka.

src_text: they wear a mask, from the date of diagnosis for at least 21 days.
tgt_text: ba tswella ho ikamantsha le boitlhwekiso le ho sielana sebaka.

src_text: i have tested negative but i still have symptoms.
tgt_text: bahiri ba beha mosebetsi leihlo ho netefatsa hore ha ba kule hape.

src_text: what now?
tgt_text: ba rwala maske, ho tloha ka letsatsi la ho etsa diteko ho fihla matsatsi a 21 bonyane.

src_text: it is possible to get a false negative test result.
tgt_text: sephetho sa diteko tsa ka ha sephetho sa diteko tsa ka ha sena tshwaetso empa ke ntse sena tshwaetso empa ke ntse ke ena le matshwao.

src_text: this means that your first test could be negative, but you could test positive at a later stage.
tgt_text: jwale ho ke ena le matshwao.

src_text: if you continue to have covid19 symptoms contact your healthcare professional.
tgt_text: jwale ho etswa jwang?

src_text: what if i am still showing symptoms after 10 days?
tgt_text: etswa jwang?

src_text: it is common for patients to continue to have symptoms for longer than 10 days.
tgt_text: ho na le kgonahalo ya hore o fumane sephetho sa diteko se fosahetseng se senangtshwaetso.

src_text: full recovery may take several weeks.
tgt_text: hona ho bolela hore sephetho sa hao sa pele se ka tla se sena tshwaetso, empa ha mmamora sephetho sa tla se ena le tshwaetso.

src_text: if you still have symptoms, seek advice from your healthcare professional.
tgt_text: haeba o ka tswella ho bontsha matshwao a covid19 ikopantshe le mosebetsi wa tlhokomelo ya bophelo bo botle.

src_text: for more information about covid19, visit the national institute for communicable diseases’ website at www.
tgt_text: jwale haeba ke ntse ke jwale haeba ke ntse ke bontsha matshwao ka morabontsha matshwao ka moramatsatsi a 10?

src_text: nicd.
tgt_text: matsatsi a 10?

src_text: ac.
tgt_text: ho tlwaelehile hore bakudi ba tswelle ho bontsha matshwao ka mora matsatsi a fetang 10. ho fola ka phethahalo ho ka nka dibeke tse mmalwa.

src_text: za, the covid19 free website at coronavirus.
tgt_text: haeba o ntse o ena le matshwao, kopa keletso ho mosebetsi wa tlhokomelo ya bophelo bo botle.

src_text: datafree.
tgt_text: mabapi le tlhahisoleseding e batsi ka covid19 , etela websaete ya institjhuti ya naha ya mahloko a tshwaetsanang howww.

src_text: co, call the covid19 hotline number at 0800 029 999 or send a whatsapp to 0600 12 3456.
tgt_text: ho kgutlela mosebetsing ka mora ho tshwarwa ke covid19 allison cooper ka kgutlela mosebetsing neng ka mora ho tshwarwa ke kokwanahloko ya corona (covid19)?

src_text: let’s keep each other safe vukuzenzele unnamed our country has moved to alert level 2 in our response to the coronavirus pandemic.
tgt_text: ha re bolokaneng vukuzenzele unnamed naha ya bo rona e se e fetetse mo hatong wa bobedi wa tlhokomediso karabe long ya rona ho sewa sa kokwanahloko ya corona .

src_text: this has come as a relief to all south africans who have had to live under stringent restrictions for the last five months.
tgt_text: sena se tlile e le kimollo ho maafrika borwa ka ofela a neng a tshwanela ho phela tlasa dithibelo tse matla bakeng sa dikgwedi tse tsheletseng tse fetileng.

src_text: it is a sign of the progress we are making in reducing new infections and demand on our health facilities.
tgt_text: ke letshwao la kgatelopele eo re e etsang mabapi le ho fokotsa ditshwaetso tse ntjha le boima hodima ditsha tsa rona tsa kalafo.

src_text: it is also a very important development as we strive to restart our economy.
tgt_text: e boetse ke ntshetsopele ya bohlokwa jwaloka ha re tsitlallela ho qala botjha moruo wa rona.

src_text: but it is too soon to celebrate.
tgt_text: feela e sa le hoseng hore re ka keteka.

src_text: we are still very much in the middle of a deadly pandemic that has taken over 11,000 lives in south africa alone.
tgt_text: re ntse re le mahareng haholo a sewa sena se bolayang se seng se fetile ka maphelo a fetang 11 000 ka hara afrika borwa feela.

src_text: at more than half a million confirmed cases, we still have the fifth highest number of infections in the world.
tgt_text: re iphumana re na le di tlaleho tse etsang halofo ya milione tse tiiseditsweng, re ntse re na le ditshwaetso tse maemong a bohlano tse phahameng ka ho fetisisa lefatsheng.

src_text: and there is always a chance of a resurgence of the disease.
tgt_text: ho ntse ho na le monyetla wa hore lefu lena le ropohe botjha.

src_text: if we ever need a stark reminder of the need for vigilance, we should look to recent events thousands of kilometres away in new zealand.
tgt_text: haeba re batla se re hopo tsang ka botlalo hore re lokele ho fadimeha, ke hore re shebe se etsahetseng dikilomithara tse dikete hole le rona e leng naheng ya new zealand.

src_text: three months since the country was declared coronavirusfree, new zealand is once again under lockdown.
tgt_text: dikgwedi tse tharo esale naha eo e tsebahatsa hore ha e sa na kokwanahloko ya corona , new zealand e boetse e hlasetswe ke ho kginwa ha ditshebeletso hape.

src_text: although the latest outbreak was of relatively few cases, the government swiftly reimposed lockdown restrictions.
tgt_text: leha ho ropoha ha moraorao e ne e le ha ditlaleho tse mmalwa, mmuso oo o ile wa potlakela ho kenya dithibelo tshebe tsong hape.

src_text: similar restrictions have had to be reimposed in several parts of europe as they experience a ‘second wave’ of infections.
tgt_text: dithibelo tse tshwanang le tseo di ile tsa lokela ho kenngwa tshebetsong hape dikarolong tse mmalwa tsa yuropa kaha di ile tsa hlaselwa ke ‘leqhubu la bobedi’ la ditshwaetso.

src_text: these experiences show just how swiftly things can change when it comes to covid19.
tgt_text: diketsahalo tsena di bontsha feela kamoo dintho di ka fetohang ka potlako ha re tla tabeng ya covid19 .

src_text: it is a wakeup call to any among us who may harbour illusions that we are even close to seeing the end of this grave public health emergency.
tgt_text: sena ke tlhokomediso ho rona ba ntseng ba ithetsa ka hore re se re le haufi le ho bona pheletso ya bothata bona ba maemo a hlobae tsang bophelong ba setjhaba.

src_text: certainly, there are signs of hope.
tgt_text: ehlile ho na le matshwao a tlisang tshepo.

src_text: the number of new confirmed cases in south africa continues to decline.
tgt_text: palo ya ditlaleho tse ntjha tse tiiseditsweng ka hara afrika borwa e ntse e tswella ho theoha.

src_text: at the peak of the disease just one month ago, we were recording around 12,000 new cases a day.
tgt_text: sehlohlolong sa lefu lena kgweding e le nngwe feela e fetileng, re ne re ba le ditlaleho tse ntjha tse ka fihlang ho 12 000 ka letsatsi.

src_text: this has dropped to an average of around 5,000 a day over the past week.
tgt_text: sena se theohetse ho palohare ya bonyane 5 000 ka letsatsi bekeng ena e fetileng.

src_text: our recovery rate stands at 80 percent.
tgt_text: sekgahla sa rona sa ho hlaphohelwa se eme ho 80%.

src_text: as the country moves to alert level 2, many restrictions on social and economic activity have been lifted.
tgt_text: jwaloka ha naha e fetela mohatong wa bobedi wa tlhokomediso, dithibelo tse ngata tsa diketsahalo tsa kahisano le tsa moruo di nyehlisitswe.

src_text: with this comes increased risk of transmission.
tgt_text: sena se tla tla ka kotsi ya ho eketseha ha ditshwaetso.

src_text: we now need to manage this risk and ensure the gains we have made thus far in containing the pandemic’s spread are not reversed.
tgt_text: jwale re lokela ho laola kotsi ena le ho netefatsa hore seo re se fihletseng ho fihlela mona mabapi le ho laola ho ata ha sewa sena ha se re kgutlisetse morao.

src_text: the greatest threat to the health of nation right now is complacency.
tgt_text: tshoso e matla ka ho fetisisa bophe long ba setjhaba hajwale ke ho itebala.

src_text: it may be that we are now permitted to meet friends and family, to visit entertainment venues, to travel for leisure and to consume alcohol in restaurants, bars and taverns.
tgt_text: e ka nna ya ba re dumeletswe ho etela me tswalle le ba malapa, ho ya dibakeng tsa boithabiso, ho tsamaela monate le ho nwa tahi le ho ya direstjhure nteng, dibareng le ditame neng.

src_text: but as the old adage goes, just because you can, doesn’t mean you should.
tgt_text: feela maele a kgale a re, ho kgona, ha ho bolele ho tlameha.

src_text: many people who have the coronavirus do not have symptoms and may not even know they are infected.
tgt_text: batho ba bangata ba nang le kokwanahloko ya corona ha ba na matshwao mme ha ba tsebe le hore ba na le tshwaetso.

src_text: this is a sobering reality because it means that any of us could be infected right now and could unwittingly infect others.
tgt_text: sena ke nnete e tshosang hobane se bolela hore mang le mang e ka nna ya ba o na le tshwaetso mme a ka tshwaetsa ba bang ntle le maikemisetso.

src_text: this is particular the case when visiting relatives, especially the elderly and those with preexisting medical conditions that render them vulnerable to infection.
tgt_text: sena e ka ba ntho e etsa halang ha motho a etela ba leloko, haholoholo ba seng ba hodile le ba ntseng ba tshwerwe ke mafu a mang a ka etsang hore ba tshwae tsehe ha bonolo.

src_text: it is also true for attending religious services or cultural activities.
tgt_text: ho boetse ho jwalo ka ho ya ditshebe letsong tsa bodumedi kapa mesebetsing ya botjhaba.

src_text: the ‘second wave’ of infections that several other countries have experienced is an everpresent possibility for us too.
tgt_text: ‘leqhubu la bobedi’ la ditshwaetso leo dinaha tse ding tse mmalwa di bileng le lona ke kgonahalo e dulang e le teng ya hore le rona le ka re fihlela.

src_text: although many restrictions have been lifted, it does not mean they will not return should we experience a significant rise in infections.
tgt_text: leha ho nyehlisitswe dithibelo tse ngata, ha ho bolele hore di keke tsa kgutla haeba ho ka ba le ho phahama ho matla ha ditshwaetso.

src_text: this pandemic is a matter of life and death.
tgt_text: sewa sena ke taba ya bophelo le lefu.

src_text: we need to adapt and we need to be vigilant.
tgt_text: re lokela ho se tlwaela le ho dula re fadimehile.

src_text: in the days, weeks and months that lie ahead, we must urgently focus our efforts on recovery.
tgt_text: matsatsing a tlang, dibekeng le dikgweding tse tlang, re lokela ho tsepamisa maikutlo ka matla maite kong a ho hlaphohelwa.

src_text: our economy and our society has suffered a great deal.
tgt_text: moruo wa rona le setjhaba di thefulehile haholo.

src_text: as we return to economic activity across almost all industries – and work to repair the damage done – we have a responsibility to not let our guard down as individuals, employers, communities, families, professionals, workers and citizens.
tgt_text: jwalo ka ha re kgutlela mesebe tsing ya moruo ho phatlalla le diindasteri kaofela – mme re ilo sebetsa le ho lokisa moo ho senyehileng – re na le boikarabelo ba hore re se itebale jwaloka batho ka bo mong, bahiri, badudi, malapa, ditsebi, basebetsi le baahi.

src_text: none of us wants a return to the early days of extreme lockdown restrictions.
tgt_text: ha ho le ya mong wa rona ya batlang ho kgutlela ma tsatsing a pele a ho kginwa ho matla ha ditshebeletso le metsamao ya batho.

src_text: we want to move on with our lives.
tgt_text: re batla ho tswela pele ka maphelo a rona.

src_text: we want our friends and loved ones to remain healthy and safe.
tgt_text: re batla ho bona me tswalle le baratuwa ba phe tse hantle le ho bolokeha.

src_text: as a nation, let us continue to work together to ensure that we progress.
tgt_text: jwaloka setjhaba, ha re tswe lleng ho sebetsa mmoho ho netefatsa hore re hatela pele.

src_text: the move to alert level 2 of the lockdown is not a ‘free for all.’ the rules on social distancing, mask wearing, social gatherings and international travel remain.
tgt_text: ho fetela mohatong wa bobedi wa ho kginwa ha ditshebeletso ‘ha se ma ntlwane.’ melawana ya ho sielana sebaka, ho kenya di maske, dikopano tsa setjhaba le maeto a matjhabeng e ntse e dutse e le jwalo.

src_text: our success rests on our ability to abide by these regulations and to ensure that we each behave carefully and responsibly.
tgt_text: katleho ya rona e itshetle hile hodima bokgoni ba rona ba ho ikobela melawana ena le ho netefatsa hore bohle re itshwara ka hloko le ka boikarabelo.

src_text: every time we are considering any form of nonessen tial activity, we should ask: what is the risk of infection to ourselves and to others?
tgt_text: kamehla ha re nahana ka ho etsa mosebetsi o sa hlokeheng, re lokela ho ipo tsa hore: kgonahalo e ka ba efe ya ho tshwaetsa ba bang kapa ho tshwaetswa?

src_text: where there is a risk, even a slight one, it is better not to do it.
tgt_text: moo ho ka bang kotsi, leha e ka ba e nyane, ho molemo hore o se be moo.

src_text: let us proceed, as ever, with caution.
tgt_text: ha re tswelleng, jwaloka kamehla, re fadimehe.

src_text: let us keep each other safe.
tgt_text: ha re bolokaneng vukuzenzele unnamed naha ya bo rona e se e fetetse mo hatong wa bobedi wa tlhokomediso karabe long ya rona ho sewa sa kokwanahloko ya corona .

src_text: protect our women and children vukuzenzele unnamed a year ago, almost to the day, thousands of wom en, men and children marched to parliament to protest against a spate of rapes and killings of women and girls.
tgt_text: sirelletsa basadi le bana ba rona vukuzenzele unnamed selemo se fetileng, hantle letsatsing lena, diketekete tsa basadi, banna le bana ke ha ba kgwantela palamenteng ho itseka kgahlanongle leqeme la dipeto le dipolao tsa basadi le barwetsana.

src_text: at the time, the nation was reeling from the murders of uyinene mrwetyana, leighandre jegels, jesse hess and a number of other women who had lost their lives at the hands of brutal men.
tgt_text: nakong eo setjhaba se ne se llela mafu a uyinene mrwetyana, leighandre jegels, jesse hess le ba babang ba basadi ba bangata ba lahlehetsweng ke maphelo a bona matsohong a banna ba kgopo.

src_text: from all social backgrounds, young and old, students and working women, the peaceful protesters held aloft placards that read ‘enough is enough’ and ‘am i next?’.
tgt_text: ho tswa mahlakoreng ohle a setjhaba, basadi ba batjha le ba baholo, ba baithuti le ba sebetsang, baitseki bana ba itsekileng ho sena merusu ba ne ba tshwere dipolakhathe tse neng di ngotswe jwana ‘enough is enough ’ le ‘am i next?’.

src_text: the anguish and the anger was palpable that day.
tgt_text: bohloko le ho tetebela ha maikutlo ho ne ho phahame letsatsing leo.

src_text: as i received their clearly articulated demands, it was clear to me that we needed to act urgently and with determination.
tgt_text: ha ke ne ke fumana ditletlebo tsa bona tse hlakileng, ho ne ho hlakile ho nna hore re lokela ho nka dikgato ka nako le ka boitelo.

src_text: it was important to me that i did not respond with hollow words and empty promises.
tgt_text: ho ne ho le bohlokwa ho nna hore ha ke araba ke se arabele ka mantswe a fofotsang le ka ditshepiso tse kekeng tsa phethahatswa.

src_text: a few days later, i called a joint sitting of parliament, where we announced a r1.6 billion emergency response action plan to combat genderbased violence and femicide (gbvf).
tgt_text: matsatsing a mmalwa a latelang, ke ile ka bitsa kopano ya komiti ya palamente, moo ho ileng hatlalewa leano la tshohanyetso la mohato wa boikarabelo la r1.6 billion ho lwatshana le tshebediso ya dikgoka e itshetlehileng hodima bong le dipolao tsa basadi (gbvf).

src_text: over the six months of its implementation, public spending in various government departments was reprioritised to support interventions for care and support for survivors, for awareness and prevention campaigns, to improve laws and policies, to promote the economic empowerment of women, and to strengthen the criminal justice system.
tgt_text: nakong ya yona ya dikgwedi tse tsheletseng tsa ho kena tshebetsong, tshebediso ya ditjhelete tsa setjhaba mafapheng a fapaneng a mmuso e ne ya suthiswa ho tshehetsa matsholo a ho hlokomela le ho tshehetsa bapholohi, le bakeng sa matsholo a tshedimoso le a temoso, ho ntlafatsa melao le mananeo, ho ntlafatsa boimatlafatso ba moruo ba basadi le ho matlafatsa disesitimi tsa botlokotsebe.

src_text: and now we are on the cusp of the most farreaching legislative overhaul in the fight against gbvf.
tgt_text: jwale re nakong eo ho yona re leng mothating wa ho fetola maano a ho lwantsha ntwa kgahlanong le gbvf.

src_text: three key bills relating to gbvf have been introduced in parliament recently.
tgt_text: dibili tse tharo tse amanang le tshebediso ya dikgoka e itshetlehileng hodima bong (gbv) di se di hlahisitswe palamenteng haufinyana tjena.

src_text: through the introduction of these bills, we are honouring the promise we made to the protestors last year and to all the women of this country.
tgt_text: ka tlhahiso ya dibili tsena, re hlompha tshepiso eo re e entseng ho batletlebi selemong se fetileng le ho basadi kaofela naha ka bophara.

src_text: the three amendment bills are designed to fill the gaps that allow some perpetrators of these crimes to evade justice and to give full effect to the rights of our country’s women and children.
tgt_text: dibili tse tharo tse hlomathisitsweng di etseditswe ho kwala dikgeo tse dumellang batlodi ba molao ba diketso tsena hore ba se kgone ho baleha molao mmoho le ho nehelana ka ditokelo tsa setjhaba tsa basadi le bana.

src_text: these bills, once finalised, will help to restore the confidence of our country’s women that the law is indeed there to protect them.
tgt_text: hang feela ha dibili tsena di phethelwa, di tla thusa ho busetsa serithi sa basadi ba naha le ho etsa hore ba dumele hore molao ka nnete o tla ba tshirelletsa.

src_text: the first is the bill to amend the criminal law (sexual offences and related matters) amendment act.
tgt_text: ntlha ya pele ya bili ke ho fetola molao wa botlokotsebe wa (ditlolo tsa motabo le dintlha tse amanang le tsona).

src_text: this creates a new offence of sexual intimidation, extends the ambit of the offence of incest, and extends the reporting duty of persons who suspect a sexual offence has been committed against a child.
tgt_text: hona ho tlisa tlolo ya molao e ntjha ya letshoho la motabo, le atollohelang ho tlolo ya molao ya batho ba amanang haholo ka leloko, mme ho tlalehwa lokela ho tlalehwa batho ba belaellwang hore ba entse ditlolo tsena kgahlanong le bana.

src_text: it expands the scope of the national register for sex offenders (nrso) to include the particulars of all sex offenders.
tgt_text: hona ho atolosa letlowa larejistara ya setjhaba ya batlodi ba motabo (nrso) ho kenyelletsa dintlha tsohle tsa batlodi bohle ba ditlolo tsa motabo.

src_text: until now, it has only applied to sex offenders convicted of sex crimes perpetrated against children or persons with mental disabilities.
tgt_text: ho fihlela jwale, bili ena e kentse feela ho batlodi ba molao wa motabo ba ahlolelwang ditlolo tsa molao tse etsahalang baneng le kapa bathong ba phelang ka bohole ba monahano.

src_text: the time an offender’s particulars must remain on the register has been increased, and those listed on the register will have to disclose this when they submit applications to work with vulnerable persons.
tgt_text: nako eo dintlha tsa motlodi wa molao di tla beng di le rejisitareng e ekeditswe, mme bao mabitso a bona a leng lenaneng la rejisitara ba tla lokela ho senola tsena ha ba etsa dikopo tsa ho sebetsa le batho ba se nang matla a ho itwanela.

src_text: the bill also provides for the names of persons on the nrso to be publicly available.
tgt_text: hape bili ena e etsa sebaka sa mabitso a batho ba hlahellang ho nrso hore a behwe pepeneneng.

src_text: the criminal and related matters amendment bill tightens, among others, the granting of bail to perpetrators of gbvf, and expands the offences for which minimum sentences must be imposed.
tgt_text: bili ya botlokotsebe le dintlha tse amanang le bona e matlafatsa hara tse ding, ho nehelwa ka beili ha batlodi ba molao wa gbvf, hape o nehelana ka katoloso ya hore ditlolo tsena di behelwe bonyane bo itseng ba dikotlo.

src_text: the amendments impose new obligations on lawenforcement officials and on our courts.
tgt_text: ntjhafatso ya molao ona e fana hape le ka boitlamo bo botjha ho diofisiri tse phethahatsang molao le makgotleng a rona a dinyewe.

src_text: when a prosecutor does not oppose bail in cases of gbv, they have to place their reasons on record.
tgt_text: ha motjhutjhisi a sa hanele beili dinyeweng tsa gbv , o lokela ho hlakisa mabaka a hae mme ba a rekote.

src_text: unless a person accused of gbv can provide exceptional circumstances why they should be released on bail, the court must order their detention until the criminal proceedings are concluded.
