tgt_text: ntle le ha motho ya qoswang ka gbv a ka nehelana ka mabaka a ikgethileng a hore hobaneng a lokela ho ntshwa ka beili, lekgotla la dinyewe le lokela ho laela hore ba dule tjhankaneng ho fihlela diqoso le nyewe e phethelwa.

src_text: in reaching a decision on a bail application, the courts are compelled to take a number of considerations into account.
tgt_text: ho fihlelleng qeto ya kopo ya beili, dinyewe di tlangwa ho shebisisa mabaka a itseng.

src_text: they include pretrial reports on the desirability of releasing an accused on bail, threats of violence made against a survivor, and the view of the survivor regarding his or her safety.
tgt_text: a knyelletsa raporoto ya pele ho nyewe e nehelang ka bohlokwa ba ho lokolla moqosuwa ka beili, ditshoso tsa dikgoka tse ka etswang ho mopholohi, le ntlha ya mopholohi mabapi le tshireletseho ya hae.

src_text: when it comes to parole, a complainant or a relative of a deceased victim must be able to make representation to the parole board.
tgt_text: ha ho tluwa tabeng ya parola, motletlebi kapa e mong wa leloko la lehlatsipa le hlokahetseng o lokela ho ba kemeding ya lekgotla la parola.

src_text: given the unacceptably high levels of intimate partner violence in our country, we have tightened the provisions of the domestic violence act.
tgt_text: ho lebelletswe sekgahla se hodimo sa tshebediso ya dikgoka e ka hare ho naha ya rona balekaneng, re matlafaditse mehato ya molao wa tshebediso ya dikgoka malapeng.

src_text: domestic violence is now defined to cover those in engagements, dating, in customary relationships, and actual or perceived romantic, intimate or sexual relationships of any duration.
tgt_text: tshebediso ya dikgoka malepeng jwale e se e hlaloswa ho kenyelletsa batho ba tshepisaneng lenyalo, ba ntshananng, dikamanong tsa setso tabeng tsa marato, dikamano tse kenelletseng, kapa dikamanong tsa motabo tsa nako efe kapa efe.

src_text: the bill also extends the definition of ‘domestic violence’ to include the protection of older persons against abuse by family members.
tgt_text: bili ena hape e atollotse tlhaloso ya yona ya ‘tshebediso ya dikgoka malapeng’ ho kenyelletsa tshirelletso ya batho ba baholo kgahlanong le tlhekefetso matsohong a maloko a malapa a bona.

src_text: complainants will be able to apply for a protection order online.
tgt_text: batletlebi ba tla fumana monyetla wa ho etsa kopo ya taelo ya tshirelletso ka inthanete.

src_text: to prevent a scenario where perpetrators can hide past histories of domestic violence, an integrated repository of protection orders will be established.
tgt_text: ho thibela maemo ao ho ona batlodi ba molao ba ka patang nalane ya bona e fetileng ya tshebediso ya dikgoka malapeng, ho tla thehwa sesiu sa ditaelo tsa lekgotla tsa tshireletso.

src_text: the proposed amendments also oblige the departments of social development, basic education, higher education and health to provide certain services to survivors where needed and to refer them for sheltering and medical care.
tgt_text: dintjhafatso tse entsweng tsa molao hape di tlama lefapha la ntshetsopele ya setjhaba, lefapha la thuto ya motheo, lefapha la thuto e hodimo le lefapha la bophelo bo botle ho nehelana ka ditshebeletso ho bapholohi moo ho hlokahalang le ho ba romela bodulong bo bolokehileng le ho ba nehela kalafo.

src_text: the circumstances under which a prosecutor can refuse to institute a prosecution when offences have been committed under the amended act or to withdraw charges when it involves the infliction of bodily harm or where a weapon was used to threaten a complainant have been limited.
tgt_text: mabaka ao motjhutjhisi a ka hanang ho ka hlahlela nyewe ha ditlolo tsa molao di entswe tlasa molao wa ntjhafatso kapa a qhala nyewe eo ho yona ho nang le diketsahalo tsa ho lematswa kapa eo ho yona ho sebedisitsweng sebetsa ho tshosa motletlebi a le tshopodi.

src_text: in perhaps the most groundbreaking proposed amendment to the act, if someone has knowledge, reasonable belief or suspicion that an act of domestic violence has been committed against a child, a person with disability or an older person and fails to report it to a social worker or police officer they can be fined and even imprisoned.
tgt_text: moo ho nang le mehato e sisintsweng ya ntjhafatso ya molao, ha motho a na le tsebo, tumelo e sa belaetseng kapa kgwao ya hore ketso ya tshebediso ya dikgoka malapeng e entswe kgahlanong le ngwana, motho ya phelang ka bohole kapa ho leqheku, mme a hloleha ho e tlaleha ho mosebelletsi wa setjhaba kapa tshebeletsong ya sepolesa sa afrika borwa (saps) motho eo a ka fuwa kotlo kapa a kwallwa.

src_text: similarly, failure by a member of the saps to comply with their obligations under the act will be regarded as misconduct and must be reported to the civilian secretariat for police service.
tgt_text: ka lehlakoreng le leng, ha leloko la saps le hloleha ho ikamahanya le boitlamo ba mosebetsi wa bona, tlasa molao ona, hono ho tla nkuwa e le tlolo ya molao mme ho tla lokelwa ho tlelehuwa ho tshebeletso ya sepolesa ya mongodi wa setjhaba.

src_text: the law is the one sure protector of all of society, but especially its most vulnerable.
tgt_text: molao ke ona feela o tshirelletsang setjhaba kaofela, haholoholo bathong ba senang matla a hoitwanela.

src_text: when diligently and fairly applied, it is the most powerful guarantor of justice.
tgt_text: ha molao o ka sebediswa ka tshwanelo le ka toka, ke sebetsa sa bohlokwa sa toka.

src_text: the women of south africa have had enough of lukewarm actions that do not address one of the most fundamental rights of all – to live in freedom from fear.
tgt_text: basadi ba aforika borwa bautlwile ke dikgato tse sesane tse sa arabeleng dillo tsa bona ha ho tluwa ditokelong tsa batho bohle tsa motheo – ho phela ka bolokolohi ntle le letshoho.

src_text: this government and its partners will make good by the women of south africa.
tgt_text: mmuso ona mmoho le basebetsi ba ona o tla etsa bonnete ba hore toka e phethahatswe basading ba aforika borwa.

src_text: we will not let them down.
tgt_text: sirelletsa basadi le bana ba rona vukuzenzele unnamed selemo se fetileng, hantle letsatsing lena, diketekete tsa basadi, banna le bana ke ha ba kgwantela palamenteng ho itseka kgahlanongle leqeme la dipeto le dipolao tsa basadi le barwetsana.

src_text: woza matrics launched dale hes this year’s ma triculants have to faced considerable challenges because of the coronavirus disease (covid19).
tgt_text: loetse 2020 kgatiso 2woza matrics e thakgotswe dale hes baithuti ba mopa to wa metiriki ba selemo sena ba ile ba tlameha ho teana le diphephetso tse ngata ka lebaka la kokwanahloko ya corona (covid19).

src_text: the department of basic education (dbe) has ensured that the safe reopening of schools is one of its top priorities, along with supporting learners with various programmes to help them successfully complete the academic year.
tgt_text: lefapha la thuto ya motheo le entse bonnete ba hore ho bulwa hape ha dikolo ka tshireletseho ke enngwe ya dintlha tse ka sehlohong lenaneng la bona, mmoho le ho tshehetsa baithuti ka mananeo a fapafapaneng hoba thusa ho ka qeta selemo sa dithuto ka katleho.

src_text: one of these is the woza matrics programme, which was launched on 1 september in collaboration with a number of broadcasting partners and educational experts.
tgt_text: le leng la mananeo ana ke la woza matrics , le thakgotsweng ka la 1 loetse mmoho le ditshebeletso tse itseng tsa kgaso le ditsebi tsa thuto.

src_text: as part of the programme, catchup lessons on six key matric subjects are being aired on sabc, dstv and openview (channel 122) every day for 12 weeks, from 8am to 10am and 1pm to 3pm.
tgt_text: jwaloka karolo ya lenaneo la ho kwala sekgeo dithutong tse tsheletseng tsa metiriki tse haswang ho sabc, dstv le openview (channel 122) letsatsi le leng le le leng ho isa dibekeng tse 12, ho tloha ka hora ya borobedi hoseng ho isa ka hora ya leshome hoseng le ka hora ya bong motshehare ho isa ka hora ya boraro mantsibuya.

src_text: the goal is to help learners to prepare for their final exams.
tgt_text: sepheo ke ho thusa baithuti ho itokisetsa dihlahlobo tsa bona tsa makgaola kgang.

src_text: the platform also provides live lessons, during which learners can ask teachers questions.
tgt_text: polatefomo ena e nehelana hape le ka dithuto tse phelang, tseo ho tsona baithuti ba ka botsang matitjhere dipotso.

src_text: exam tips are also provided.
tgt_text: dikeletso tsa dihlahlobo le tsona di a fumaneha woza matrics e amohela hore le ha baithuti kaofela ba senyehetswe ke nako ya sekolo, baithuti ba mophato wa 12 ke bona ba amehileng haholo, ka ha dimaraka tsa bona di le bohlokwa haholo bakeng sa ho fumana mesebetsi le ho amohelwa diyunivesithing.

src_text: woza matrics recognises that while all learners have lost school time, grade 12s have been the most severely affected, as their marks are extremely important for their career and university acceptance.
tgt_text: letona la thuto ya motheo angie motshekga o itse lenaneo lena ke la bohlokwa haholo, ho sa lebalwe hore ho bile le ditshetiso tsa dithuto tse bakilweng ke covid19 .

src_text: basic education minister angie motshekga says the programme is vital, considering the disruption to learn ing caused by covid19.
tgt_text: "metiriki hangata e ba thata, empa 2020 e bile boima haholo.

src_text: "matric is always stressful, but 2020 has been filled with unusual stresses.
tgt_text: ke rata ho tlotla baithuti bohle ba mophato wa 12 le ba malapa a bona bakeng sa mamello le boitelo ba bona.

src_text: i want to congratulate all our grade 12 learners and their families for their perseverance and determination.
tgt_text: ho pepeneneng hore tshehetso e eketsehileng e a hlokeha bakeng sa baithuti mme re tla tswella pele ho ba neha yona.

src_text: it is abundantly clear that additional support is required for learners and we will continue to provide this.
tgt_text: ho se ho setse dikgwedi tse mmalwa feela hore selemo se fele mme woza matrics e tla neha baithuti tshehetso eo ba e hlokang ho itokisetsa dihlahlobo tsa makgaola kgang," o buile jwalo.

src_text: there are a few months left before the end of the year and woza matrics will give learners the support they need to prepare for the final exams," she says.
tgt_text: lenaneo le ikgethile ka ha le tobane le boholo ba baithuti ba mophato wa 12 naheng ka bophara mme ba se nang phumano ya inthanete ebile ba se na disebediswa tsa dijithale.

src_text: the programme is unique in that it targets the majority of grade 12s in the country who do not have regular access to the internet and connected digital devices.
tgt_text: dikgaso tsa dithuto di tla fumanwa ke baithuti ba fetang dimiliyone tse 1.2 ba ngolang dihlahlobo tsa metiriki ka kgwedi ya pudungwana.

src_text: broadcasts will be available to view by most of the 1.2 million learners who are writing matric exams in november.
tgt_text: lekgotla la matona a thuto le kgothalleditse baithuti le batswadi kaofela ho sebedisa polatefomo ena.

src_text: the council of education ministers has urged all learners and parents to make use of the platform.
tgt_text: mookamedi e moholo (ceo) wa lekgotla la kgaso la afrika borwa (sabc) madoda mxakwe o itse kgaso e motlotlo ka hoba karolo ya lenaneo lena.

src_text: sabc ceo madoda mxakwe says the broadcaster is proud to be part of the initiative.
tgt_text: "re thabile ho ba ba bang ba banka karolo ba bohlokwa ba ho pholosa selemo sa 2020 sa meteriki.

src_text: "we are pleased to be one of the key roleplayers in saving the 2020 matric year.
tgt_text: jwaloka kgaso ya tshebeletso ya setjhaba re tlamehile ho etsa bonnete ba hore mananeo a rona a kenyelletsa mananeo a thuto, haholo nakong ena eo e hlokahalang haholo.

src_text: as a public service broadcaster, we are dutyb ound to ensure that our content includes a significant number of educational programmes, particularly during a period when it is most needed.
tgt_text: dipotso tsa hao di a arajwake dithuto dife tse tla akaretswa?

src_text: "your questions answeredwhat subjects will be covered?
tgt_text: maths geography life sciences physical sciences accounting maths literacy.

src_text: maths geography life sciences physical sciences accounting maths literacy.
tgt_text: hobaneng ho kgethilwe dinako tsena ka hobane baithuti ba tla be ba le sekolong?

src_text: why were these time slots chosen, because learners could be at school?
tgt_text: dinako tsa ho ya sekolong di a fapana ho ya ka dikgaolo le ho ya ka diporovinsi, jwaloka ha ho imatahanngwa le mehato ya ho se atamelane.

src_text: school attendance times vary across districts and provinces, due to social distancing measures.
tgt_text: baithuti ba bangata ba metiriki ba tla be ba le hae ha mananeo ana a haswa.

src_text: many matrics will be at home at the time of broadcasting.
tgt_text: palo e nngwe hape e nyane feela le yona ke ya baithuti ba ithutelang lapeng.

src_text: a small percentage of learners are also being homeschooled.
tgt_text: dikgaso tse kgolo di tla phetwa ka hora ya bone mantsibuya ho openview mme di fumanwe hape ho dstv catchup .

src_text: the main broadcasts will be repeated after 4pm on openview and are available on dstv catchup.
tgt_text: hobaneng ho thusiwa barutwana ba metiriki feela?

src_text: why only matrics?
tgt_text: mametiriki a ka tlase ho kgatello e kgolo ya ho nka diqeto tse amang maphelo a bona ha ba se ba qetile ho kena sekolo.

src_text: matrics are under the most pressure to plan their postschool lives.
tgt_text: mametiriki a kopane le ditshitiso tse ngata tse kgolo dithutong tsa bona tsa sekolo ho tloha ka hlakubele 2020 ka lebaka la hore kharikhulamo ya bona ha e soka e kgutsufatswa.

src_text: matrics have faced more significant disruption to their schooling since march 2020 because their curriculum was not shortened.
tgt_text: mametiriki a saletse morao dithutong tsa bona.

src_text: matrics have fallen the furthest behind on curricu lum learning.
tgt_text: sekejule sa ho sheba mananeo ke se fumana kae?

src_text: where can i find the viewing schedule?
tgt_text: sekejule sa ho sheba mananeo se teng sekejuleng sa tataiso ya tv le ho wepsaete ya woza matrics ho wozamatrics.co.za.

src_text: the viewing schedule is available in tv guides and on the woza matrics website at wozamatrics.co.za.
tgt_text: mananeo a phetwang le ona a teng moo.

src_text: repeat broadcasts will be available.
tgt_text: na e teng tshehetso e nehwang batswadi le matitjhere?

src_text: is support being provided to parents and teach ers?
tgt_text: ee.

src_text: yes.
tgt_text: sekejule sa ho sheba mananeo se tla ba le mananeo a nang le dikeletso ho thusa batswadi ka hore ba ka tshehetsa bana ba bona ba etsang metiriki jwang.

src_text: the broadcast schedule will have some sessions on tips for parents on ways to support their matric children.
tgt_text: mananeo a mang a tla eletsa matitjhere mme lefapha la thuto ya motheo le polatefomo ya lona ya teacher connect ya whatsapp le tla e sebedisa ho romella matitjhere melaetsa ya bohlokwa.

src_text: some sessions will focus on teachers and the dbe's teacher connect whatsapp platform will communicate key messages to teachers.
tgt_text: na ho tla ba le tsepamiso mabapi le ho lwantshana le kgatello e tobileng mametiriki?

src_text: will there be a focus on dealing with the stresses faced by matrics?
tgt_text: ee.

src_text: yes.
tgt_text: ho tla ba le mananeo a tla tobana ka ho otlolloha le phano ya dikeletso bakeng sa boitekanelo ba baithuto, ho emelana le kgatello ya monahano le ho laola letshoho.

src_text: there will be several sessions focused on providing tips for student wellbeing, coping with stress and managing anxiety.
tgt_text: loetse 2020 kgatiso 2woza matrics e thakgotswe dale hes baithuti ba mopa to wa metiriki ba selemo sena ba ile ba tlameha ho teana le diphephetso tse ngata ka lebaka la kokwanahloko ya corona (covid19).

src_text: sa media is a key pillar of our democracy vukuzenzele unnamed in many countries around the world, the coronavirus pandemic has required the limita tion of many civil liberties and put social cohesion to the test.
tgt_text: boqolotsi ba ditaba afrika borwa ke tshiya e kgolo ya demokrasi ya rona vukuzenzele unnamed dinaheng tse ngata tsa lefatshe lohle, sewa sa kokwanahloko ya corona se thibetse bolokolohi ba ditjhaba tse ngata le ho sitisa dikamano tsa setjhaba ka bosona.

src_text: but countries with strong institutions, vigilant judicial systems and a robust media have been able to prevent human rights from being undermined and the authority of the state being abused.
tgt_text: empa dinaha tse nang le diinstitjushene tse matla, ditshebetso tse hlwahlwa tsa toka esita le boqolotsi bo tjhatsi ba ditaba di bile le hona ho sireletsa ditokelo tsa botho hore di se ke tsa halalwa le bolaodi ba naha hore bo se ke ba sebediswa hampe.

src_text: it has been six months since the national state of disaster was proclaimed.
tgt_text: e se e le dikgwedi tse tshe letseng esale maemo a naha a tlokotsi a phatlaladitswe.

src_text: despite the unprecedented nature of the disease and the immense challenge of placing a country of 58 million people under lockdown, we have fared well.
tgt_text: le ka ntle le hore boleng ba bolwetse bona ha bo a ka ba tloha bo tsebilwe pele esita le yona phephetso e matla ya ho etsa hore naha ya batho ba dimiliyone tse 58 ba dule ba le malapeng ba thibetswe metsamao, re sebeditse ha ntle.

src_text: we have managed to contain the spread of the disease primarily because of the cooperation and vigilance of all citizens.
tgt_text: re kgonne ho laola ho ata ha bolwetse bona ka lebaka la tshebedisano le bohlwahlwa ba baahi bohle.

src_text: this is in no small part due to the sterling work of our media.
tgt_text: hona ho bakilwe haholo ke mosebetsi o kgabane wa boqolotsi ba rona ba ditaba.

src_text: we owe a debt of gratitude to south africa’s hardworking and tenacious journalists.
tgt_text: re lokela ho leboha haholo baqolotsi ba ditaba ba afrika borwa ba sebetsang ka matla ba bileng ba nang le boitelo bo matla.

src_text: they have kept our people informed by disseminating key health messages about social distancing and hygiene.
tgt_text: ba ile ba etsa hore setjhaba se dule se na le tsebo ka ho fana ka melaetsa ya bohlokwa ya bophelo bo botle mabapi le ho sielana sebaka dipakeng esita le tlho komelo ya mmele.

src_text: they have done so under extremely trying conditions, often with limited resources.
tgt_text: ba entse tseo tsohle maemong a thata haholo, ebile hangata ba se na le mehlodi e lekaneng.

src_text: they have told the stories of the effects of lockdown on the lives of people and their businesses.
tgt_text: ba ile ba pheta dipale tsa batho tse buang ka hore se kgahla sa ho dula malapeng se amile jwang bophelo le dikgwebong tsa bona.

src_text: they have been out in the villages, towns and cities, bringing stories of ordinary people and drawing national attention to problems being experienced in hospitals and clinics, prompting government action.
tgt_text: ba ile ba etela metsana, ditoropo le metse e meholo mme ba tla ka dipale tsa batho ba sa tsebahaleng hakaalo mme ba bile ba hlokomedisa naha ka mathata ao setjhaba se nang le ona dipetlele le ditleliniking, mme hona ho bakile hore mmuso o etse ho hong.

src_text: our media have also shone a light on excesses that perhaps would not have ordinarily come to light.
tgt_text: boqolotsi bona ba rona ba ditaba bo ile ba hlahisa dintlha tse ding tse ngata tseo ka mohlomong di neng di ke ke tsa hlahiswa tsa tsebahala.

src_text: they have fulfilled their watchdog role by unearthing acts of corruption and maladministration, sparking a massive national debate and leading to a number of highprofile investigations.
tgt_text: ba ile ba phethahatsa seabo sa bona sa ho ba dihlwela ka ho sibolla diketso tsa bobodu le tsamaiso e fosahetseng, mme hona ha tsosa dinga ngisano tse matla ka hara setjhaba tse ileng tsa etsa hore qetellong ho be le dipatlisiso tsa boemo bo phahameng.

src_text: through this reporting they have earned people’s trust.
tgt_text: ka lebaka la dipehelo tsena tsa bona, ba ile ba ikgapela tshepo ho tswa ho setjhaba.

src_text: a free press is not an end in itself.
tgt_text: boqolotsi ba ditaba bo loko llohileng ha bo bolele hore ke qetello ya bona.

src_text: it is a means by which democracy is secured and upheld.
tgt_text: ke mokgwa oo ka ona demokrasi e fihle llwang le ho baballwa.

src_text: during this pandemic, our media has played not just its traditional watchdog role, but exercised its civic duty in supporting the national effort to contain the coronavirus.
tgt_text: nakong ena ya sewa sena, boqolotsi ba rona ba ditaba ha bo a phetha feela seabo sa bona se tlwaelehileng sa bohlwela, empa bo ile ba etsa mosebetsi wa bona wa setjhaba ka ho tshehetsa me kutu ya setjhaba ya ho laola kokwanahloko ena ya corona .

src_text: given the importance of the media to the health of our democracy, it is a great concern that like all other sectors of the economy, the coronavirus crisis has hit our media houses hard.
tgt_text: ha re tadima bohlokwa ba boqolotsi ba ditaba bakeng sa bophelo bo botle ba demokra si ya rona, ke tletlebo e kgolo e bonahalang hore jwaloka dikarolo tse ding tsa moruo, tlokotsi ena ya kokwanahloko ya corona e thefutse matlo a boqolotsi ba ditaba haholo.

src_text: some publications lost as much as 60 percent of their income in the early days of the lockdown.
tgt_text: diphatlalatso tse ding di lahlehetswe ke lekeno la tsona le ka etsang 60% matsatsing a ha re qala feela ka thibelo ya metsamao.

src_text: a number of companies have had to implement salary cuts, reduce staff numbers or reduce hours worked.
tgt_text: dikhamphani tse ngata di ile tsa lokela ho fokotsa meputso ya basebetsi, ho fokotsa palo ya basebetsi kapa hona ho fokotsa dihora tse sebeditsweng.

src_text: regrettably, some publications have even been forced to close, among them some of south africa’s most established and wellknown magazine titles.
tgt_text: ka maswa bi, tse ding tsa diphatlalatso di ile tsa qobeleha ho kwalwa, hara tsona ho na le tse ding tsa mabitso a dikgatiso a tsebisa halang haholo a dimakasine tsa afrika borwa.

src_text: the job losses that have resulted from the lockdowns have exacerbated a crisis for media companies already facing challenges like loss of advertising revenues, falling circulation and market share being taken by mobilefirst news and other technologies.
tgt_text: ditahlehelo tsa mesebetsi tse bakilweng ke thibelo ya metsamao di bakile tlokotsi ho dikhamphani tsa boqolotsi ba ditaba tse seng di ntse di na le mathata a jwaloka tahlehelo ya ditjhelete tsa dipapatso, kabo e ntseng e theoha e qepha esita le me baraka e ileng ya nkuwa ke dikhamphani tsa ditaba tse rekisang ditaba ka difono fono esita le mekgwa e meng ya theknoloji.

src_text: these financial difficulties are being faced across the board, from online titles to traditional broadsheets to the public broadcaster.
tgt_text: mathata ana a ditjhelete a ile a ba teng hohle dikhamphaning tsa ditaba, ho kenyeletsa tsa mabitso a di kgatiso tsa mo inthaneteng le tsa mangolo a ditaba ao a tlwaelehileng mmoho le tsa kgaso ya setjhaba.

src_text: this was one of the issues that was raised sharply during my engagement with the south african national editors’ forum recently.
tgt_text: ena e bile e nngwe ya di taba tse ileng tsa hlahiswa ka matla nakong eo ke buisa nang le south african national editors’ forum haufinyana.

src_text: instead of lamenting their fate, however, the media industry is working hard to refine business models, to drive innovation and to retain staff as much as possible.
tgt_text: ho na le ho dulela ho nna ba ingamangama, leha ho le jwalo, indasteri ya boqolotsi ba ditaba e sebetsa ka matla ho hlabolla mekgwa ya yona ya kgwebo, ho ntshetsa pele boitshimollelo le ho baballa basebetsi kamoo ba ka kgo nang ka teng.

src_text: at the same time, the media is a unique entity in any society because its practitioners fulfil a role that is so essential to our democratic order.
tgt_text: ka tsela e jwalo, boqolotsi ba ditaba ke setheo se ikgethi leng ka hara setjhaba sefe kapa sefe hobane baphethahatsi ba na le seabo sa bohlokwa ba keng sa taolo ya demokrasi ya rona.

src_text: they work to keep the public informed and to keep power in check.
tgt_text: ba hlaha setjhaba lese ding ka tse etsahalang esita le ho disa hore batho ba fuweng matla ha ba iketsetse kamoo ba ratang ka teng.

src_text: we need more journalists, not less.
tgt_text: re batla baqolotsi ba banga ta ba ditaba, eseng ba fokoditsweng.

src_text: that is why the loss of even a single journalist is not just a loss to the industry but to the country.
tgt_text: ke ka hona tahlehelo ya moqolosi a le mong feela wa ditaba eseng feela ya indasteri empa e le tahlehelo ho naha kaofela.

src_text: we need our media veterans, who bring with them vast experience and institutional memory, and are able to offer critical reportage and informed analysis.
tgt_text: re batla diqhoku tsa me kaubere ya baqolotsi ba di taba, ba tlisang boiphihlelo bo bongata le dikgopolo tsa kgale tsa institjushene, mme ba kgona ho fana ka dipehelo tsa mahlakore ohle le tshe katsheko e theilweng hodima dintlha.

src_text: at the same time we need more young journalists in the profession who are techsavvy, abreast with new trends in storytelling and in touch with the concerns of a youthful population.
tgt_text: ka ona mokgwa o jwalo, re batla batjha ba eketsehileng ba baqolotsi ba ditaba ka hara mosebetsi ona mme e le batjha ba nang le boitsebelo ba theknoloji, ba na le tsebo ya mekgwa e metjha ya ho pheta dipale le tsebo ya ditletlebo tsa batjha.

src_text: as a society we owe the media our full support.
tgt_text: jwaloka setjhaba, re lokela ho fa boqolotsi ba ditaba tshe hetso ka botlalo.

src_text: whether it is electing to pay for content, supporting crowdfunded journalism, paying our sabc license fees or simply buying a newspaper, we can all play our part to support this industry in crisis.
tgt_text: e ka ba ka ho ikgethela ho lefela mananeo a ditaba, ho tshehetsa pokele tsong ya ditjhelete tsa ho thu sa ho boloka mesebetsi ya bo qolotsi, ho lefella ditefello tsa laesense ya sabc kapa hona ho reka koranta feela, bohle re ka ba le seabo ho tshehetsa indasteri ena e nang le mathata.

src_text: as government, despite the gloomy economic climate we will continue to extend advertising spend to publications and broadcasters, especially community media.
tgt_text: jwaloka mmuso, le ka ntle ho maemo a kganyang a atle hileng a moruo, re tla tswe la pele ho eketsa dipapatso tse etsetswang diphatlalatso le kgaso, haholoholo boqolotsi ba ditaba tsa setjhaba.

src_text: the private sector must also continue to support the industry through advertising and working with media houses in the production of innovative content in line with global media trends.
tgt_text: makala a poraefete le ona a lokela ho tswela pele ho tshehetsa indasteri ka ho etsa dipapatso le ho sebedi sana le matlo a boqolotsi ba ditaba bakeng sa tlhahiso ya mananeo a boitshimollelo a tsamaelanang le metjha ya tsamaiso ya boqolotsi ba ditaba lefatsheng.

src_text: local philanthropic and donor organisations should also come on board and support public interest journalism ventures, as is the case in many democracies.
tgt_text: bafani ba ditjhelete ba ka naheng le banyehelani ba mekgatlo le bona ba lokela ho hlahella mme ba tshehetse mekutu ena ya boqolotsi ba ditaba e mo lemong wa setjhaba, jwaloka ha ho etswa jwalo mererong e mengata ya demokrasi.

src_text: the proliferation of fake news during the pandemic, primarily on social media platforms, has added to the urgency for more news that is accurate, fair and impartial.
tgt_text: ho ata ha ditaba tseo eseng tsa nnete tsa boiqapelo nakong ya sewa sena, haholoholo ho ya ka tshebediso ya ma rangrang a dikgokahano tsa setjhaba, ho ekeditse tlhoke ho ya ditaba tse ngata tse nepahetseng, tse tshepa halang le tse sa yeng ka leeme.

src_text: during this time our people have relied on our established media houses for information, once again underscoring their importance as pillars of our democracy.
tgt_text: nakong ena batho ba rona ba itshepetse ho lesedinyana le tswang ma tlong a rona a tsebahalang a boqolotsi ba ditaba bakeng sa phumano ya dintlha tse tshepahalang, hape e le ntho e supang bohlokwa ba tsona demokrasi ya rona.

src_text: as we begin the great task of rebuilding our economy in the aftermath of the pandemic, the media industry will need our support more than ever.
tgt_text: ha re qala mosebetsi wa ho aha botjha moruo wa rona kamora maputula ana a sewa sena, indasteri ya boqolotsi ba ditaba e tla batla tshehetso ya rona haholo le ho feta mehla yohle.

src_text: the free press was once described as ‘the unsleeping guardian of every other right that free men and women prize’.
tgt_text: boqolotsi ba ditaba bo lokolohileng bo kile ba hla loswa e le ‘mohlokomedi ya sa otseleng wa tokelo efe kapa efe eo e leng kgau e lokollang banna kapa basadi’.

src_text: as we salute their role in this pandemic, let us do what we can to ensure that the free and diverse media in our country is able to survive and thrive.
tgt_text: boqolotsi ba ditaba afrika borwa ke tshiya e kgolo ya demokrasi ya rona vukuzenzele unnamed dinaheng tse ngata tsa lefatshe lohle, sewa sa kokwanahloko ya corona se thibetse bolokolohi ba ditjhaba tse ngata le ho sitisa dikamano tsa setjhaba ka bosona.

src_text: transforming the agricultural sector vukuzenzele unnamed recently, the department of agriculture, land reform and rural development (dalrrd) announced that members of the public will be able to apply to lease 700 000 hectares of underutilised or vacant state land in seven of the provinces.
tgt_text: re fetola lekala la temo vukuzenzele unnamed lefapha la temo thuo, tlhabollo ya mobu le ntshetsopele ya mahae (dlrd) le sa tswa tsebisa hore ditho tsa setjha ba di tla kgona ho etsa kopo ya ho hira mobu wa mmuso wa dihekthara tse 700 000 o sa sebedisweng ka botlalo kapa o disa busabu diprovenseng tse supileng.

src_text: agricultural land is the mainstay of our natural resource base.
tgt_text: mobu wa temo ke seikoko tlelo sa motheo sa dihlodi lweng tsa habo rona.

src_text: the availability and sustainable use of farmland to grow crops and for animal husbandry is key to our very survival.
tgt_text: boteng le tshebediso ya nako e telele ya mobu wa temo bakeng sa ho lema dijalo le thuo ya mehlape ke ntho ya bohlokwa maphelong a rona.

src_text: south africa has vast tracts of land suitable for agricultural production, with 37,9% of our total land area currently being used for commercial agriculture.
tgt_text: afrika borwa e na le mobu o mongata o loketseng dihlahiswa tsa temo, moo hajwale 37,9% ya kakaretso ya mobu wa habo rona e sebedise tswang temo ya kgwebo.

src_text: like many other countries, our arable land is under threat from land degradation, water scarcity and urban encroachment.
tgt_text: jwaloka dinaha tse ding tse ngata, mobu wa habo rona o manoni o tlokotsing ya ho nyotobela ha boleng, ya kgaello ya metsi le ho ata ha metse ya ditoropo.

src_text: we are also losing prime agricultural land through landuse changes.
tgt_text: re boetse re lahlehelwa ke mobu wa bohlokwa wa temo ka lebaka la diphetoho tshebedisong ya mobu.

src_text: given our history, broadening access to agricultural land for commercial production and subsistence farming is a national priority.
tgt_text: ka lebaka la nalane ya habo rona, ho pharalatsa phihlello ya mobu wa temo bakeng sa tlhahiso ya kgwebo le bohwai ba ho iphedisa ke taba e ka sehlohlolong mererong ya naha.

src_text: although the post1994 land reform process has resulted in more land being restored and restituted to black south africans, the pernicious effects of the 1913 natives land act continue to be in patterns of farmland ownership.
tgt_text: leha tsamaiso ya tlhabollo ya mobu ya kamora 1994 e bakile hore mobu o tomanyana o busetswe ho maafrika borwa a batho ba batsho, ditlamorao tse bohloko tsa molao wa mobu wa batala wa 1913 di ntse di tswelapele ka sebopeho se ammeng boithuelo ba mobu wa bohwai.

src_text: the act went far beyond dispossessing millions of people of their ancestral land.
tgt_text: molao ona o ile wa fetella ka hore o amohe dimilione tsa batho naha ya baholoholo ba bona.

src_text: with land ownership still concentrated in the hands of the few, and agriculture primary production and value chains mainly owned by white commercial farmers, the effects of our past remain with us today.
tgt_text: ka boholo ba boithuelo ba mobu bo ntseng bo le matsohong a ba mmalwa, le boholo ba dihlahiswa tsa motheo tsa temo le mathathamo a kgwebo e ntse e le tsa bahwebi ba dihwai tsa ba basweu, ditlamorao tsa nalane ya habo rona di ntse di re maname le kajeno.

src_text: the continued monopolization of a key means of production like land is not just an obstacle to advancing a more egalitarian society; it is also a recipe for social unrest.
tgt_text: tswelopele ya ho bokella mehlodi e ka sehloohong ya tlhahiso e kang ya mobu o matsohong a ba mmalwa ha se feela tshita ya ho ntshe tsapele setjhaba se lekanang; e boetse e hlohlelletsa merusu setjhabeng.

src_text: the hunger for land to farm is growing, especially amongst the rural poor.
tgt_text: tabatabelo ya mobu wa ho lema e ntse e tota, haholoholo hara bafutsana ba dibakeng tsa mahae.

src_text: and for a number of reasons, the pace of land reform in this particular sector has been slow and unsatisfactory.
tgt_text: ka mabaka a mangatanyana, sekgahla sa tlhabollo ya mobu lekaleng lena haesale le le monyebe le bile le sa kgotsofatse.

src_text: transforming patterns of agricultural land ownership is vital not just to address the historical injustices of the past, but to safeguard our nation’s food security.
tgt_text: ho fetola meralo ya boithuelo ba mobu wa temo ho mo lemo e seng feela bakeng sa ho lokisa bosiyo ba toka ba nako e fetileng, empa le ho sireletsa kanetso ya dijo setjhabeng sa habo rona.

src_text: as noted in the 2019 report of the presidential advisory panel on land reform and agriculture, "whilst we export food, back home 41% of people in rural areas and 59,4% in urban areas have severely inadequate access to food."
tgt_text: jwaloka ha ho ile ha lemohuwa tlalehong ya 2019 ya phanele ya boeletsi ya moporesidente ya tlhabollo ya mobu le temothuo, e reng "leha re na le diyantle tsa dijo, morao lapeng 41% ya batho ba mahaeng le 59,4% ya ba ditoropong ba ntse ba na le kgaello e kgolo ya phihlello ya dijo."

src_text: agrarian reform has been a priority of successive administrations since democracy.
tgt_text: haesale tlhabollo ya temo e le taba e ka sehlohlolong ya ditsamaiso ka tatelano ya tsona ho tloha tshimolohong ya demokrasi.

src_text: between 1994 and march 2018 the state has delivered 8,4 million hectares of land to previously disadvantaged individuals under the land reform programme.
tgt_text: dipakeng tsa 1994 le tlhlakubele 2018, katlasa lenaneo la tlhabollo ya mobu, mmuso o se o fane ka mobu wa dihekthara tse 8,4 milione bathong ba neng ba kote tswe nakong e fetileng.

src_text: but this progress amounts to less than 10% of all commercial farmland.
tgt_text: empa kgatelopele ena e ka tlase ho 10% ya mobu ohle wa temo ya kgwebo.

src_text: in my state of the nation address earlier this year i committed that stateowned agricultural land would soon be released for farming.
tgt_text: puong ya ka ya boemo ba naha pejana monongwaha ke ile ka etsa boitlamo ba hore haufinyane mobu wa temothuo oo e leng wa mmuso o tla lokollelwa temo.

src_text: this is a major milestone in the agrarian reform process, and gives effect to the promise of the freedom charter that the land shall be shared among those who work it.
tgt_text: ena ke katleho e kgolo tsamaisong ya tlhabollo ya tsa temo, e bile e fana ka tshehetso tshepisong ya tokomane ya tokoloho ya hore mobu o tla arolelanwa le bohle ba o sebetsang.

src_text: our redistributive vision aims to strike a balance between social justice and redress, and enhancing agricultural output by bringing more black farmers into the mainstream of the economy.
tgt_text: tjhebelopele ya rona ya ho aba botjha e habile ho tlisa tekano dipakeng tsa toka le tokisobotjha kahisanong, esita le ho ntlafatsa tlhahiso ya temothuo ka ho kenya dihwai tse ngatanyana tsa batho ba batsho moruong o moholo.

src_text: land is a productive asset that generates profit and can be used for collateral to secure other assets.
tgt_text: mobu ke ntho ya boleng ba bohlokwa e nang le tlhahiso le phaello mme o ka sebediswa e le tshireletso e tiisang hore motho o tla lefa mokitlane wa hae ka wona haeba a sa kgone ho lefella sekepele seo a se kolotang.

src_text: we have to ensure that land acquired for farming purposes is productively used.
tgt_text: re lokela ho netefatsa hore mobu o reretsweng temo o sebediswa ka nepo.

src_text: to safeguard the allocated state land for farming purposes, the lease is not transferrable.
tgt_text: e le ho sireletsa mobu wa mmuso o abilweng bakeng sa temo, kgiro ya wona e ke ke ya fetisetswa ho e mong.

src_text: beneficiaries will sign a lease agreement with the state and pay a rental fee consistent with the land value.
tgt_text: bakgola molemo ba tla tekena tume llano le mmuso mme ba lefe rente e tsamaelanang le boleng ba mobu oo.

src_text: we must also ensure that farmers are supported along the road to sustainability and profitability.
tgt_text: re tlameha le ho netefatsa hore dihwai di a tshehetswa tseleng ena e lebisang boi tjarong ba nako e telele esita le ya bokgoni ba ho etsa phaello.

src_text: as part of this programme, beneficiaries will be trained in financial management and enterprise development.
tgt_text: e le karolo ya lenaneo lena, bakgolamolemo ba tla rupe llwa ka bolaodi ba ditjhelete le ntshetsopele ya kgwebo.

src_text: experience has shown that emerging and smallscale farmers often lack the financial skills to exploit market opportunities and integrate with value chains.
tgt_text: malebela a re rutile hore hangata dihwai tse ntseng di thuthua di haellwa ke boqhetseke ba tsa ditjhelete bakeng sa ho utolla menyetla ya mebaraka le ho itahlela ka setotswana mathathamong a dikgwebo tse kgolwanyane.

src_text: we are prioritizing women, youth and persons with disabilities as beneficiaries.
tgt_text: re beile basadi, batjha le dikowa hore e be bona ba kgolamolemo ba ka sehloo hong.

src_text: there has been demonstrable success with empowering women farmers under the existing proactive land acquisition strategy.
tgt_text: ho bile le katleho e bonahalang mabapi le ho matlafa tsa basadi tlasa lewa le ma tla la phumantsho ya mobu (plas) le teng hajwale.

src_text: in a number of provinces, women who have been allocated farms by the dalrrd have been able to run them successfully and even move into commercial production.
tgt_text: diprovenseng tse ngatanyana, basadi ba abetsweng mapolasi ke dlrd ba kgonne ho a sebetsa ka katleho le ho a phahamisetsa tlhahisong ya kgwebo.

src_text: in addition to the land acquisition itself, the department continues to invest in infrastructure, equipment and machinery to enable these entrepreneurs to run successful businesses.
tgt_text: ho eketseng hodima phumantsho ya mobu ka bo yona, lefapha le tswelapele ka ho tsetela meralong ya motheo, disebedisuweng le metjhineng e le ho thusa bahwebi bana ho tsamaisa dikgwebo tsa bona ka katleho.

src_text: broadening access to land and opportunities for farming will support job creation and enterprise development, and improve the market for food, agricultural goods and services.
tgt_text: ho pharalatsa phihlello ya mobu le menyetla ya temo ho tla tshehetsa tlhahiso ya mesebetsi le ntshetsopele ya dikgwebo, ho be ho ntlafatse mebaraka bakeng sa dijo, dihlahiswa le ditshebeletso tsa temothuo.

src_text: the ultimate goal of releasing these land parcels is to transform the agricultural landscape by growing a new generation of farmers.
tgt_text: sepheopheo sa ho neelana ka dikarolo tsena tsa mobu ke ho fetola lepatlelo la temothuo ka ho phahamisa moloko o motjha wa dihwai.

src_text: leasing land under such favourable conditions must spur them to think big; to not just grow their own businesses but to advance shared wealth and prosperity in the communities in which they farm.
tgt_text: ho hirisa mobu katlasa maemo a matle jwaana ho lokela ho ba fa morolo wa ho ja masapo a hlooho; e seng feela ho hodisa dikgwebo tseo e leng tsa bona empa le ho ntshetsapele karolelano ya moruo le nala dibakeng tseo ba lemang ho tsona.

src_text: they must heal the deep divisions of our past.
tgt_text: ba tlameha ho fodisa maqeba a tebileng a dikarohano tsa nako e fetileng.

src_text: they must dispel the stereotype that only white farmers are commercially successful in south africa, and that black farmers are perpetually ‘emerging.’in working this land; in turning it to productive use, they will indeed turn swords into ploughshares.
tgt_text: ba tlameha le ho nyahlatsa ditumelokgwela tsa hore ke dihwai tsa ba basweu feela tse atlehileng ho tsa kgwebo afrika borwa, le hore dihwai tsa batho ba batsho tsona di tla dula e ntse e le ‘tse thuthuang.’ho sebetsaneng le mobu ona; ho o fetoleng hore o sebedisetswe tlhahiso e ntle, ba tla fela ba fetole disabole hore e be mehoma.

src_text: they will become the faces of national reconciliation.
tgt_text: re fetola lekala la temo vukuzenzele unnamed lefapha la temo thuo, tlhabollo ya mobu le ntshetsopele ya mahae (dlrd) le sa tswa tsebisa hore ditho tsa setjha ba di tla kgona ho etsa kopo ya ho hira mobu wa mmuso wa dihekthara tse 700 000 o sa sebedisweng ka botlalo kapa o disa busabu diprovenseng tse supileng.

src_text: building a society that works vukuzenzele unnamed the launch of the presidential employment stimulus last week marks a fundamental shift in our ap proach to tackling unem ployment.
tgt_text: ho susumetsa moruo o sebetsang vukuzenzele unnamed ho thakgolwa ha letsholo la tshusumetso ya mesebetsi ya mopresidente bekeng e fetileng ho tshwaya phetoho ya mo kgwa oo re neng re o sebedisa ho lwantshana le tlhokeho ya mesebetsi.

src_text: we are undertaking a farreaching and ambitious public investment in human capital, with the state as both a creator and an enabler of jobs.
tgt_text: re ikana le ho ikemisetsa ho tsetela letsete le ngatangata ho tjhoriseng boiphihlelo ba batho ba rona, le mmusong jwalo ka mothehi le mophethahatsi wa mesebetsi.

src_text: the presidential employment stimulus is unprecedented in its scale and breadth, involving a public investment of r100 billion over the next three years.
tgt_text: letsholo la tshusumetso ya mesebetsi ya mopresidente e ipabolapele ka bophara le boholo ba bo tsetedi, ho kenyeletsa letsete la mmuso la r100 bilione nakong ya dilemo tse fetang tse tharo tse tlang.

src_text: we will protect and create directlyfunded jobs and livelihood support interventions while the labour market recovers from the coronavirus pandemic.
tgt_text: re tla tshireletsa le ho theha matlole a mesebetsi le bonamodi bo tshehetsang maphelo a batho ka kotloloho ha di mmaraka tsa mesebetsi di ntse di ntlafatswa ka lebaka la tshenyo ya sewa sa ko kwanahloko ya corona.

src_text: each of these is ready for implementation, and is additional to existing commitments.
tgt_text: tsena tsohle di se di loketse ho phethahatswa, mme sena ke tlatselletso hodima boitlamo bo seng bo le teng.

src_text: while some of the interventions build on the strengths of existing programmes, the stimulus also includes new and innovative approaches.
tgt_text: le ha feela tse ding tsa bonamodi bona di thehilwe hodima matla a mananeo a seng a le teng, tshusumetso ena e boela e kenyeletsa mekgwa ya tshebetso e metjha e nang le tshibollo.

src_text: this includes a focus on what we have termed ‘social employment’.
tgt_text: sena se kenyeletsa ho tsepama ho seo re se bitsang ‘mese betsi ya setjhaba’.

src_text: we are working from the premise that there is no shortage of work to be done to address the many social problems in our society.
tgt_text: re sebetsa ho tswa ho boemong ba hore ha hona kgaelo ya mesebetsi e hlokehang ho phethahatsa ho tobana le mathata a mangata ao batho ba rona ba nang le ona.

src_text: the aim is to support the considerable creativity, initiative and institutional capabilities that exist in the wider society to engage people in work that serves the common good.
tgt_text: maikemisetso a rona ke ho tshehetsa bonono bo bongata, boiteko le boiphihlo ba ditheho bo teng boholong ba batho ba rona ho kgothaletsa batho ho sebetsa mesebetsi e tswelang bohle melemo.

src_text: this work cuts across a range of themes, including food security, ending genderbased violence, informal settlement upgrading and much more.
tgt_text: mesebetsi ena e akaretsa meokotaba e me ngata, e kenyeletsang phepelo ya dijo, ho fedisa tlhekefetso ya basadi le bana, ho ntjhafatsa dibaka tsa baipei le tse ding tse ngata.

src_text: this will supplement the efforts of the public sector, allowing for greater scale and social impact as well as new forms of partnership with diverse social actors.
tgt_text: sena se tla tlatseletsa boiteko ba lekala la mmuso, le ho dumella kgahlamelo ya setjhaba e kgolokgolo ha mmoho le mekgwa ya bolekane e metjha le makala a setjhaba a fapafapaneng.

src_text: the stimulus includes a new national programme to employ teaching and school assistants in schools.
tgt_text: tshusumetso ena e kenyele tsa lenaneo la naha le letjha la ho hira bathusi ba matitjhere dikolong.

src_text: schools are making these appointments right now, delivering new opportunities in every community across the length and breadth of the country.
tgt_text: dikolo di se di qadile ho hira bathusi bana ha jwale, mme di nehela ka menyetla e ya mesebetsi e metjha bathong bohle ka bophara naheng ya rona.

src_text: public employment is not just for unskilled work.
tgt_text: mesebetsi ya setjhaba ha se ya batho ba senang bokgoni feela.

src_text: there is a crosscutting focus on graduates, with opportunities for nurses, science graduates, artisans and others.
tgt_text: e kenyeletsa batho ba nang le mangolo a thuto e phahameng, menyetla ya mesebetsi ya baoki, batho ba nang le mangolo a saense, diathesine le e meng.

src_text: the stimulus will also protect jobs in vulnerable sectors that have been hit hard by the pandemic.
tgt_text: tshusumetso e tla boele e tshireletsa mesebetsi makeleng a hlokolotsi ao a hahlame tsweng ke sewa sena ka se kgahla.

src_text: support will be provided to early childhood development practitioners, mainly selfemployed women.
tgt_text: tshehetso e tla ne helwa ke basebetsi ba dikolo tsa thuto ya dikonyana (ecd), haholoholo basadi ba itshebetsang.

src_text: over 74,000 small farmers will also receive production input grants.
tgt_text: borapolasi le mmapolasi ba thuthuhang ba fetang 74 000 le bona ba tla boela ba fumantshwa matlole a tlhahiso.

src_text: as a nation, we need arts and culture to lift our spirits once more – the stimulus provides new funding to help the sector back onto its feet, including support to digital contentcreation and expansion of ecommerce platforms.
tgt_text: jwalo ka naha, re hloka bonono le setso ho phahamisa meya ya rona hape – tshusumetso e nehela ka letlole le letjha ho thusa lekala lena ho ikemela hape, ho kenyeletsa ho tshehetsa ditlhahiso tse entsweng ka mokgwa wa dijithale le katoloso ya dipolatefomo tsa hwebisano ya elektroniki.

src_text: this will enable artists to adapt to the new market conditions that the pandemic has imposed on us all and to seize new opportunities for growth.
tgt_text: sena se tla thusa dinono hore di itlwaetse maemo a dimmaraka a matjha ao sewa sena se re kentseng ho ona mme ba sebedise monyetla ona o motjha wa kgolo.

src_text: a critical enabler for wider job creation, made more important by the pandemic, is connectivity.
tgt_text: mophethehatsi wa bohlo kwahlokwa ho theha mesebe tsi, o entsweng bohlokwahlo kwa ka ho fetisisa ke sewa sena, ke kgokahanyo.

src_text: to overcome the digital divide, the stimulus will provide affordable, highspeed broadband to lowincome households through innovative connection subsidies and the expansion of free public wifi.
tgt_text: ho fedisa karohano ya dikgokahanyo disebedisweng tsa dijithale, tshusumetso e tla nehela malapa a nang le lekeno le tlase phepelo ya inthanete e theko e tlase, e potlakang ka ho a lefella karolo e itseng ya dikgokahanyo mmoho le ho eketsa wifi ya mahala setjhabeng.

src_text: as our country recovers from the devastation of the coronavirus pandemic, we are in no doubt as to the size of the task before us.
tgt_text: ha naha ya rona e ntse e intlafatsa ho tswa ho thefulong e bakuweng ke sewa sa kokwanahloko ya corona, ha o qeaqeo hore mosebetsi o re o tobileng o mongata haholo.

src_text: we have to achieve an economic recovery that is swift and inclusive.
tgt_text: re tlameha ho fihlella ntlafa tso ya moruo e potlakileng le ho kenyeletsa bohle.

src_text: we have to get as many of our people as possible working again.
tgt_text: re tlameha ho fumantsha boholo ba batho ba rona mesebetsi hape.

src_text: we also have to regain lost ground in the provision of basic services and critical infrastructure, addressing social challenges and transforming townships and rural communities too.
tgt_text: re boela re tlameha ho fumana botsitso hape ho phanong ya ditshebeletso tsa mantlha le meralo ya motheo e bohlo kwahlokwa, ho lwantshana le diphepetso tse tobaneng le setjhaba sa rona le ho fetola makeishene le metse ya mahaeng.

src_text: public employment is an instrument that can do all of the above: creating jobs at scale in the short term while markets recover, and creating social value in the process.
tgt_text: mesebetsi ya setjhaba ke sesebediswa se ka kgonang ho phethahatsang tsena tsohle: ho theha mesebetsi ka bophara ka nako e kgutshwane ha di mmaraka di ntse di ntlafatswa, le ho theha boleng ba setjhaba ka yona nako eo.

src_text: the example is often cited of the massive public works programme undertaken by the united states after the great depression in the 1930s.
tgt_text: hangata mohlala o yeng o qotswe wa lenaneo le leholo la ditshebeletso tsa setjhaba ke le ileng la phethahatswa ke amerika ka morao sewa sa kgatello e kgolokgolo ya moruo dilemong tsa bo1930.

src_text: this was not just a stimulus, but also promoted social participation and inclusion.
tgt_text: sena e ne e se tshusumetso feela, empa se ne se kgotha lletsa hoba le seabo ha batho le ho kenyeletswa ha bona moruong.

src_text: there are several examples of innovative public employment programmes in the developing world, including in india, ethiopia and here in south africa.
tgt_text: e mmalwa mehlala ya mananeo a tshibollo ya mesebetsi ya setjhaba dinaheng tse ntseng di ntshetswapele, ho kenyeletsa india, ethiopia le mona afrika borwa.

src_text: these programmes make a direct investment in local economies, reaching poorer areas first, supporting local small enterprises and trickling up into the wider economy from there.
tgt_text: mananeo ana a kenya letsete ka kotloloho ho meruo ya selehae, ho fihlella ditulo tse futsanehileng ka ho fetisetsa pele, le ho tshehetsa dikgwebo tse thuthuhang tsa selehae mme ho tloha moo e qhekelle le meruong e meholo.

src_text: they also promote social participation and inclusion, providing communities with the means to change their lives as they undertake new forms of work.
tgt_text: mme e boela e kgothaletsa ho ba le seabo le ho kenyeletswa ha setjhaba moruong, ka ho nehela batho mekgwa ya ho fetolo maphelo a bona ha ba ntse ba batlana le mesebetsi e metjha.

src_text: in doing so, they contribute to transformation both at a local level and within broader society.
tgt_text: ka ho etsa jwalo, ba kgona ho ba le seabo phetolong ya moruo naheng le setjhabeng ka kakaretso.

src_text: direct public investment to support employment and create economic opportunities that generate social value does more than just tackle the unemployment crisis.
tgt_text: ho kenya letsete ka kotloloho setjhabeng ho tshehetsa mesebetsi le ho theha menyetla ya moruo e nang le hlompho hona ho molemo haholo ho feta ho lwantshang feela le qaka ya tlhokeho ya mesebetsi setjhabeng.

src_text: it is responsive, because it uses the state’s resources to respond to local community needs, be it for greener spaces, food security, more early childhood development centres, or for better and more accessible roads.
tgt_text: le ya sebetsa hobane le sebedisa mehlodi ya mmuso ho arabela ditlhoko tsa setjhaba tsa naheng, ekaba molemong wa ho boloka tlhaho, phepelo ya dijo, ditsi tse ding hape tsa diecd, kapa ho ntlafatsa le ho etsa hore ditsela di be betere le tse ding tse ngata.

src_text: it is progressive, because it offers social protection and income security to those who face destitution because they are unable to find work.
tgt_text: le hatetsepele, hobane le nehela ka matlole a setjhaba le phano ya makeno ho ba futsanehileng ka lebaka la hore ba hloka mesebetsi.

src_text: it is an investment in the future, in that it supports the broader economic recovery agenda by urgently getting our people to work on improving our national and municipal infrastructure.
tgt_text: ke letsete ho bokamoso, ka ha le tshehetsa ajenda ya ntlafatso ya moruo ka bophara ka ho potlakisa ho netefatsa hore batho ba rona ba sebetsana le ho ntlafatsa meralo ya motheo ya rona ya naha le ya dimmasepaleng.

src_text: through the interventions in the stimulus, we are creating work for those who need it, while leaving a lasting impact on entire communities.
tgt_text: ka bonamodi ba tshusumetso, re tlo theha mesebetsi molemong wa ba hlokang mesebetsi, re ntse re theha kgahlamelo e matla ho batho bohle.

src_text: like public employment programmes across the world, this employment stimulus supports and complements the critical role of the private sector in creating jobs.
tgt_text: jwalo ka mananeo a mesebetsi lefatsheng ka bophara, tshusumetso ena e tshehetsa le ho tshwanela karolo e bohlo kwahlokwa eo lekala la porae fete le nang le yona ho theheng mesebetsi.

src_text: it is countercyclical, in that as the recovery advances, the scale of public employment will decline.
tgt_text: e hlwahlwa, kaha ha ntlafatso e phahama, bo phara ba tlhokeho ya mesebe tsi ya setjhaba e tla fokotseha.

src_text: the work experience and skills acquired by beneficiaries of the presidential employment stimulus will improve their prospects of securing formal employment.
tgt_text: boiphihlello ba mesebetsi le bokgoni bo fumanweng ke ba uneng molemo ho letsholo la tshusumetso ya mesebetsi ya mopresidente ba tla ntlafatsa menyetla ya bona ya ho fumana mesebetsi ka semmuso.

src_text: the experience gained is also a pathway to entrepreneurial activity.
tgt_text: boiphihlelo boo ba bo fumaneng bo ka boela e le mokgwa wa ho iqalla dikgwebo.

src_text: participants will improve their skills and capabilities to start their own businesses, and can use the steady income provided by public employment to branch out into other incomegenerating activities.
tgt_text: bankakarolo ba tla ntlafatsa bokgoni ba bona le boiphihlelo ba ho iqalla dikgwebo tseo e leng tsa bona, mme ba ka sebedisa makeno a tsitseng a tswang ho mesebetsi ya setjhaba ho etsa mekgwa e meng ya ho iketsetsa lekeno.

src_text: i have consistently affirmed that the covid19 crisis is also a window of opportunity to build back better.
tgt_text: ke ntse ke hatella ntlha ya hore qaka ya covid19 e boela e le monyetlo wa hore re ntlafatse moruo wa rona hape.

src_text: at this time of great upheaval, we would be doing ourselves no favours by making unrealistic promises that raise expectations, only to come short when they are not met.
tgt_text: nakong ena ya mathata a maholoholo ha kaale, re tlabe re sa ithuse ka letho ha re ka etsa ditshepiso tseo re senang ho kgona ho di phethahatsa, sena se tla re nyahamisa feela ha re sa kgone ho di fihlella.

src_text: this is why each of the jobs and livelihood support interventions is fully funded, with a clear implementation plan.
tgt_text: ke ka hoo bonamodi bofe kapa bofe ba mosebetsi le tshehetso ya maphelo a batho bo tshehetswang ka matlole ka bo tlalo, ka leano la phethahatso le qaqileng.

src_text: the employment stimulus is not about vague commitments for some time in the future, but about jobs being created right here and now.
tgt_text: tshusumetso ya mesebetsi ha se boitlamo ba ho theha mesebetsi bo fokaelang feela bo tla phethahatswa mmamorao, empa ke leano la ho thehwa ha mesebetsi hona tjena.

src_text: the stimulus is the result of extensive consultation with national departments, provinces and metros to rapidly design employment pro grammes that can be rolled out or expanded within six months.
tgt_text: tshusumetso ena ke se phetho sa dipuisano ka botebo le mafapha a naha, a diprofe nse le metse toropo ka ho po tlakisa ho theha mananeo a tla kengwa tshebetsong kapa a tla atoloswa nakong ya dikgwedi tse tshelela.

src_text: the implementing departments and other stakeholders were rigorously assessed on their capacity to implement.
tgt_text: mafapha a phethahatso le bohle ba nang le seabo ba ile ba hlahlojwa hore na ba na le boiphihlelo ba ho phethahatsa mesebetsi ka kelahloko.

src_text: in every one of the programmes that fall under the stimulus, opportunities will be widely advertised and recruitment will be fair, open and transparent.
tgt_text: ho lenaneo le leng le le leng le ka tlasa tshusumetso ena, menyetla ya ona e tla bapa tswa hohle mme le tsamaiso ya khiro e tla hloka leeme, e be pepeneneng le ho bonahala ho bohle.

src_text: the goals we have set ourselves are realistic, measura ble and achievable, and draw lessons from past experience and international best prac tice.
tgt_text: maikemisetso ao re ipehe tseng ona ke a nnete, ke ao re tla kgonang ho a fihlella le ho a phethahatsa, mme hape re ithutile ho tswa ho tse etsahetseng nakong e fetileng le ho mekgwa ya tshebetso e metle ya matjhabeng.

src_text: our people are ready and willing to work.
tgt_text: batho ba rona ba itukisitse ebile ba ikemiseditse ho sebe tsa.

src_text: this vast potential must be harnessed, and our collective skills and capabilities brought to bear in rebuilding our country in the wake of the coronavirus.
tgt_text: bokgoni bona bo bongata bo tlameha ho tjhoriswa, mme le bokgoni le boiphihlelo ba rona bohle bo lokela hore tswela molemo kahongbotjha ya naha ya rona nakong ena ya kokwanahloko ya corona.

src_text: the presidential employment stimulus provides a respite for families who have endured a long hard winter with greatly reduced income, and for individuals who have spent many years without work.
tgt_text: letsholo la tshusumetso ya mesebetsi ya mopresidente e nehela ka matlole a dithuso ho malapa a ileng a tobana le mariha a boima haholo ka lebaka la phokoletsohadi ya makeno a bona, le ho batho ba qedileng dilemo tse ngatangata ba sa sebetse.

src_text: real, decent work is the right of every human being.
tgt_text: mesebetsi ya nnete, e nang le seriti, ke tokelo ya motho e mong le emong.

src_text: it is a precondition for economic growth and social stability.
tgt_text: ke karolo ya pehelo ya sethathu ya kgolo ya moruo le botsitso ba setjhaba.

src_text: by giving effect to this fundamental right, the presidential employment stimulus is making a decisive contribution to building a society that works.
tgt_text: ho susumetsa moruo o sebetsang vukuzenzele unnamed ho thakgolwa ha letsholo la tshusumetso ya mesebetsi ya mopresidente bekeng e fetileng ho tshwaya phetoho ya mo kgwa oo re neng re o sebedisa ho lwantshana le tlhokeho ya mesebetsi.

src_text: recovery on the horizon for sa vukuzenzele unnamed the jacaranda trees are in full bloom across the nation’s capital, heralding the start of summer.
tgt_text: tsosoloso e motjheng bakeng sa afrika borwa vukuzenzele unnamed difate tsa jacaranda di thuntse hohle motsemoholong wa naha ena, e leng letshwao la hore ho kena lehlabula.

src_text: after a long and difficult winter, the beginning of a new season should fill us with optimism.
tgt_text: kamora hore ho fete mari ha a malelele a bile a le boima, mathwaso a sehla se setjha a tshwanela ho re fa tshepo .

src_text: when the national state of disaster was declared in march, our immediate priority was to contain the spread of the virus and provide emergency relief to citizens, communities, workers and businesses.
tgt_text: ha ho ne ho tsebahatswa ka maemo a koduwa ya naha ka tlhakubele, ntho e neng e le ka sehloohong di sa tloha e ne e le ya hore re kgine ho ata ha kokwanahloko ena re be re fane ka kimollo ya tshoha nyetso ho baahi, setjhabeng, ho basebetsi le dikgwebong.

src_text: over the course of eight months and with the support of our social partners, we rolled out a comprehensive set of measures to limit the social and economic impact of the pandemic.
tgt_text: nakong ya dikgwedi tse robedi, ebile e le ka tshehetso ya balekane ba rona kahisa nong, re ile ra anetsa mehato e phethahetseng ya ho kgina sefutho sa kokwanahloko ena setjhabeng le moruong.

src_text: we massively expanded social protection on a scale that has never been attempted before in this country.
tgt_text: re ile ra nanabetsa tshire letso ya setjhaba ka sekgahla se neng se e so ka se bonwa naheng ena.

src_text: we are one of the few countries in the world where the right of access to social security is enshrined in the constitution, and we can be proud that during this grave crisis we gave practical expression to this right in many ways.
tgt_text: re enngwe ya dinaha tse mmalwa lefa tsheng moo ho yona tokelo ya phihlello ya tshireletso ya setjhaba e fuperweng ke molaotheo, ebile re ka ba motlotlo ka hore nakong ya koduwa ena e mpehadi re ile ra fana ka mohlala o tshwarehang wa tokelo ena ka mekgwa e mengatanyana.

src_text: in addition to our existing social grants, which reach more than 17 million people every month, we toppedup the old age, disability and child support grants.
tgt_text: ho eketsa hodima dithuso tse seng di le teng tsa ditjhe lete tsa setjhaba, tse fihlellang bathong ba kahodimo ho 17 milione kgwedi le kgwedi, re ile ra eketsa dithuso tsa ditjhelete tsa metsofe, tsa dikowa le tsa tshehetso ya bana.

src_text: we rolled out a special coronavirus disease (covid19) social relief of distress grant, which has reached some six million people to date.
tgt_text: re ile ra nanabetsa dithuso tsa ditjhelete tse kgethehileng tsa kimollo ya setjhaba matshwenyehong a covid19 , tse fihlelletseng bathong ba dimilione tse tsheletseng ho fihlela jwale.

src_text: this was done within weeks of the national state of disaster being declared.
tgt_text: sena se ile sa etsuwa na kong ya dibeke tse mmalwa kamora ho phatlalatswa ha maemo a koduwa ya naha.

src_text: the scale of such an undertaking cannot be understated.
tgt_text: sefutho sa boikitlaetso boo se ke ke sa shebelwa fatshe.

src_text: to bring this system online there was extensive collaboration between the south african social security agency, south african revenue service, home affairs and many others.
tgt_text: ho kopanya tsamaiso ena inthaneteng e ne e le mose betsi o boima wa kopane lo dipakeng tsa lekgotla la tshireletso ya setjhaba la afrika borwa (sassa), tshebeletso ya pokello ya lekgetho ya afrika borwa (sars), lefapha la merero ya lehae le tse ding tse ngata.

src_text: we set up a fully automated application and disbursement process, and integrated multiple databases, including the national population register and the unemployment insurance fund (uif) database.
tgt_text: re ile ra qala mosebetsi o phethahetseng wa ho etsa dikopo le wa ditefo, le ho kopanngwa ha mehlodi e mengatanyana ya dideitha, ho akga le ngodiso ya naha ya palo ya setjhaba le mohlo di wa deitha wa inshorense ya ho fellwa ke mosebetsi (uif).

src_text: we set up new application channels like whatsapp and ussd, and created systems with the commercial banks to enable banking detail verification.
tgt_text: re ile ra qala methati e metjha ya ho etsa dikopo e kang ya whatsapp le ussd, ra ba ra thea mekgwatsamaiso le dibanka tse kgolo hore di thuse ka tiiseletso ya dintlha tsa motho tsa ho banka.

src_text: this is a remarkable achievement in a very short space of time.
tgt_text: ena ke katleho e kgolo ka nako e kgutshwane.

src_text: alongside the measures we took to protect and sustain livelihoods, we also supported ailing businesses.
tgt_text: ntle le mehato eo re ileng ra e nka ya ho sireletsa le ho baballa mesebetsi, re ile ra boela ra tshehetsa dikgwebo tse neng di tsherema.

src_text: we provided relief to small businesses in the form of debt relief, finance, tax payment deferrals and other instruments.
tgt_text: re ile ra fana ka kimollo dikgwebong tse nyenyane ka mokgwa wa ho di imolla dikolotong, wa ho di tshehetsa ka ditjhelete, wa ho diehisa ditefo tsa le kgetho le mekgwa e meng.

src_text: we implemented a covid19 loan guarantee scheme to enable businesses to meet their operational expenses during the lockdown, and are currently looking at how this scheme can reach more companies in need.
tgt_text: re ile ra kenya tlhophiso ya tiiseletso ya kadimo ya ditjhelete ya covid19 tshebetsong, e le ho thusa dikgwebo hore di kgone ho fihlella ditshenyehelo tsa tsona tsa tshebetso nakong ya ho kginwa ha metsamao ya batho le ditshebeletso tseo e seng tsa mantlha, mme ha jwale re ntse re sheba hore na tlhophiso ena e ka di fihlella ha jwang dikhamphane tse ngata le ho feta tse hlokang.

src_text: we provided income protection to workers and relief to business owners through the temporary employer relief scheme administered by the uif.
tgt_text: re ile ra fana ka tshireletso ya meputso ya basebetsi le ki mollo ho beng ba dikgwebo ka hore ho etswe tlhophiso ya nakwana ya kimollo ya basebetsi e neng e disitswe ke uif.

src_text: these were all in direct response to an emergency and were by nature temporary.
tgt_text: tsena tsohle di ne di arabe la ka kotloloho maemo a tshohanyetso mme e ne e le tsa nakwana feela.

src_text: some are now coming to an end, while others have been extended as the labour market recovers.
tgt_text: tse ding jwale di tla pheletsong, ha tse ding ho atollotswe nako ya tsona jwaloka ha mebaraka ya bosebetsi e ntse e hlapho helwa.

src_text: the measures we implemented went a long way towards protecting our society from the harsh winds of covid19.
tgt_text: mehato eo re ileng ra e kenya tshebetsong e thusi tse haholo ho sireletseng setjhaba sa habo rona hore se se ke sa tsukutlwa ke maemo a covid19 .

src_text: the additional grants helped to prevent millions of people from falling below the food poverty line.
tgt_text: dithuso tsa ditjhelete tse ekeditsweng di thusitse ho thibela hore dimilione tsa batho di se ke tsa kodumela mosimeng wa bofuma ba lephako.

src_text: had we not intervened to secure livelihoods and save businesses, the living conditions of our people and the circumstances of thousands of businesses would have been considerably worse.
tgt_text: ha re ne re sa ka ra kena dipakeng ho sireletsa mese betsi le ho pholosa dikgwebo, maemo a ho phela a batho ba habo rona le maemo a dikete kete tsa dikgwebo a ka be a mpefetse le ho feta.

src_text: now we are in a transition from relief to recovery.
tgt_text: jwale re mothating wa phetoho ya ho tloha kimo llong ho ya boiphumanong.

src_text: the emergency measures we put in place have laid a firm foundation on which to rebuild our economy.
tgt_text: mehato ya tshohanyetso eo re ileng ra e kenya tshebe tsong e radile motheo o ti ileng oo re tla ahella moruo wa habo rona hodima ona.

src_text: as our focus now shifts to the implementation of the economic reconstruction and recovery plan, our priority will be to stimulate growth and create jobs.
tgt_text: jwaloka ha tsepamiso ya rona ya maikutlo jwale e feto hetse ho kenngweng tshebe tsong ha leano la kahobotjha le ntlafatso ya moruo, ntlha ya rona e ka sehloohong e tla ba ho susumetsa kgolo le ho thea mesebetsi.

src_text: there has already been progress in a number of areas.
tgt_text: ho se ho e na le kgatelopele mapatlelong a mangata nyana.

src_text: we are seeing new funding commitments for infrastructure development following an infrastructure project roundtable last week.
tgt_text: re bona boitlamo bo botjha ba ho kenya tjhelete bakeng sa kaho ya meralo ya motheo kamora motshetshetho o bileng teng bekeng e fetileng o neng o le mabapi le projeke ya meralo ya motheo.

src_text: a number of employment programmes under the presidential employment stimulus have started.
tgt_text: mananeo a mangatanyana a kgiro a katlasa ditsiane tsa kgiro tsa moporesidente a se a qadile.

src_text: we are pushing ahead with economic reforms in areas such as energy and telecommunications.
tgt_text: re hahamalla pele ka ditlhabollo tsa moruo mapatlelong a kang a eneji le a dikgokahanyo tsa mehala.

src_text: plans are being converted to action and commitments are being reflected in jobs and opportunities.
tgt_text: merero e fetolwa hore e be diketso ha boikitlaetso bona bo bonahala mesebetsing le menyetleng.

src_text: it is all the more critical at this time, more so with the festive season approaching, that we do not become the architects of our own undoing.
tgt_text: tsohle di hlokolotsi haho lwanyane mothating wa jwale, haholoholo jwaloka ha ho atamela sehla sa monyaka wa mafelo a selemo, hore re se ke ra fetoha baitshenyetsi.

src_text: the greatest vigilance is required from us all to keep the virus at bay.
tgt_text: phadimeho e kgolo e a hlokeha ho rona bohle, re tsebe ho boloka kokwanahlo ko ena e le hojana le rona.

src_text: a resurgence at any scale will not just dramatically reverse our health gains.
tgt_text: ho ropoha botjha ha yona neng kapa neng ha ho no busetsa morao dikatleho tsa rona tsa bophelo bo botle feela, empa ho tla kwebetella makgabane a tsosoloso ya moruo a seng a hlahelletse, ho be ho re tlose mathwasong a selemo ho re busetse morao mariheng.

src_text: it will choke the green shoots of economic recovery that have emerged, and take us back from spring to winter.
tgt_text: ho thibela leqhubu la bobedi la ditshwaetso tsa covid19 , re tlameha ho ikamahanya le ditataiso tse ntseng di le teng tsa bophelo bo botle ba setjhaba.

src_text: to prevent a second wave of covid19 infections, we must observe the public health guidelines that remain in place.
tgt_text: haeba re hloleha ho kgwesa sekwahelanko le molomo moo ho kgobokaneng batho, haeba re ya diketsahalong tseo ho tsona ho subuhle llaneng batho, ha re ipee borona le ba bang feela tlokotsing, re boela re bea le tsosoloso ya moruo wa habo rona kotsing.

src_text: when we fail to wear a mask at a social gathering, when we attend crowded events, we are not only putting ourselves and others at risk.
tgt_text: bohle ha re nneng re tswe lepele ho etsa letsoho la monna.

src_text: we are also putting our economic recovery in jeopardy.
tgt_text: diketso tse ntle tsa ho kgwe sa sekwahelanko le molomo, tsa ho qaqolohana le tsa ho hatlela matsoho kgafetsa di re thusitse ho fenya ditla morao tse mpempe tsa sewa sena.

src_text: let us all continue to play our part.
tgt_text: e ntse e le tsona tseo e leng thebe ya rona e ntle ka ho fetisisa.

src_text: the positive actions of wearing a mask, of maintaining social distancing and of regular hand washing helped us overcome the worst effects of the pandemic.
tgt_text: ha re hopoleng boitelo boo bohle re ileng ra tlameha ho bo etsa e le ho kgina ho ata ha kokwanahloko ena ma tsatsing a yona a pele.

src_text: they are still our best defence.
tgt_text: esita leha boholo ba dike tsahalo tsa kahisano le tsa moruo di thakgohile hape, re ntse re tshwanela ho hlo mpha mehato yohle ya bophelo bo botle.

src_text: let us remember the sacrifices we all had to make to contain the spread of the virus in the early days.
tgt_text: tsosoloso e motjheng bakeng sa afrika borwa vukuzenzele unnamed difate tsa jacaranda di thuntse hohle motsemoholong wa naha ena, e leng letshwao la hore ho kena lehlabula.

src_text: sa overcoming hiv and aids vukuzenzele unnamed as we continue our efforts to manage the devastating coronavirus pandemic, we cannot ignore the other public health challenges that our country faces.
tgt_text: afrika borwa e hlola hiv le aids vukuzenzele unnamed ha re ntse retswella ka maiteko a rona a ho laola sewa sena se re thefutseng sa kokwanahloko ya corona , ha hona hore re ka iphapanyetsa diphephetso tse ding tsa bophelo bo botle tseo naha ya rona e kopanang le tsona.

src_text: for more than three dec ades, our country has been engaged in an ongoing struggle against hiv and aids, which has cost many lives and caused great hardship and suffering.
tgt_text: ka dilemo tse fetang mashome a mararo, esale naha ya rona e ntse e lwantshana le bothata ba phamokate (hiv) le lefu la phamokate (aids), bo ileng ba baka tahlahelo ya maphelo a mangata le ho baka ditsietsi le tshotleho e kgolohadi.

src_text: since the outbreak of cov id19 in the country, with the nationwide lockdown and the pressure on our health facilities, many hiv , aids and tuberculosis services have suffered.
tgt_text: ho tloha maqalong a sewa sa covid19 naheng, le ho kwalwa ha naha ka kakaretso le kgatello ho ditsha tsa bophelo bo botle, boholo ba ditshebeletso tsa hiv , aids le lefuba (tb) di ile tsa kgahlamelwa hampe.

src_text: this has posed a challenge for people testing and starting antiretroviral treatment.
tgt_text: sena se bakile phephetso ho batho ba etsang diteko le ho qala ka pheko ya meriana ya arv .

src_text: many people found it difficult to collect their medicines and fewer people accessed other services, such as voluntary male medical circumcision.
tgt_text: boholo ba batho ba fumane ho le boima ho phaka meriana ya bona mme ke batho ba mmalwa feela ba ileng ba kgona ho fumantshwa ditshebeletso tse itseng, tse jwalo ka ho bolotswa ha banna ka bongaka ka boithaupi.

src_text: at the same time, there are many lessons that have been learnt from our public health response to the coronavirus pandemic that can strengthen our fight against hiv and tb.
tgt_text: ka mokgwa o tshwanang, re boetse re ithutile dintho tse ngata ho tswa ho karabelo ya rona ya ditshebeletso tsa bophelo bo botle ka sewa sa kokwanahloko ya corona tse ka matlafatsang ntwa ya rona kgahlano le hiv le tb.

src_text: south africa continues to have the largest number of people living with hiv in the world.
tgt_text: afrika borwa e tswella ho ba le palo e kgolo ya batho ba phelang ka hiv lefatsheng.

src_text: it is encouraging, however, that over the last decade we made progress in reducing the number of new hiv infections in the population by nearly 60%.
tgt_text: feela, ho a kgothatsa hore dilemong tse leshome tse fetileng re ﬁ hletse kgatelopele ho fokotseng palo e ntjha ya ditshwaetso tsa hiv setjhabeng sa rona ka boholo bo batlileng bo lekana le 60%.

src_text: it is also encouraging that hiv infections in adolescent girls and young women have significantly declined in the last decade.
tgt_text: ho boela ho kgothatsa hore tshwaetso ya hiv barwetsaneng le dikgarebe e theohile haholo dilemong tse leshome tse fetileng.

src_text: this is a crucial group because they are much more likely to be at risk of getting hiv .
tgt_text: sena ke sehlopha sa baahi se bohlokwa haholo hobane ke bona ba ka bang kotsing e kgolokgolo ya ho tshwaetswa ke hiv .

src_text: our treatment programme has contributed to a reduction in the number of deaths due to aids by 60%.
tgt_text: lenaneo la rona la pheko le bile le seabo ho fokotseng palo ya mafu a bakwang ke aids ka 60%.

src_text: there has been a greater reduction in hivrelated deaths among young people.
tgt_text: ho bile le phokotseho e kgolo mafung a amanang le hiv batjheng.

src_text: it was possible to reduce the number of deaths because we, together with our partners, have rolled out an extensive antiretroviral programme reaching millions of people living with the disease.
tgt_text: re ile ra kgonahala ho fokotsa dipalo tsa mafu hobane, ha mmoho le balekane ba rona, re ile ra kenya lenaneo le leholo la meriana ya arv le ileng la ﬁ hlella dimilione tsa batho ba phelang ka lefu lena.

src_text: at the beginning of the decade, our programme to prevent mother to child transmission (pmtct) of hiv had very low coverage.
tgt_text: maqalong a dilemo tse leshome, lenaneo la rona la ho thibela tshwaetso ya mme leseeng (pmtct) ka hiv le ne le sa phatlalatswa haholo.

src_text: now we have one of the highest rates of coverage of pmtct in southern africa, which has substantially reduced rates of infection among children.
tgt_text: ha jwale re se re ena le palo e hodimodimo ka ho fetisisa dinaheng tsa borwa ba afrika, e leng se fokoditseng haholo dipalo tsa tshwaetso baneng.

src_text: while we have reduced deaths and new infections, we still are far from reaching the goal we committed ourselves in 2016 of achieving a 75% reduction in hiv infections by 2020. if we succeed in doing so, we are likely to end aids as a public health threat by 2030. unfortunately, we are not there yet.
tgt_text: le ha feela re fokoditse mafu le ditshwaetso tse ntjha, re ntse re le hole le ho ﬁ hlella maikemisetso a rona ao re ikanneng ka ona ka 2016 a ho ﬁ hlella 75% ya phokotso ya ditshwaetso tsa hiv ka 2020. ha re ka atleha ho etsa sena, re ka kgona ho fedisa aids jwalo ka kotsi e kgahlano le bophelo bo botle ka 2030. ka maswabi, ha re so ﬁ hle moo.

src_text: we have to do far more to ensure that young people are empowered to prevent infections, including through changing behaviour, accessing condoms and testing regularly.
tgt_text: re tlameha ho etsa dintho tse ding tse ngata ho netefatsa hore batjha ba rona ba matlafaditswe ka ho thibela ditshwaetso, ho kenyeletsa ho fetola maitshwaro a bona, ho fumantshwa dikgohlopo le ho etsa diteko kgafetsa.

src_text: we need to make sure that everyone who is infected has access to treatment and care.
tgt_text: re hloka ho netefatsa hore bohle ba nang le tshwaetso ba fumantshwa pheko le tlhokomelo.

src_text: we need to work harder on hiv prevention among key populations, including sex workers, men who have sex with men, and people who inject drugs.
tgt_text: re hloka ho sebetsa ka thatathata ho thibela tshwaetso ya hiv haholoholo ho ditho tsa setjhaba tse nang le kgonahalo e hodimo ya ho tshwaetseha, tse kenyeletsang basebetsi ba rekisang mmele, banna ba etsang thobalano le banna ba bang, le batho ba itlhabang ka dithethefatsi.

src_text: we must end the stigma and discrimination towards these populations.
tgt_text: re tlameha ho fedisa sekgobo le kgethollo e kgahlano le batho bana.

src_text: we cannot hope to end hiv if we ignore the needs, concerns and rights of any part of our population.
tgt_text: re ka se tshepe feela hore re tla fedisa hiv haeba re iphapanyetsa ditlhoko, dingongoreho le ditokelo tsa karolo e fe kapa e fe ya setjhaba sa rona.

src_text: south africa needs to increase efforts to medically circumcise young men to reduce their risk of acquiring hiv .
tgt_text: afrika borwa e hloka ho eketsa maiteko a ho bolotsa bahlankana ka bongaka ho fokotsa kotsi ya bona ya ho tshwaetswa ke hiv .

src_text: unsafe circumcision should not leave young men with lifelong health problems, and no one should die from circumcision.
tgt_text: ho bolotswa ho sa bolokehang ha ho a tlameha ho siya bahlankana ba rona ba ena le mathata a bophelo bo botle ka ho sa feleng, mme ha ho motho ya tlameha ho hlokahala ka lebaka la ho bolotswa.

src_text: we must make sure that young men have safe circumcision.
tgt_text: re tlameha ho netefatsa hore bahlankana ba rona ba bolotswa ka tsela e bolokehileng.
