src_text: we are encouraged by findings of a recent study on preexposure prophylaxis (prep).
tgt_text: re kgothaditswe ke sephetho sa diphuputsu tsa hauﬁ nyana tjena tse buang ka meriana ya ho thibela tshwaetseha (prep).

src_text: unlike antiretroviral treatment that is given to people who are hiv positive, prep involves the regular use of antiretroviral drugs by hiv negative people to prevention infection.
tgt_text: e fapane ho arv ka ha pheko ya arv e fuwa batho ba nang le tshwaetso ya hiv , prep yona e le pheko e sebediswang kgafetsa ke batho ba senang hiv ho thibela tshwaetso.

src_text: the study, conducted by scientists from the hiv prevention trials network, found that longacting injections once every eight weeks was better than the daily tablet used for hiv prevention.
tgt_text: diphuputsu tsena, tse entsweng ke ditsebi tsa saene tsa marangrang a diteko tsa thibelo ya hiv , di fumane hore ho hlajwa ha nngwe ka mora dibeke tse robedi ha diente tse sebetsang ka nako e telele ho betere ho feta ho nwa pidisi e thibelang hiv e nwewang letsatsi le letsatsi.

src_text: these findings have the potential to significantly strengthen our response to the epidemic.
tgt_text: diphetho tsena di na le bokgoni bo boholo ba ho ka matlafatsa karabelo ya sewa sena.

src_text: if we are to succeed in ending aids as a public health threat within the next decade, we need to combine these medical breakthroughs with fundamental changes in behaviour.
tgt_text: haeba re ikemiseditse ho atleha ho fedisa aids jwalo ka kotsi e kgahlano le bophelo bo botle dilemong tsena tse leshome, re hloka ho kopantsha ditshibollo tsa bongaka le ho fetola maitshwaro ka botebo.

src_text: we also need to tackle the economic and social conditions that contrib ute to high rates of infection.
tgt_text: re boela re hloka ho lwantshana le maemo a moru le a bophelo a bakang dipalo tse hodimo tsa tshwaetso.

src_text: one of our central tasks is to empower adolescent girls and young women, educationally, economically and socially.
tgt_text: e nngwe ya dithomo tsa rona e ka sehlohlong ke ho matlafatsa barwetsana le dikgarebe, ka thuto, moruo le maemo a bophelo setjhabeng.

src_text: they need to be able to make their own decisions about every aspect of their lives, including their sexuality and sexual behaviour.
tgt_text: ba hloka ho kgona ho inkela diqeto ka karolo e nngwe le e nngwe ya maphelo a bona, ho kenyeletsa maikutlo le maitshwaro a bona ka thobalano.

src_text: ultimately, we will achieve the end of aids through the empowerment of young people, women and other people at risk.
tgt_text: qetellong, re tla ﬁ hlella phediso ya aids ka ho matlafatsa batjha, basadi le batho ba bang ba kotsing.

src_text: this includes empowerment through access to information, advice and support.
tgt_text: sena se kenyeletsa matlafatso ka phumantsho ya lesedi, dikeletso le tshehetso.

src_text: it includes access to education and economic opportunities, especially for young women.
tgt_text: se kenyeletsa phumantsho ya thuto le menyetla ya moruo, haholoholo ho barwetsana.

src_text: empowerment also means that every person must have access to testing, treatment and other health services.
tgt_text: matlafatso e boela e bolela hore motho e mong le e mong o tlameha ho fumantshwa diteko, pheko le ditshebeletso tse ding tsa bophelo bo botle.

src_text: the people of south africa have come so far, endured so much and made such great progress in the fight against hiv , aids and tuberculosis.
tgt_text: ho fihlela ha jwale, batho ba afrika borwa ba ﬁ hleletse kgatelopele e ngata, ba mamella tse ngata le ho ﬁ hlella kgatelopele e kgolo twantshong ya hiv , aids le tb.

src_text: let us intensify both our resolve and our actions to confront and overcome aids once and for all.
tgt_text: afrika borwa e hlola hiv le aids vukuzenzele unnamed ha re ntse retswella ka maiteko a rona a ho laola sewa sena se re thefutseng sa kokwanahloko ya corona , ha hona hore re ka iphapanyetsa diphephetso tse ding tsa bophelo bo botle tseo naha ya rona e kopanang le tsona.

src_text: a better 2021 for all south africans the first weeks of the year have been difficult for all south africans.
tgt_text: 2021 e betere ho maafrika borwa ohledibeke tsa pele tsa selemo e bile tse boima ho maafrika borwa ohle.

src_text: vukuzenzele unnamed the coronavirus pandemic has gotten worse, with new infections increasing far faster and far higher than before.
tgt_text: vukuzenzele unnamed koduwa ya kokwanahloko ya corona e ile ya mpefala haholo, mme le tshwaetso tse ntjha tsa eketseha ka sekgahla se seholo se fetang sa pele.

src_text: hospitals have been under great strain as more people have needed medical attention.
tgt_text: dipetlele di ile tsa ba tlasa kgatello e kgolo jwalo ka ha bongata ba batho bo ile ba hloka tlhokomelo ya bongaka.

src_text: while most economic sectors have been able to operate again for several months, it will take some time for the economy to recover and for lost jobs to be restored.
tgt_text: leha dikarolo tse ngata tsa moruo di kgonne ho sebetsa hape dikgwedi tse mmalwa, ho sa tla nka nako hore moruo o boele o setlele esitana le yona mesebetsi e lahlehileng hore e boele e fumanehe.

src_text: as the new year starts, many families are still feeling the effects of the pandemic on their lives and livelihoods.
tgt_text: jwalo ka ha selemo se setjha se qala, malapa a mangata a ntse a utlwela ditlamorao tsa koduwa ena maphelong a ona le moo a phelang teng.

src_text: the world is now entering the second year of the coronavirus pandemic.
tgt_text: lefatshe ka bophara jwale le kena selemong sa bobedi sa koduwa ena ya kokwanahloko ya corona.

src_text: for south africa, as for most countries around the world, the year 2021 will be extremely challenging.
tgt_text: afrika borwa jwalo ka dinaha tse ding tse ngata tsa lefatshe, selemo sa 2021 e tla ba se nang le phephetso e kgolo haholo.

src_text: the second wave of covid19 infections may well be followed by further waves, which will threaten both the health of our people and the recovery of our economy.
tgt_text: leqhubu la bobedi la tshwaetso ya covid19 le ka latelwa ke a mang a ka kgahlapetsang maphelo a batho ba rona le yona tsoseletso ya moruo wa rona.

src_text: difficult as this year will be, i am certain that we will overcome the pandemic and set our country firmly on the path to recovery.
tgt_text: selemo sena se le boima se le jwalo, empa ke na le tshepo ya hore re tla e hlola koduwa ena mme re thehe tsela e yang tsoseletsong.

src_text: my confidence comes from the south african people.
tgt_text: tshepo ya ka e tswa ho maafrika borwa.

src_text: if i look at how south africans responded to this crisis from the moment the virus arrived on our shores, i have no doubt that we have the resilience, discipline and ability to defeat this disease.
tgt_text: ha ke sheba tsela eo maafrika borwa a ileng a arabela ka yona bothateng bona ho tloha ha kokwanahloko ena e ne e fihla naheng ya habo rona, ha ke qeaqee hore re na le mamello, tiisetso esitana le bona bokgoni ba ho hlola bohloko bona.

src_text: certainly there were exceptions, but the vast majority of south africans understood the need for restrictions on their movement and activities, and complied with the regulations that we had to put in place.
tgt_text: teng ho bile le phapang moo le moo, empa bongata ba maafrika borwa bo utlwisisitse tlhokeho ya ho kginwa ha metsamao le mesebetsi ya ona, mme a ikobela le melao e behilweng.

src_text: even more important than compliance, most south africans took responsibility for themselves and for others, following advice on issues like social distancing, wearing a mask and hand washing.
tgt_text: se bileng bohlokwa haholo le ho feta ho ikobela melao, ke hore maafrika borwa a mangata a ile a nka boikarabelo bakeng sa ona le ba bang, a latela dikeletso mabapi le dintlha tse kang ho se atamellane le batho ba bang, ho apara sefonyo esitana le ho hlapa matsoho.

src_text: and where we fell short, we have, sadly, seen the consequences.
tgt_text: moo re ileng ra haellwa teng, ka bomadimabe, re bone ditlamorao tse bosula.

src_text: we now know about the risks of closed spaces and crowded gatherings, of not wearing masks and not keeping our distance from others.
tgt_text: re a tseba jwale kotsi ya tshubuhlellano le ho ba mokguping, ho se apare sefonyo le ho se ipehe thoko le ba bang.

src_text: this bodes well for the year ahead.
tgt_text: sena ke tlhokomediso bakeng sa selemo sena seo re leng ho sona.

src_text: we now know much more about the disease and how to prevent its spread.
tgt_text: jwale se re tseba haholwanyane ka bohloko bona le hore re ka thibela ho ata ha bona jwang.

src_text: and despite what one could call ‘pandemic fatigue’, we are no less determined as south africans to do what needs to be done.
tgt_text: le ho siya taba ya hore re se re 'kgathetse ke koduwa' ena, jwalo ka maafrika borwa, re na le tshepo ya ho etsa se tlamehang ho etswa.

src_text: as we adhere even more rigorously to the basic prevention measures, we will also be rolling out a mass vaccination campaign.
tgt_text: jwalo ka ha re ntse re ikobela ka thata dipehelo tsa ho thibela bohloko bona, re boetse hape re kena letsholong le leholo la ho hlaba setjhaba ka ente e thibelang bohloko bona.

src_text: as more and more people are vaccinated, we will both save lives and progressively reduce the risk of infection across the population.
tgt_text: ho entwa ha batho ka bongata, ho tla pholosa maphelo a mangata, ho boele hape ho theole kotsi ya tshwaetso setjhabeng.

src_text: getting enough vaccines as quickly as possible – and making sure that they reach the people who need them – will be one of the biggest tasks of the year.
tgt_text: ho fumana ente e lekaneng ka potlako – le ho netefatsa hore e finyella bathong ba e hlokang – e tla ba o mong wa mesebetsi e meholo selemong sena.

src_text: this will be particularly challenging as every country in the world is clamouring to secure a limited supply of vaccines.
tgt_text: sena e tla ba bothatanyana jwalo ka ha dinaha tsohle tsa lefatshe di leka ho fumana ente ena e so kang e fumaneha ka bongata.

src_text: but we are hard at work with partners in business, labour and civil society to make this happen.
tgt_text: leha ho le jwalo, re sebetsa mmoho le mahlahana a rona ho tsa kgwebo, mekgatlo ya basebetsi le ya setjhaba ho fihlela sena.

src_text: we are working on several fronts to get vaccines, including through the global covax facility, the african union initiative and through our own engagements with vaccine manufacturers.
tgt_text: re leka ho fumana ente ena dibakeng tse fapafapaneng tse kenyeletsang mokgatlo wa matjhaba wa covax, mokgatlong wa dinaha tsa afrika re boetse hape re buisana ka kotloloho le bahlahisi ba diente tsena.

src_text: as we act together to overcome the pandemic, we will need to work together to rebuild and transform our economy.
tgt_text: jwalo ka ha re sebetsa mmoho ho lwantsha koduwa ena, re tlameha ho boela re sebetsa mmoho ho tsoseletsa le ho fetola moruo wa rona.

src_text: we have both the ability and the will to stimulate economic activity, grow our economy and create jobs.
tgt_text: re na le bokgoni le tabatabelo tsa ho tsosolosa le ho nyolla moruo esitana le hona ho theha mesebetsi.

src_text: and to do so in the midst of a pandemic.
tgt_text: re tlameha ho etsa sena re ntse re tjamelane le koduwa ena.

src_text: public finances are under extreme strain, now even more so because of the cost of our health response to covid19 and the social and economic relief measures we put in place to assist businesses and poor households.
tgt_text: ditjhelete tsa setjhaba di tlasa kgatello e kgolo, haholoholo ka lebaka la ditjeho tsa bophelo bo botle twantshanong le covid19 esitana le tshehetso eo re fanang ka yona dikgwebong le malapeng a futsanehileng.

src_text: the contraction of the economy also meant that tax revenue has declined significantly.
tgt_text: ho putlama hona ha moruo ho boetse ho bolela le ho theoha haholo ha lekgetho le kenang.

src_text: there are some parts of the economy that will take longer to recover due to lower global demand generally and restrictions on international travel.
tgt_text: ho na le dikarolo tse ding tsa moruo tse tla nka nako ho tsoseletseha ka lebaka la sekgahla se tlase sa tlhokeho ya ditshebeletso tsa tsona lefatsheng ka bophara, le ka lebaka la ho kginwa ha maeto a matjhaba.

src_text: that is why we need to be innovative and focused in our plans to rebuild the economy.
tgt_text: ke ka hona re tlamehang ho shebana le ntjhafatso esitana le ona maano a rona a ho aha moruo botjha.

src_text: significantly, the economic reconstruction and recovery plan that we announced in october last year is based on broad consensus among all social part ners on the actions needed to rebuild the economy.
tgt_text: hantlentle, leano la tsoseletso ya moruo leo re le phatlaladitseng ka mphalane ngwahola, le thehilwe tumellanong le mahlahana a rona ka mehato e hlokahalang kahong botjha ya moruo.

src_text: this lays a firm basis for effective cooperation that draws on the resources, capabilities and energies of all sections of society.
tgt_text: sena ke motheo o matla wa tshebedisano mmoho e radilweng ka disebediswa, bokgoni le matla dikarolong tsohle tsa setjhaba.

src_text: we are seeing this in various practical ways.
tgt_text: re bona sena se etsahala ka ditsela tse fapafapaneng.

src_text: for example, we have been working closely with private funders and multilateral development institutions to prepare infrastructure projects in areas like transport, human settlements, water and telecommunications.
tgt_text: mohlala, haesale re sebedisana mmoho le batshehetsi ba ikemetseng ba ditjhelete le mekgatlo e fapafapaneng ya ntshetsopele ho rala diprojeke tsa dibopeho tsa motheo dikarolong tse kang tsa dipalangwang, ho dudiswa ha batho, metsi le tsa kgokahano.

src_text: using the infrastructure fund as one of the vehicles, we are developing funding models for these projects that draw on several sources in both the public and private sectors.
tgt_text: ka ho sebedisa letlole la dibopeho tsa motheo jwalo ka o mong wa mekgwa ya tshebetso, re theha mekga ya diprojeke mehloding e fapafapaneng ho tswa ka bobedi, mmusong le makaleng a ikemetseng.

src_text: this is particularly important at a time when public finances are limited.
tgt_text: sena se bohlokwa haholo nakong eo ditjhelete tsa setjhaba di fokolang.

src_text: the presidential employment stimulus is another example of partnership in action.
tgt_text: o mong wa mehlala ya tshebedisano mmoho ena ke leano la kgiro la mopresidente.

src_text: understanding that it will take time for economic growth to translate into private sector employment, we have launched the employment stimulus to start creat ing work opportunities now.
tgt_text: jwalo ka ha re utlwisisa hore ho tla nka nako e telele hore kgolo ya moruo e thehe menyetla ya mesebetsi lekaleng le ikemetseng, re thehile leano la kgiro ho qala ho theha menyetla ya mesebetsi hona jwale.

src_text: this programme is being coordinated from the presiden cy, but is being implemented by a range of government departments and different spheres.
tgt_text: leano lena le laolwa ke kantoro ya mopresidente, empa le kengwa tshebetsong ke mafapha a fapafapaneng maemong a fapafapaneng a mmuso.

src_text: through this programme, tens of thousands of unemployed people are able to both earn and learn as they provide valuable social services.
tgt_text: ka lona leano lena, dikete tse balwang ka mashome tsa batho ba sa sebetseng di kgona ho fumana manyane le hona ho ithuta jwalo ka ha ba fana ka ditshebeletso tsa bohlokwa setjhabeng.

src_text: in time, this programme will include a ‘social employment’ part, where we will partner with other social actors to employ people in a variety of activities – from improving food security, to tackling genderbased violence to upgrading informal settlements – that all contribute to the common good.
tgt_text: ha nako e ntse e tsamaya, leano lena le tla kenyeletsa karolo ya 'kgiro ya setjhaba' moo re tlang ho sebedisana mmoho le basebeletsi setjhabeng ho hira batho ho etsa mesebetsi e fapafapaneng – ho tloha ntlafatsong ya pokeletso ya dijo ho ya twantshong ya tlhekefetso ya bonng ho isa ntlafatsong ya bodulo dibakeng tsa baipehi – tseo kaofela e leng ketso tse molemo haholo.

src_text: all this work is being reinforced by an aggressive focus on those economic reforms that will have the greatest focus on growth.
tgt_text: mosebetsi ona kaofela o matlafaditswe ke ho shebana ka matla le dintlafatso tsa moruo tse tla shebana le kgolo ya ona.

src_text: these include the expansion of electricity generation capacity, making our ports more efficient and competitive, improving access to affordable broadband, and improving turnaround times for water, mining and other licenses.
tgt_text: tsona di kenyeletsa kgudiso ya ho fehlwa ha motlakase, ho etsa boemakepe bo sebetsang ka nepo le bo maemong, ho ntlafatsa kgokahano e ditjeho di fihlellehang ya inthanethe, mmoho le kgutsufatso ya nako ya ho fumana dilayesense tsa phepelo ya metsi, merafo le tse ding.

src_text: these efforts are being coordinated and monitored jointly by my office and national treasury.
tgt_text: maano ana a laolwa le hona ho behwa leihlo ka kopanelo ke kantoro ya ka esitana le kantoro ya naha ya matlotlo.

src_text: there is much to be done in the year ahead.
tgt_text: mosebetsi o tlamehang ho etswa o sa le moholo ha selemo se ntse se tsamaya.

src_text: and we should be in no doubt that we will have to confront many daunting challenges.
tgt_text: ka hodimo ho moo, re tlameha ho tseba hore ha ho qeaqeo, re tla teana le diphephetso tse ngata.

src_text: but we have shown that, as a nation, we are able to succeed when we work together in pursuit of a common purpose.
tgt_text: leha ho le jwalo, jwalo ka setjhaba re a kgona ho fihlela maikemisetso a rona ha feela re sebedisana mmoho.

src_text: if we remember that, and if we put our unity into action, we will ensure that 2021 brings better health and better lives to all our people.
tgt_text: ha re ka hopola seo, mme ra sebedisana mmoho, re ka netefatsa hore 2021 e tlisetsa batho bohle maemo a betere a tsa bophelo bo botle esitana le a moo ba phelang teng.

src_text: i wish you all the best for the new year.
tgt_text: 2021 e betere ho maafrika borwa ohledibeke tsa pele tsa selemo e bile tse boima ho maafrika borwa ohle.

src_text: an honour to lead the african union vukuzenzele unnamed south africa’s term as chair of the african union has come to an end.
tgt_text: ke tlotla hore re ile ra fuwa monyetla wa ho etella pele mokgatlo wa dinaha tsa afrika (au) vukuzenzele unnamed sehla sa afrika bo rwa sa ho ba moe tapele wa au se fi hlile pheletsong.

src_text: as we reflect on our year in this position, i am reminded of the old saying that ‘in crisis lies opportunity’.
tgt_text: ha re hetla morao moo selemo sa rona se qadileng teng re le maemong ana, ke hopola mantswe a kgale a reng ‘ka hara bobe bo bong le bo bong ho na le botle’.

src_text: ours was a baptism of fire, having assumed the chairship in the same month the first case of coronavirus was reported on the continent.
tgt_text: rona re bile le kolobetso ya mollo, jwalo ka ha re bile badulasetulo ka kgwedi e ho bileng le tlaleho ya pele ya motho a nang le kokwanahloko ya corona ka hara kontinente.

src_text: the priorities we outlined for our term, among them furthering peace and security, the economic empowerment of women and deepening economic integration, had to be immediately and dramatically reoriented to deal with the pandemic.
tgt_text: maano ao re neng re a beile ka pele sehleng sa rona, a a kgang ntshetsopele ya kgotso le tshireletso, matlafatso ya basadi moruong le ho tebisa ho kopana ha moruo, a ile a tlameha ho phephethwa hanghang ho sa lebellwa, hore fela ho tsebe ho mekamekanwa le sewa sena.

src_text: our most pressing task was to steer the focus of the african union to addressing the worst global emergency in over a century.
tgt_text: mosebetsi o neng o re peteditse haholo e bile wa ho tsepamisa maikutlo a au ho phumano ya tharollo ya koduwa ena e mpehadi ka ho fetisisa lefatshe ka bophara dilemong tse fetang tse le kgolo tse fetileng.

src_text: covid19 has affected all the countries on the continent.
tgt_text: covid19 e amme dinaha tsohle kontinenteng.

src_text: to date there are more than 3.5 million confirmed cases in africa, and more than 88,000 people have died.
tgt_text: ho fihlela hajwale, ho na le batho ba dimiliyone tse tharo le halofo ba ho tsejwang hore ba na le covid19 ka hara afrika, mme ba fetang 88 000 ba hlokahetse.

src_text: it has been a health, humanitarian, social and economic crisis for african countries, most of whom are inadequately resourced to manage a health emergency of this size.
tgt_text: e bile bothata bo boholo ditheong tsa bophelo, botho, phedisano le moruo bakeng sa dinaha tsa afrika, tseo bongata ba tsona di hae llwang ke disebediswa tsa ho laola koduwa ya bophelo e kgolo ha kana.

src_text: and yet, as unprecedented as the nature of the pandemic has been, so too has been the manner in which african countries have come together to fight it.
tgt_text: le ha e le mona sewa sena se bile seholo ha kana, ho bile jwalo fela le ka mokgwa oo dinaha tsa afrika di ileng tsa ipopa ngatana nngwe twantshong ya sona ka teng.

src_text: in doing so we have drawn principally on the continent’s own expertise, capabilities and institutions such as the africa centres for disease control and prevention (africa cdc).
tgt_text: ka ho etsa seo, haholoholo re tshepetse tsebong, bokgo ning le ditheong tsa konti nente tse jwalo ka ditheo tsa afrika tsa taolo le thibelo ya mahloko (africa cdc).

src_text: africa did not sit by passively as the true extent and danger of the pandemic unfurled.
tgt_text: afrika ha e a ka ya iketla ya phutha matsoho ya shebella ha sewa sena se kotsi se ntse se nama.

src_text: from the earliest days of the pandemic and led by the au, we swiftly developed a continental response strategy, driven by the africa cdc and regional task forces.
tgt_text: ho tloha qalong ya sewa sena re ntse re etelletswe pele ke au, re ile ra etsa leano la ho se phallela ka potlako ka thuso ya africa cdc mmoho le dihlopha tsa tshebetso tsa mabatowa a kontinente.

src_text: we realised that every country on the continent would be severely affected by the pandemic.
tgt_text: re ile ra elellwa hore naha enngwe le enngwe kontinenteng e tlo angwa hampe ke sewa sena.

src_text: most would not have the resources needed to meet the public health challenge or to protect their economies.
tgt_text: bongata ba tsona di ne di ke ke tsa ba le disebediswa tse hlokahalang bakeng sa ho rarolla mathata a bophelo a setjhaba kapa ho tshireletsa meruo ya tsona.

src_text: we therefore agreed as african countries to appoint several prominent africans as special envoys, who would engage with international funders and multilateral institutions to make the case for financial support and debt relief on africa’s behalf.
tgt_text: ka hoo, jwalo ka dinaha tsa afrika re dumellane ho kgetha maaforika a hlaheletseng ka mahetla jwalo ka baemedi ba kgethehileng, ba tla bua le batshehetsi ba tjhelete ba matjhabatjhaba le ditheo tsa dipuso tse fapaneng bakeng sa ho tshehetsa ka tjhelete le kimollo ya mekitlane ya afrika.

src_text: in this way, working as a one continent, we were able to achieve debt relief for many countries and financial assistance towards our covid response and economic recovery.
tgt_text: ka mokgwa ona wa ho sebetsa mmoho jwalo ka kontinente, re kgonne ho fihlella kimollo ya mekitlane bakeng sa dinaha tse ngata le ho fumana thuso ya tjhelete bakeng sa ho lwantsha covid19 le ho thusa ho tsosa moruo.

src_text: but much as african countries went to the international community for support, we first helped ourselves – establishing and capitalising a continental covid19 response fund.
tgt_text: empa le ha e le mona dinaha tsa afrika di kopile thuso ho matjhabatjhaba, re ithusitse ka borona pele – ra aha latlole la ho lwantsha covid19 a kontinente.

src_text: for every partnership forged with betterresourced nations and the international donor community, we set up our own innovative and groundbreaking african medical supplies platform to enable all african countries to quickly secure personal protective equipment and other medical supplies in an equitable, affordable manner.
tgt_text: ka lebaka la tshebedisano mmoho enngwe le enngwe e etswang le dinaha tse nang le disebediswa tse betere mmoho le batshehetsi ba dinaha tsa matjhabatjhaba, re sibollotse motjha wa afrika wa phepelo ya disebediswa le meriana o tswetseng pele, bakeng sa ho thusa dinaha tsohle tsa afrika ho fumana disebediswa tsa tshireletso le phepelo ya meriana ka ho tshwana le ka ditjeho tse tlase.

src_text: and now that the covid19 vaccine is available, we have worked as a collective to ensure that the continent gets its fair share, working with the covax facility and led by our own african vaccine acquisition task team.
tgt_text: mme jwalo ka ha ente e thibelang covid19 e se e le teng, re sebeditse mmoho ho netefatsa hore kontinente e fumana karolo ya yona e e tshwanetseng, ka tshebedisano mmoho le setheo sa covax le ketello pele ya sehlopha sa afrika sa tshebetso ya phumano ya ente.

src_text: vaccine rollout has already commenced on the continent and we aspire to have the majority of the continent’s population vaccinated by the end of 2021 to achieve herd immunity.
tgt_text: ente e se e qadile ho fihla ka hara kontinente mme re labalabela ho bona boholo ba batho ba kontinente ba entile mafelong a 2021, hore re fihlelle setjhaba se sengata se entileng se seng se sa tshwaetsehe.

src_text: we have acted as one to protect health, people and livelihoods on the continent.
tgt_text: re sebeditse mmoho bake ng sa ho tshireletsa bophelo, batho le tshehetso ya bophe lo kontinenteng.

src_text: in doing so, we have demonstrated our capacity for selfreliance and our ability to be the drivers of our own development.
tgt_text: ka ho etsa jwalo, re bontshitse bokgoni ba ho ikemela le ho intshetsa pele.

src_text: despite the dominance of covid19, we have still managed to make advances in several of our key priorities.
tgt_text: le ha e le mona covid19 e re hlwele setha, re ntse re kgonne ho ntshetsa pele maano a rona a mmalwa a ka sehlohong.

src_text: during our term, the africa continental free trade area (afcfta) was finally launched, heralding a new era of intraafrican trade and economic integration.
tgt_text: sehleng sa rona ho ile ha sibollwa letsholo la kgwebisano ya dinaha tsa konti nente ya afrika ntle le dite fello (afcfta), e bontshang nako e ntjha kgwebisanong ya dinaha tsa afrika le kopanelong ya moruo.

src_text: even under the difficult conditions posed by the pandemic, the continent has pushed ahead with towards the goal of ‘silencing the guns’ on the continent.
tgt_text: le maemong a thata a tlisitsweng ke sewa sena, kontinente e ntse e kgonne ho tswela pele ka leano la ho ‘kgutsisa dithunya’ ka hara kontinente.

src_text: the au has been actively involved in negotiations around the grand ethiopian renaissance dam, in achieving a ceasefire in libya and promoting peace in south sudan.
tgt_text: au e ile ya nka karolo dipuisanong tsa grand ethiopian renai ssance dam mme ya fihlella ho kgutsisa dithunya libya le ho tlisa kgotso naheng ya south sudan.

src_text: another focus of our term has been on the economic empowerment of women, which we will continue to champion even beyond our term and throughout the decade of african women’s financial and economic inclusion to 2030. as we hand over the baton to the democratic republic of congo (drc) we leave this preeminent continental body in a position of greater strength.
tgt_text: nqa enngwe eo re neng re tsepamisitse maikutlo ho yona sehleng sa rona ke ho matlafatso ya basadi moruong, eo re tla tswela pele ho e kenya tshebetsong le ka mora sehla sa rona le nakong ya dilemo tse leshome tsa kenyeletso ya basadi ba afrika ditjheleteng le moruong ho leba ho 2030. jwalo ka ha re fetisetsa boetapele ho naha ya democratic republic of congo (drc), re tlohela ketapele ena e kgabane ya kontinente e le maemong a matle ho feta pele.

src_text: south africa will continue to play its part to foster integration on the continent, and support the incoming chair and the organisation in its efforts to meet the aspirations of the au’s agenda 2063. when the organisation for african unity was founded in 1963, member states planted the seeds of cooperation and solidarity in pursuit of a better life for all the peoples of africa.
tgt_text: afrika borwa e tla tswela pele ho nka karolo ho tlisa kopano ka hara kontinente, le ho tshehetsa ketapele e ntjha le matsapa a au a ho phethahatsa ditabatabelo tsa ona tsa agenda 2063. ha mokgatlo wa dinaha tsa afrika o ne o thewa ka 1963, dinaha tseo e leng ditho mokgatlong ona di ile tsa jala peo ya tshebedisano mmoho le bonngwe ntshetsopeleng ya bophelo bo botle bakeng sa batho bohle ba afrika.

src_text: they affirmed that african unity was paramount if the welfare and wellbeing of africa’s people was to be assured.
tgt_text: di ile tsa bolela hore kopano ya afrika e bohlokwa haholo bakeng sa ho netefatsa the kolohelo le bophelo bo botle ba maafrika.

src_text: history bears witness that these seeds have not always fallen on fertile ground, and over the years the continental unity project has experienced many hurdles and false starts.
tgt_text: nalane e paka hore ha se ka mehla moo peo ena e ileng ya wela mobung o nonneng, mme dilemong tse ngata tse fetileng, porojeke ya kopano ya kontinente e bone ditshita tse ngata le qalo tse fosahe tseng.

src_text: but the grave threat posed by this pandemic has galvanised african countries to collective action.
tgt_text: empa kotsi e tlisitsweng ke sewa sena e qobelletse dinaha tsa afrika ho sebetsa mmoho.

src_text: in the hothouse of the covid19 crisis, the seeds of unity and cooperation planted by our pioneering forebears have come to life and flourished.
tgt_text: thuto eo re ithutileng yona bothateng ba covid19 e entse hore peo ya kopano le ya tshebedisano mmoho tse jetsweng ke baholoholo ba rona e mele mme e behe tholwana tse molemo.

src_text: this time of great trial and difficulty has been among the au’s finest hours.
tgt_text: nako ena ya teko ya tonanahadi le mathata e bile enngwe ya dinako tse babatsehang tsa au.

src_text: we are honoured to have been given the opportunity to lead the organisation through this period, when it practically demonstrated the true meaning of the words african union.
tgt_text: ke tlotla hore re ile ra fuwa monyetla wa ho etella mokgatlo pele ka nako ena e bontshitseng hantle hore lentswe ‘kopano ya afrika’ le bolelang.

src_text: this is an accomplishment for which all the citizens of our continent africa should feel proud and from which they should draw encouragement.
tgt_text: ke tlotla hore re ile ra fuwa monyetla wa ho etella pele mokgatlo wa dinaha tsa afrika (au) vukuzenzele unnamed sehla sa afrika bo rwa sa ho ba moe tapele wa au se fi hlile pheletsong.

src_text: steps to revive the economy vukuzenzele unnamed it will soon be a year since the first reported case of coronavirus disease (covid19) in our country.
tgt_text: mehato ya ho tsosolosa moruo vukuzenzele unnamed e se e tla ba selemo jwale re bile le ke tsahalo ya pele ya kokwanahloko ya khorona e ileng ya tlalehwa naheng ya rona.

src_text: the pandemic has come at a great cost to both public health and the livelihoods of millions of our people.
tgt_text: sewa sena se bakile ditshenyehelo tse kgolo bophelong ba setjhaba esita le maphelong a dimilione tsa batho ba habo rona.

src_text: many workers lost part of their income as their work hours were reduced with many being retrenched.
tgt_text: basebetsi ba bangata ba lahlehetswe ke karolo ya meputso ya bona ha dihora tsa bona tsa tshebetso di fokotswa, mme ba bangata ba fokotswa mesebetsing.

src_text: several businesses have incurred heavy losses from scaledback operations.
tgt_text: dikgwebo tse ngata di bile le tahlehelo e boima ka lebaka la ditshebetso tse fokoditsweng.

src_text: others have had to close.
tgt_text: tse ding di ile tsa tlameha ho kwalwa.

src_text: people working in the informal sector have also suffered.
tgt_text: batho ba sebetsang karolong ya moruo e sa hlophiswang le bona ba amehile habohloko.

src_text: most difficult of all, the pandemic has claimed the lives of breadwinners in many families, leaving them destitute and fearful for the future.
tgt_text: ntlheng e boima ka ho fetisisa, sewa sena se nkile maphelo a bafepi malapeng a mangata, mme ba malapa ba sala ba itlhophere, hape ba tsielehille bakeng sa bokamoso.

src_text: this is why the extensive relief measures we put in place were both necessary and urgent.
tgt_text: ke ka lebaka lena mehato e pharaletseng ya diphallelo eo re e nkileng e neng e hlokeha e bile e le e potlakileng.

src_text: and, now that nearly a year has passed, we can say that these measures have proved effective.
tgt_text: hape, jwalo ka ha ho batla ho fetile selemo, re ka re mehato ena e atlehile.

src_text: of the full package of relief measures that we introduced, perhaps the two measures that had the greatest impact were the special covid19 social relief of distress grant and the unemployment insurance fund's (uif) covid19 temporary employer/employee relief scheme, generally known as covid ters.
tgt_text: kakaretsong ya yona mehato ena ya diphallelo tseo re di entseng mohlomong e mmedi e bileng le tshusumetso e matla haholo ke phallelo ya setjhaba e ikgethileng ya covid19 le ya uif, ya leano la diphallelo tsa basebetsi la nakwana, le tsejwang feela e le covid ters.

src_text: we would not have been able to roll out these measures in such a short space of time if we had not had an extensive social security infrastructure already in place.
tgt_text: re ne re ke ke ra atleha ho qala mehato ena ka nako e kgutshwane hakana haeba re ne re se na dibopeho tsa motheo tsa tshireletseho ya setjhaba tse pharaletseng tse neng di se di sebetsa.

src_text: we were able to respond to this huge and immediate need in our society thanks to the substantial nationwide infrastructure and systems of the south african social security agency and the uif.
tgt_text: re ile ra kgona ho arabela tlhoko ena e kgolo e bileng e le e potlakileng setjhabeng sa rona, re leboha dibopeho tsa motheo tse kgolo naheng ka bophara le ditsamaiso tsa setsi sa afrika borwa sa tshireletso ya botjhaba (sassa) le letlole la inshorense ya batho ba feletsweng ke mosebetsi (uif).

src_text: there were certainly technical and other glitches along the way, but most of these were speedily resolved.
tgt_text: kantle ho qeaqeo, a bile teng mathatanyana a setekgeniki le a mang boleleng ba nako, empa tsena tsohle di ile tsa rarolleha kapele.

src_text: these government agencies did outstanding work to enroll millions of new beneficiaries and ensure they were paid.
tgt_text: diagente tsena tsa mmuso di entse mosebetsi o babatsehang wa ho ngodisa dimilione tsa baamohedi ba batjha le ho netefatsa ho lefuwa ha bona.

src_text: the support provided by the uif was a lifeline to struggling businesses and employees.
tgt_text: tshehetso e fanweng ke uif e inotse dikgwebo tse thekeselang esita le basebetsi.

src_text: it made the difference between companies remaining open and being forced to close, between jobs saved and jobs lost.
tgt_text: e entse phapang pakeng tsa dikhampani tse setseng di sebetsa le tse ileng tsa tlameha ho kwalwa, pakeng tsa mesebetsi e ileng ya bolokeha le e ileng ya lahleha.

src_text: this benefited businesses like sihle’s brew, a restaurant in gauteng, which was able to retain its 18 employees because of the ters scheme.
tgt_text: sena se ile sa tswela molemo dikgwebo tse jwalo ka sihle’s brew, kgwebo ya dijo gauteng, e ileng ya kgona ho boloka basebetsi ba yona ba 18 ka lebaka la morero wa ters.

src_text: thanks to government support, mamoshal agae trading and projects, an autoelectrical business in mokopane, was able to pay its workers as well as its rent and rates during the lockdown.
tgt_text: re leboha tshehetso ya mmuso, mamoshalagae trading and pojects, kgwebo ya motlakase wa dipalangwang mokopane, e ile ya kgona ho lefa basebetsi ba yona esita le ho lefella rente, le ditefiso tsa thepa nakong ya ho kginwa ha tshebetso le maeto.

src_text: employees in dire straits were able to receive a portion of their salaries.
tgt_text: basebetsi ba maqakabetsing ba ile ba kgona ho amohela karolo ya meputso ya bona.

src_text: lindiwe ntuli, a paralegal in centurion, has told how receiving her benefits enabled her to work from home and be able to afford her rent.
tgt_text: lindiwe ntuli, molaodi wa molao, centurion, o boletse kamoo ho fumana ha hae meropotso ho ileng ha mo thusa hore a tsebe ho sebeletsa hae mme a kgonane le rente ya hae.

src_text: there are many stories of companies that have been able to stay afloat over the past year because of the support they received from the uif.
tgt_text: di ngata dipale tsa dikhampani tse ileng tsa qoba ho teba nakong ya selemo sena se fetileng ka lebaka la tshehetso eo di e fumaneng ho uif.

src_text: the same can be said of the small businesses helped by the various grants and loans provided by a number of departments.
tgt_text: ho ka phetwa tse tshwanang le dikgwebong tse nyenyane tse thusitsweng ke diphallelo tse fapafapaneng esita le dikadimo tse fanweng ke mafapha a mangata.

src_text: these measures greatly helped our people in their time of need.
tgt_text: mehato ena e thusitse batho ba habo rona haholo nakong ya bona ya tlhoko.

src_text: as we transition from relief to recovery, we have to shift gear.
tgt_text: jwalo ka ha re fetoha ho tloha ho diphallelo ho ya ho tsosoloso, re tlameha ho fetola mokgwa wa rona wa tshebetso.

src_text: while these relief measures were designed to be temporary, the economy will continue to feel the effects of the pandemic for some time.
tgt_text: le hoja mehato ena ya kokobetso e ne e raletswe ho ba ya nakwana, moruo o tla tswela pele ho utlwa maoma a sewa sena nako e itseng.

src_text: even as lockdown restrictions have been eased, many companies are struggling to cope with the fallout of months of diminished operations and lost revenue.
tgt_text: le ha e le mona dipehelo tsa ho kginwa ha tshebetso le maeto di nyenyisitswe, dikhampani tse ngata di fumana ho le thata ho emelana le ditlamorao tsa dikgwedi tse ngata tsa ditshebetso tse fokotsehileng esita le kuno e lahlehileng.

src_text: it is for this reason that, following extensive discussion with social partners at the national economic development and labour council the covid ters benefit has been extended until 15 march 2021 for sectors that have not been able to fully operate.
tgt_text: ke ka lebaka lena, kamorao ho dipuisano tse pharaletseng le balekane ba rona ba tswang setjhabeng ho lekgotla la naha la ntshetsopele ya moruo le basebetsi (nedlac), meropotso ya covid ters e atolotswe ho ya ho 15 tlhakubele 2021 bakeng sa dikarolo tse sa kang tsa kgona tshebetso ka botlalo.

src_text: the special covid grant has been extended for another three months.
tgt_text: tshehetso e ikgethileng ya covid e atolotswe ka dikgwedi tse ding tse tharo.

src_text: these remain shortterm measures.
tgt_text: ena e ntse e le mehato ya nako e kgutshwane.

src_text: our focus now must be on creating an enabling environment for businesses to recover, and for economic growth that spurs job creation and attracts invest ment.
tgt_text: re tlameha ho tsepamisa maikutlo a rona ho bopeng tikoloho e fang dikgwebo bokgoni ba tsosoloso, hape le kgolo ya moruo e tla kenya ho thewa ha mesebetsi merebele, hape e hohele matsete.

src_text: the recovery will be difficult and will take time, not least because we are still in the midst of the pandemic.
tgt_text: tsosoloso e tla ba boima mme e tla nka nako, hakaakang re sa ntse re le ka hara sewa.

src_text: important as these relief measures are now, we will not be able to sustain them indefinitely.
tgt_text: le ha e le ya bohlokwa jwalo, mehato ena ya diphallelo, re ke ke ra kgona ho di ntshetsa pele molebe.

src_text: we need to make sure that these relief measures provide a firm foundation for a broader recovery without driving the country deeper into debt.
tgt_text: re tshwanela ho etsa bonnete ba hore mehato ena ya diphallelo e fana ka motheo o tiileng bakeng sa tsosoloso e batsi kantle ho ho kgannela naha tebetebeng ya dikoloto.

src_text: unless we can bring our national debt down to sustainable levels no meaningful economic recovery will be possible.
tgt_text: kantle ho ha re ka theolela mokitlane wa naha ya rona methathing e laolehang, ha ho tsoloso e bonahalang e ka kgonehang.

src_text: our national consciousness must now move beyond the realm of relief into that of recovery, and we must all be part of this effort.
tgt_text: phadimehelo ya rona re le setjhaba e tlameha ho sutha mothathing wa diphallelo e habele ho wa tsosoloso, mme bohle re tshwanela ho ba karolo ya boiteko bona.

src_text: as government, hard decisions on public spending will need to be made and implemented this year.
tgt_text: re le mmuso, diqeto tse boima malebana le tshebediso ya ditjhelete tsa setjhaba di tla tshwanela ho nkuwa le ho sebediswa selemong sena.

src_text: companies will need to be innovative in driving methods and processes that secure their sustainability and profitability, with job retention being their foremost consideration.
tgt_text: dikhampani di tla tshwanela ho hlahisa dintjhafatso ho ntshetseng pele mekgwa le ditshebetso tse netefatsang mokoka le bokgoni ba ho etsa phaello, poloko ya mesebetsi e le monahanong o ka sehloohong.

src_text: we must put our money back into our economy by buying local products, supporting local businesses and industrie and procuring from local suppliers.
tgt_text: re tlameha ho busetsa tjhelete ya rona moruong wa rona ka ho reka dihlahiswa tsa ka hara naha, re tshehetse dikgwebo tsa ka hara naha le bahlahisi ba ka hara naha, re reke ho bafepi ba ka hara naha.

src_text: an injured patient with strong prospects for recovery is given regular phys ical therapy to help them get stronger until they can stand unaided.
tgt_text: mokudi ya lemetseng mme a bonahala a na le menyetla e meholo ya ho kgutlela boemong ba hae ba pele o fumantshwa phekolo ya mmele e sa thiseng e le ho mo thusa ho matlafala ho fihlela a ka ikemela a sa thuswe.

src_text: so must these temporary relief measures be seen as the means to get our economy back on its feet.
tgt_text: ka mokgwa o jwalo mehato ena ya diphallelo ya nakwana e tlameha ho bonwa e le mokgwa wa ho etsa hore moruo wa rona o boele o ikemele ka maoto.

src_text: our ultimate goal is to walk again.
tgt_text: sepheo sa rona sa qetello ke sa hore re boele re tsamaye.

src_text: as a nation, let us all lend a hand.
tgt_text: re le setjhaba, kaofela ha rona ha re thuseng.

src_text: let us be part of our own development and progress.
tgt_text: ha re beng karolo ya ntshetsopele le tswelopele ya rona.

src_text: let us use the extended relief to drive a stronger recovery.
tgt_text: mehato ya ho tsosolosa moruo vukuzenzele unnamed e se e tla ba selemo jwale re bile le ke tsahalo ya pele ya kokwanahloko ya khorona e ileng ya tlalehwa naheng ya rona.

src_text: a professional public service vukuzenzele unnamed when i was elected to the position of president of south africa, i said that building an efficient, capable and ethical state free from corruption was among my foremost priorities.
tgt_text: tshebeletso ya setjhaba e profeshenale vukuzenzele unnamed ha ke ne ke kgethwa ho ba mopresi dente wa afrika borwa, ke itse ho aha naha e sebetsang hantle, e nang le bokgoni le boitshwaro, le ho hloka bobudu, ke ya tse ding tsa dintlha tsa ka tse bohlokwahlokwa tse ka sehlohlolong.

src_text: only a capable, efficient, ethical and developmentoriented state can deliver on the commitment to improve the lives of the people of this country.
tgt_text: ke naha feela e nang le bokgoni, e sebetsang hantle, e maitshwaro a matle mme e tsepameng ntshetsopeleng e tla kgona ho phethahatsa boitlamo ba yona ba ho ntla fatsa maphelo a batho ba naha ena.

src_text: this means that the public service must be staffed by men and women who are professional, skilled, selfless and honest.
tgt_text: hona ho bolela hore tshe beletso ya setjhaba e tlameha ho hirelwa banna le basadi ba profeshenale, ba nang le tsebo, ba sa inahaneleng ba le bang mme ba nang le botshepehi.

src_text: they must be committed to upholding the values of the constitution, and must, as i said in my inaugural speech, "faithfully serve no other cause than that of the public".
tgt_text: ba tlameha ho itlama ka ho phahamisa ditekanyetso tsa molaotheo, mme ba tlame hile, jwalo ka ha ke ile ka hla losa puong ya ka ya pele ya bopresidente, "ho sebeletsa setjhaba sa naha ena feela ka botshepehi".

src_text: over the past two weeks, public consultations have been underway on an important policy document that will give greater impetus to our efforts to bolster, strengthen and capacitate the civil service.
tgt_text: dibekeng tse pedi tse feti leng, dipuisano le setjhaba di ile tsa nka sebaka ma bapi le tokomane ya leano le bohlokwa le tla fana ka matla boitekong ba rona ba ho nolofatsa, ho matlafatsa le ho fana ka bokgoni ho tshebeletso ya setjhaba.

src_text: the draft national implementation framework towards the professionalisation of the public service aims to build a state that better serves our people, that is insulated from undue political interference and where appointments are made on merit.
tgt_text: moralo wa naha wa tshe betso wa nakwana o mabapi le ho phahamisa botsebi ba tshebeletso ya setjhaba o ike miseditse ho aha naha e tla fa batho ba rona ditshebeletso tse betere, tse tshireletsehi leng kgahlano le kgahlamelo ya dipolotiki mme le moo batho ba hirwang ho ya ka makgabane a bona.

src_text: the framework was approved by cabinet in november last year and structured consultation with various sectors of society are now underway.
tgt_text: moralo ona o ananetswe ke kabinete ka pudungwana selomong se fetileng mme le dipuisano tse hlophisitsweng le makala a mmalwa a setjha ba, se dintse di tswelapele.

src_text: twentyseven years into democracy, it can be said of the public service that while several pockets of excellence exist, we have serious challenges in many government departments with regards to skills, competence and professionalism.
tgt_text: dilemo tse 27 ho kenwe demokrasing, ho ka tjho ka tshebeletso tsa setjhaba hore le ha feela ho ena le tse mmalwa tse hlwahlwa, re na le diphepetso tse ngatangata ho a mang mafapha mabapi le botsebi, tshebetso e nang le boiphihlelo le profeshenale.

src_text: all too often, people have been hired into and promoted to key positions for which they are neither suitable nor qualified.
tgt_text: boholo ba nako, batho ba hirwa le ho phahamisetswa maemong a hodimo ao a sa ba tshwaneleng kapa ao ba senang mangolo a ona.

src_text: this affects government performance, but also contributes to nepotism, political interference in the work of departments, lack of accountability, mismanagement and corruption.
tgt_text: sena se hahlamela tshebetso ya mmuso hampe, empa se boela se eba le seabo ho bolesafo, boitshunyakgare ba dipolotiki mesebetsing ya mafapha, ho hloka boika rabelo, tsamaiso e bohlaswa le bobodu.

src_text: there is also the related problem of political and executive interference in the administration of the public service.
tgt_text: ho boela ho ena le bothata bo amanang le boitshunya kgare ba sepolotiki le bolaodi ba phethahatso tsamaisong ya tshebeletso ya setjhaba.

src_text: one need only to look at the instability in government departments when senior managers are swopped or replaced each time a new minister is appointed.
tgt_text: motho o hloka feela ho she ba tlhokeho ya botsitso e ba teng mafapheng a mmuso ha balaodi ba ka sehloohong ba fapantshwa kapa ho kengwa ba batjha ha ho hirwa letona le letjha.

src_text: directorsgeneral (dgs) and provincial heads of departments (hods) are particularly affected.
tgt_text: balaodi ba baholo (didg) le dihlooho tsa mafapha (dihod) a diprofense ke tsona tseya amehang haholo.

src_text: in some departments, dgs, hods and executive managers have had stability of tenure, enabling the departments to function with little disruption.
tgt_text: mafapheng a mang, didg, dihod le batsamaisi ba phethahatso ba bile le bo tsitso ka nako ya tshebetso e telele, sena se ile sa dumella mafapha ho sebetsa hantle ntle le tshitiso e ngata.

src_text: in most of these departments where there is leadership stability, audit outcomes tend to be positive and public funds can be accounted for.
tgt_text: boho long ba mafapha ana ho ne ho ena le ketapele e tsitsitseng, diphetho tsa bohlakisi tse hlwekileng mme le matlole a setjhaba a ne a sebediswa ka maikarabelo.

src_text: where there is a high turnover of heads of department, there is often administrative turmoil.
tgt_text: moo ho nang le tahlehelo e hodimo ya dihlooho tsa mafapha, ha ngata ho ba le pherekano e ngata tsamaisong.

src_text: one of the key recommendations made in the draft framework is that the public service must be depoliticised and that government departments must be insulated from politics.
tgt_text: e nngwe ya ditshisinyo tse ka sehlohong e entsweng ho moralo ona ke hore tshebe letso ya setjhaba ha ya tla meha ho amana le dipolotiki mme mafapha a mmuso a tlameha ho ntshwa dipolo tiking.

src_text: professionalisation is necessary for stability in the public service, especially in the senior ranks.
tgt_text: boprofeshenale bo bohlo kwa hore ho tle ho be le botsitso tshebeletsong ya setjhaba, haholoholo ho ba maemong a hodimo tshebetsong.

src_text: public servants must be able to continue doing their jobs "regardless of any changes of ministers, members of the executive council or councillors within the governing party in charge of the administration, or changes to political parties after elections".
tgt_text: basebetsi ba setjhaba ba tlameha ho tswe lapele ho etsa mosebetsi wa bona "ho sa kgathalatsehe hore na ho na le phetholo ya matona, ditho tsa lekgotla la phethahatso kapa balekgotla mokgatlong o busang o ika rabellang tsamaisong, kapa ha mekgatlo ya dipolotiki e fetoha ka mora dikgetho".

src_text: we are proposing a number of farreaching reforms, such as extending the tenure of hods based on merit and performance, doing occupationbased competency assessments and involving the public service commission in the interviews of dgs and deputy dgs.
tgt_text: re sisinya palo ya diphe toho tse tla finyellang hole, tse jwalo ka ho atolosa nako ya tshebetso ya dihlooho tsa lefapha ho ya ka makgabane le tshebetso ya bona, ho etsa dihlahlobo tsa bokgoni ba ho phethahatsa tshebetso le ho mema komishini ya tshe beletso ya setjhaba ho ba le seabo diinthaviung tsa mese betsi ya didg le batlatsi ba balaodi ba moholo (diddg).

src_text: introducing integrity tests for all shortlisted individuals will help so that we can recruit civil servants who can serve honestly.
tgt_text: ho kenya tshebetsong di teko tsa seriti ho batho bohle ba hlwahilweng ho lenane la diinthaviu ho tla thusa hore re kgone ho fumana basebetsi ba mmuso ba tla sebetsa ka botshepehi.

src_text: we also need to extend the compulsory entrance exams that we introduced in april 2020 beyond senior management.
tgt_text: re boela re hloka ho atolosa ditlhahlobo tsa di kamohelo tse tlamang bohle tseo re ileng ra di tsebahatsa ka mmesa 2020 tseo ha jwale di tobaneng le bahlanka ba mmuso ba baholo hore jwale di etswe le ke basebetsi ba mmuso kaofela.

src_text: successful developmental states have similar measures which help advance professionalism within the public service.
tgt_text: dinaha tse tswelang pele tse atlehileng di ile tsa kenya mekgwa e jwalo ho di thusa ho ntshetsa pele boprofeshenale lekaleng la ditshebeletso tsa setjhaba.

src_text: as we note in the draft framework, "the bureaucracy must continue to loyally and diligently implement the political mandate set by voters and the party, but to refrain from being political actors themselves.
tgt_text: jwalo ka ha re hlalositse ho moralo wa nakwana, "tsamaiso ya naha e tlameha ho tsamaiswa ka botshepehi le ho phethahatsa thomo ya sepolotiki ka mahlahahlaha ho ya ka taelo ya bakgethi le mokgatlo, mme ho hlokahala hore ho ikgulwe dipoloti keng ha ho tla ntlheng ya ditshebeletso.

src_text: "we are suggesting a more rigorous approach towards recruitment and selection of public servants, induction and performance management.
tgt_text: "re sisinya mokgwa o mong o hlwahlwa wa ho hira le ho kgetha basebetsi ba setjhaba, tsamaiso ya kamohelo ya basebetsi ba batjha le tshe betso.

src_text: this includes continuous learning and a clear professional development path for every public servant.
tgt_text: sena se kenyeletsa ho ithuta ho tswelapele le tsela e hlakileng ya ntshetsopele ya boprofeshenale ba mosebetsi e mong le mong wa setjhaba.

src_text: the draft framework puts emphasis on the need to hold public servants accountable for irregularities, to do away with a culture of impunity in the mismanagement and misappropriation of state resources.
tgt_text: moralo wa nakwana o ha tella tlhokeho ya ho netefatsa hore basebetsi ba mmuso ba ikarabella tshebedisong e bohlaswa ya ditjhelete tsa setjhaba, ho fedisa tlwaelo ya ho se fumantshwe kotlo tsamaisong e bohlaswa ya ditjhelete le e sa tshwanelang ya mehlodi ya mmuso.

src_text: professionalising the public service involves training for accounting officers across all spheres of government on the applicable legislative provisions.
tgt_text: boprofeshenale tshebe letsong ya mmuso bo kenye etsa kwetliso ya basebetsi ba diakhaonto makaleng a mmuso ka bophara ho ya ka ditekanyetso tse ikamaha ntsha le ketsamolao.

src_text: the national school of government (nsg) has a vital role to play in this regard.
tgt_text: sekolothupello sa naha sa mmuso (nsg) se bapala ka rolo e bohlokwa ntlheng ena.

src_text: professionalism is not only about having the right qualifications and technical skills, but also about having appropriate standards of respect, courtesy and integrity in dealing with members of the public.
tgt_text: boprofeshenale ha bo bolele ho ba le mangolo a tshwanetseng le botsebi ba matsoho feela, empa le ho ba le maemo a tshwane tseng a maitshwaro a nang le hlompho, boitlhompho, le seriti ha o sebetsa le ditho tsa setjhaba.

src_text: the public service is diverse, with a huge range of skills, qualifications and capabilities.
tgt_text: tshebeletso ya setjhaba e fapane, e na le mekgahlelo e mengata e kenyeletsang bo tsebi, mangolo a boiphihlelo le bokgoni.

src_text: many public servants have specialised skills that are necessary for the effective provision of services.
tgt_text: boholo ba basebetsi ba setjhaba bona le botsebi bo ikgethileng bo hlokehang phanong ya kabelo ya ditshe beletso e tshwanetseng.

src_text: it is therefore not necessarily the case that we need a smaller public service: what we actually need is a fitforpurpose public service with suitable skills, a professional ethic and a commitment to serving the people.
tgt_text: ka hoo, ha se hore re hloka tshe beletso ya setjhaba e nyenya ne: seo re feela re se hloka ke tshebeletso ya setjhaba e nang le mehlodi yohle e tshe betso e nang le boitsebi bo tshwanetseng, maitshwaro a boprofeshenale le boitlamo ba ho sebeletsa setjhaba.

src_text: the men and women of the public service need to be capacitated to play their role in driving development and consolidating democracy.
tgt_text: banna le basadi ba tshebe letso ya setjhaba ba hloka ho fumantshwa bokgoni hore ba kgone ho bapala dikarolo tsa bona ho kganneng ntshe tsopele le ho matlafatsa de mokrasi ya rona.

src_text: this is our best guarantee of a capable state that serves the interests of citizens.
tgt_text: hona ke netefaletso ya rona e kgolo ya naha e nang le bokgoni e sebeletsang ditlhoko tsa baahi ba yona.

src_text: i call on you to be part of the public consultation process around this draft framework, which is available on the nsg's website, and to make your voice heard.
tgt_text: ke ipiletsa ho lona hore le nke karolo ho tsamaiso ya dipuisano le setjhaba tse ma bapi le moralo wa nakwana, o fumanehang websaeteng ya nsg, ho etsa hore lentswe la hao le utlwahale.

src_text: the public service does not belong to any one party, nor should it be the domain of any particular interest group.
tgt_text: tshebeletso ya setjhaba ha se ya mokgatlo ofe kapa ofe o le mong feela, kapa ha ya tlameha ho laolwa ke mokgatlo o nang le ditabatabelo tse itseng.

src_text: it should not be a law unto itself.
tgt_text: ha ya tlameha ho iketsa molao ka bo yona.

src_text: the public service belongs to the people of south africa.
tgt_text: tshebeletso ya setjhaba ke ya batho bohle ba afrika borwa.

src_text: it must serve them and them alone.
tgt_text: tshebeletso ya setjhaba e profeshenale vukuzenzele unnamed ha ke ne ke kgethwa ho ba mopresi dente wa afrika borwa, ke itse ho aha naha e sebetsang hantle, e nang le bokgoni le boitshwaro, le ho hloka bobudu, ke ya tse ding tsa dintlha tsa ka tse bohlokwahlokwa tse ka sehlohlolong.

src_text: traditional leaders key to recovery efforts vukuzenzele unnamed in the last few months, we have had to bid a sad farewell to two of our country’s most respected traditional monarchs.
tgt_text: marena a bohlokwa mehatong ya tsoseletso ya moruo vukuzenzele unnamed dikgweding tse mma lwa tse fetileng, marena a mabedi a neng a hlomphuwa haholo naheng ena a iketse badi mong.

src_text: the zulu people recently laid to rest his majesty king goodwill zwelithini ka bhekuzulu who reigned for half a century.
tgt_text: setjhaba sa mazulu se sa tswa boloka morena wa sona morena goodwill zwelithini ka bhekuzulu ya busitseng dilemo tse 50 kaofela.

src_text: in january, the bapedi people buried kgoshikgolo thulare thulare iii, who passed away less than a year after his inauguration.
tgt_text: ka phe rekgong, setjhaba sa bapedi le sona se bolokile morena wa sona kgoshikgolo thulare thulare wa boraro, ya ileng badimong ho so fele le selemo a kotsometse sa borena.

src_text: with their passing, we have lost champions of the preservation of our heritage, and revered custodians of the histories of their respective peoples.
tgt_text: re lahlehetswe haholo ke dikakapa tsena paballong ya setso le nalane ya ditjhaba tsa tsona ka ho fapana.

src_text: at the same time, they were vital players in rural development, and were committed to driving programmes to uplift the material conditions of their people.
tgt_text: marena ana a ne a boetse a bapala karolo ya bohlokwa ntshetsong pele ya dibaka tsa mahaeng mme a le ka pele mananeong a ntlafatso ya maemo a ditjhaba tsa ona.

src_text: with the advent of democracy in 1994, it was a priority of the new government to restore the integrity and legitimacy of traditional leadership in line with indigenous law and customs and subject to the constitution of the republic.
tgt_text: ha demokrasi e qala ka sele mo sa 1994, mmuso o motjha o ile wa beha pele taba ya ho kgutlisa seriti le tlhompho ya marena le ho netefatsa hore melao e laolang ditaba tsa setso le meetlo e ikamahanya le molaotheo wa naha ena.

src_text: the institution of traditional leadership continues to play an important role in the lives of millions of people around our country, especially in rural areas.
tgt_text: marena a bapala karolo e kgolo maphelong a dimilione tsa batho naheng ena, haholo holo dibakeng tsa mahaeng.

src_text: traditional leaders support and drive development in their communities.
tgt_text: marena a tshehetsa le hona ho ntshetsa pele ntlafatso ditjhabeng tsa ona.

src_text: recently, i had the opportunity to participate in the debate on the opening of the national house of traditional leaders, which was concerned with the most pressing issues currently facing the country.
tgt_text: haufinyane ke sa tswa fumana monyetla wa ho kopana le ona marena ha ho ne ho bulwa palamente ya marena moo ho neng ho tshohlwa ditaba tsa bohlokwa tsa naha ena.

src_text: what was particularly refreshing about the robust engagement was that traditional leadership has a keen appreciation of the difficult economic conditions facing our country, and want to be part of addressing the many challenges of underdevelopment and poverty in their areas.
tgt_text: se ileng sa nkgahla haholo puisanong ya rona ke ho hlokomela hore le marena a ngongorehile ka maemo a boima a moruo naheng ena mme le ona a batla ho ba ka rolo ya tharollo ya mathata le bofuma dibakeng tsa ona.

src_text: i have consistently said that our economic recovery in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic must be inclusive, and that nobody must be left behind.
tgt_text: ke dutse ke bolela hore tso seletso ya moruo ka lebaka la sewa sa khorona, e tlameha ho kenyeletsa motho ohle, ho se be le ya siuwang kantle.

src_text: the success of the economic reconstruction and recovery plan rests on forging strong partnerships between not just government, business and labour, but also with traditional leadership and other societal formations.
tgt_text: katleho ya leano la tsose letso le kahobotjha ya moruo ha e a tlameha ho ba letsema la mmuso, borakgwebo le basebetsi feela, empa marena le mekgatlo e meng ya setjha ba e tlameha ho kenyeletswa.

src_text: a constant refrain from participants in the debate recently was that they do not want to be dependent on handouts or for their communities to perpetually look to government for financial assistance.
tgt_text: maikutlo a hlahelletseng hangata a ho emisa ho llela mmusong a bontsha hore ma rena a ne a sa rate ho phutha matsoho mme a thabele taba ya ho kgaketswa ke mmuso kapa hona hore setjhaba sa ona se nne se shebe mmuso mahlong bakeng la thuso ya ditjhelete.

src_text: they want to be provided with the necessary support, training and enabling environment to allow rural communities to be selfsufficient.
tgt_text: a batla hore a fuwe tshe hetso le thupello a e hlokang mmoho le tikoloho e tla dumella setjhaba sa ona ho ikemela.

src_text: they want to bridge the urbanrural divide in access to government services and private sector resources.
tgt_text: a batla ho qeta phapang e teng pakeng tsa dibaka tsa mahaeng le tsa ditoropong ha ho tluwa tabeng ya ho fumana ditshebeletso tsa mmuso le dithuso lekaleng le ikemetseng.

src_text: what they would like to see is for rural areas to become centres of economic activity, industry and employment opportunity.
tgt_text: a batla ho bona dibaka tsa mahaeng e ba dibaka tsa kgiro, ditsi tsa tlhahiso le ntshetso pele ya moruo.

src_text: this mirrors the aspirations of the district development model (ddm), which was launched in 2019. traditional leaders are well positioned to ensure that district plans are informed by and respond to the real needs of communities and that they reflect the lived reality in rural areas.
tgt_text: sena se tshwantshwa hantle le le ano la ntlafatso ya ditereke (ddm), le neng le thehwe ka 2019. marena a maemong a nepahetseng a ho netefatsa hore maano ana a ntlafatso ya ditereke a sebetsa hantle le hore a atlehisa ditlhoko tsa setjhaba sa ona dibakeng tsa mahaeng.

src_text: just as the ddm supports localised programmes that focus on the needs, strengths and opportunities in specific areas, traditional leaders have pioneered their own approach to local economic development.
tgt_text: jwalo ka ha leano la ddm le tshehetsa maano a ntlafatsang ditlhoko le menyetla diba keng tse itseng, marena le ona a na le tsela ya ona e pele ya ho ntlafatsa moruo dibakeng tsa ona.

src_text: they have developed the investrural masterplan, which was launched in north west last month.
tgt_text: a thehile leano la ntlafatso ya dibaka tsa mahaeng, le hlomamisitsweng leboya bophirima kgweding e feti leng.

src_text: it is greatly encouraging that traditional leaders have rallied behind the plan and want to work with local authorities to ensure it is a success.
tgt_text: ke ntho e kgothatsang ho bona hore marena kaofela a tshehetsa leano lena mme a batla ho sebetsa mmoho le makgotla a metsaneng ho netefatsa katleho ya lona.

src_text: during the debate in the national house of traditional leaders it was proposed that a major success factor for the investrural programme is that traditional structures are trained, strengthened and capacitated.
tgt_text: puisanong ya rona pala menteng ya marena, ho ile ha hlahella hore leano lena la ntlafatso ya dibaka tsa mahaeng le ka atleha ha feela dikomiti tsa marena di fumana tshehetso le thupello.

src_text: a number of participants outlined economic plans that are already in advanced stages of development.
tgt_text: bankakaroloba mmalwa ba ile ba hlahisa maano a kgo diso ya moruo a seng a hatetse pele haholo.

src_text: these range from agricultural projects to bioprospecting to renewable energy.
tgt_text: hara ona re ka bala a tsa temo, tshebediso ya dimela le diphoofolo ho etsa meriana esitana le tsoseletso ya matla a motlakase.

src_text: what was evident is that the institution of traditional leadership understands that professionalisation is necessary for rural businesses in the form of small, medium and micro enterprises and cooperatives to become part of the mainstream economy.
tgt_text: se ileng sa hlokomeleha ke hore marena a elellwa taba ya hore ho tle dikgwebo tsa mahaeng di atlehe mme e be karolo ya moruo wa naha ena, di tlameha ho sebetsa ka tsela ya profeshenale ho sa natsehe hore ke tse thuthuhang, tse mahareng, tse hodileng kapa tsa matsema.

src_text: the traditional leaders who spoke presented their vision of ‘developmental monarchs’, who see themselves as not just custodians of heritage but also as drivers of economic prosperity and progress.
tgt_text: marena ohle a buileng mona, a bontshitse taba ya hore ona ha se marena a she bileng paballo ya setso feela, empa a ntshetsa pele le taba ya moruo dibakeng tseo a busang ho tsona.

src_text: they have identified several projects and economic opportunities that will create jobs and improve livelihoods in rural areas.
tgt_text: a hlwahile diprojeke tse ngatanyana le menyetla ya moruo e tla theha menyetla ya mesebetsi le ho ntlafatsa maphelo a batho ba mahaeng.

src_text: traditional leaders have also expressed their willingness to play an active part in the land reform process.
tgt_text: marena a boetse a ikemise ditse ho nka karolo kabong botjha ya mobu.

src_text: since 2018, traditional leaders have made around 1 500 000 hectares of communal land available for development, and it is hoped this will increase in future.
tgt_text: ho tloha ka selemo sa 2018, marena a se a nehelane ka mobu o ka bang dihektara tse 1 500 000 bakeng sa ntshetsopele, mme re tshepa hore a tla fana ka o mong nakong e tlang.

src_text: to develop a coordinated and sustainable strategy, we have agreed to hold a presidential land summit in the next year.
tgt_text: hore re tle re be le leano le tiileng ka taba ena, re du mellane ka ho ba le pitso ya mopresidente ya ditaba tsa mobu isao.

src_text: this will discuss pressing issues around land reform and its impact on communal land, much of which is located in rural areas.
tgt_text: pitsong ena, ho tla tshohlwa ditaba tsa kabo ya mobu le kgahlamelo ya sena mobung wa marena o dibakeng tsa mahaeng.

src_text: the tone of the debate in the national house was a fitting reflection of a climate in which economic recovery is foremost among our considerations.
tgt_text: se bonahetseng haholo puisanong ya palamente ena ya marena, ke hore tsoseletso botjha ya moruo e ne e le yona ntlhakgolo.

src_text: at the same time it was a promising signal that traditional leaders appreciate their role in being part of the national recovery effort through being proactive and innovative.
tgt_text: ka ho le leng, sena e ne e le sesupo sa hore marena a thabela ho ba karolo ya tsoseletso ya moruo ka mahlale le maano a ona.

src_text: the most fitting legacy of great leaders is that the seeds of development they sow during their tenure grow into mighty trees that protect and shelter their communities for posterity.
tgt_text: sa bohlokwa haholo ke hore seo marena a se etsang hona jwale se tla tswela setjhaba sa ona molemo le melokong e tlang.

src_text: as we work together as a country to rebuild our economy, we will continue to count on the support of the institution of traditional leadership, which is an inextricable part of our past, our present and our future.
tgt_text: marena a bohlokwa mehatong ya tsoseletso ya moruo vukuzenzele unnamed dikgweding tse mma lwa tse fetileng, marena a mabedi a neng a hlomphuwa haholo naheng ena a iketse badi mong.

src_text: religious community vital in the fight against covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed recently many south africans of faith have joined others across the world in important religious observances.
tgt_text: badudi ba ditumelo tse fapaneng ba bohlokwa ntweng e kgahlanong le covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed moraorao tjena maafrika bo rwa a mangata a ipapisitse le ba bang ho phatlalla le lefatshe dike tsahalong tsa bohlokwa tsa bodumedi.

src_text: members of the jewish faith celebrated pesach, chris tians observed easter and muslims will soon be observing the holy month of ramadan.
tgt_text: ditho tsa bodu medi ba sejuda haufinyane tjena di sa tswa keteka pa seka, bakreste ba ketekile labohlano le halalelang ha mamoselemo haufinyane a tla keteka kgwedi e halale lang ya ramadan.

src_text: for the second year, these occasions have been marked in the midst of a devastating global pandemic that has cost the lives of more than 2.5 million people across the world.
tgt_text: jwale re se re le selemong sa bobedi bobedi, diketsahalo tsena di ketekwa hara sewa sena se thefutseng lefatshe se qositseng maphelo a batho ba fetang dimilione tse pedi le halofo ho phatlalla le lefatshe.

src_text: faithbased organisations have been vital to our national response to the disease, not only providing spiritual comfort and guidance, but also by caring for those most vulnerable to the effects of the pandemic, including through the provision of food, shelter and other social services.
tgt_text: mekgatlo ya ditumelo tse fapaneng esale e le bohlokwa ho karabelo ya rona lefung lena, e ne e sa fane feela ka matshediso a semoya le ta taiso, empa e ne e boetse e hlokomela ba neng ba ame hile haholo ke ditlamorao tsa sewa, ho kenyeletswa phano ya dijo, bodulo le ditshebe letso tse ding tsa kahisano.

src_text: religion plays an important role in the lives of millions of south africans, and congregational worship forms a vital part of their religious practice.
tgt_text: bodumedi bo bapala karolo ya bohlokwa maphelong a di milione tsa maafrika borwa, le ho kenela tshebeletso e le phutheho ke ka karolo ya bohlokwa ya ditlwaelo tsa bona tsa bodumedi.

src_text: being able to gather for religious services is also a welcome respite from a period of great hardship for individuals, families and communities.
tgt_text: ho kgona ho bokana ba keng sa ditshebeletso tsa bodumedi kamora ho tswa nakong ya mathata a maholo, e boetse e ba kgefu bakeng sa batho ka bo mong, malapa le badudi.

src_text: it is understandable that after more than a year of labouring under restrictions on religious gatherings that the faith community are keen for a return to a semblance of normality.
tgt_text: ho a utlwahala hore ka mora nako e fetang selemo ya ho sotleha tlasa dithibelo tsa dipokano tsa bodumedi, badumedi ba tjhesehela ho kgutlela maemong a setlwa eding.

src_text: in recognition of the importance of congregational worship to the lives of our people, government has been engaging with the faith community.
tgt_text: ka kananelo ya bohlokwa ba ho kena tshebeletsong e le phutheho maphelong a batho ba bo rona, mmuso esale o buisana le badumedi.

src_text: leaders of the faith community understand and appreciate the very real danger of a new wave of covid19 infections.
tgt_text: baetapele ba badumedi ba utlwisisa le ho ananela kotsi ya sebele ya ditshwaetso tsa leqhubu le le letjha la covid19 .

src_text: since the outbreak of the pandemic, religious organisations have taken proactive and positive measures to limit the spread of the disease among worshippers.
tgt_text: esale sewa sena se ropoha, mekgatlo ya bo dumedi e nkile mehato ya phadimeho le e hlwahlwa ya ho fokotsa ho nama ha lefu lena hara barapedi.

src_text: another important factor is that during the various alert levels, religious organisations have incurred substantial financial losses that threaten their sustainability.
tgt_text: ntlha e nngwe ya bohlokwa ke hore nakong ya mehato ya tlhokomediso e fapafapa neng, mekgatlo ya bodumedi e bile le ditahlehelo tse kgolo tsa ditjhelete tse tshosetsang boemo ba yona ba ho ite kanela.

src_text: as government we remain committed to working with the faith community to find workable solutions.
tgt_text: jwaloka mmuso re dula re itlamme ho sebetsa le badumedi bakeng sa ho thola ditharollo tse tla ba tswelang molemo.

src_text: at the same time, public health and safety must be our paramount consideration.
tgt_text: re sa le hona moo, boiteka nelo le polokeho ya setjhaba di lokela ho ba ka sehlohlo long.

src_text: the religious community has shown innovation and initiative in the holding of worship at a time when there was a great deal of uncertainty over the trajectory of the pandemic.
tgt_text: badumedi ba bontshitse ntjhafatso le boikitlaetso mabapi le ho tshwara di tshebeletso ha ho ne ho na le qeaqeo e kgolo mabapi le boemo ba sewa sena.

src_text: congregational services were held online and worshippers were encouraged to pray in their homes instead of attending services.
tgt_text: ditshebeletso tsa diphu theho di ne di tshwarwa ka marangrang a inthanete mme barapedi ba ne ba kgothale tswa ho rapella malapeng ho e na le ho ya ditshebeletsong.

src_text: this greatly aided the national effort to contain the spread of the disease.
tgt_text: sena se thusitse haholo me kutung ya naha ya ho ngotla ho nama ha lefu lena.

src_text: religious leaders played a pivotal role in encouraging public adherence to health measures around important customary and cultural rituals like burials.
tgt_text: baetapele ba bodumedi ba bapetse karolo ya bohlokwa mabapi le ho kgothaletsa setjhaba ho ikobela mehato ya bophelo bo botle mabapi le ditlwaelo tsa meetlo le tsa botjhaba tse akgang mapato.

src_text: by equal measure, our people have demonstrated their commitment to adhering to public health protocols and to social distancing.
tgt_text: ka tsela e tshwanang, batho ba bo rona ba bontshitse boi tlamo ba ho ikobela melawa na ya boitekanelo ba setjhaba le ho sielana sebaka.

src_text: and they correctly appreciate that they must continue to avoid large gatherings .
tgt_text: mme ruri ba ananela hore ba lokela ho tswella ho phema dipokano tse kgolo.

src_text: we are now at a time where precaution is needed above all.
tgt_text: hajwale re nakong moo re hlokang ho itlhokomela.

src_text: the coronavirus pandemic has not been eliminated, either in our own country or around the world.
tgt_text: kokwanahloko ya sewa sa corona ha e so fediswe, naheng ya bo rona kapa le fatsheng ho pota.

src_text: the threat of a third wave is real and everpresent.
tgt_text: ketsahalo ya hore re be le leqhubu la boraro e teng mme e tla dula e le teng.

src_text: international experience has taught us that we should not tempt fate.
tgt_text: boiphihlelo ba matjhabeng bo re rutile hore re seke ra leka modimo tumelo.

src_text: many countries have eased restrictions, only for there to be resurgences, necessitating the imposition of even harsher restrictions.
tgt_text: dinaha tse ngata di nyehlisitse dithibelo, kanthe ke feela moo ho bileng le ho ropoha botjha, ho ileng ha baka dithibelo tse matla le ho feta.

src_text: large gatherings, whether religious or otherwise, have the potential to spread the virus, despite the application of measures around social distancing and sanitising.
tgt_text: dipokano tse nang le batho ba bangata, e ka ba e le tsa bodumedi kapa tse ding, di na le bokgoni ba ho atisa kokwanahloko ena, ho sa natswe tshebediso ya ditsela tse amanang le ho sielana se baka le ho hlapa matsoho ka sebolayadikokwanahloko.

src_text: millions of south africans have been observing an important tenet of their faith.
tgt_text: dimilione tsa maafrika borwa esale di kenela di ketsahalo tsa bohlokwa tsa tumelo ya bona.

src_text: in a country that enshrines the right to religious freedom, all effort must be made to support our people in the exercise of this right.
tgt_text: naheng ena e amohelang tokelo ya bolokolohi ba bodumedi, ho lokelwa ho etswa mekutu yohle ya ho tshehetsa batho ba bo rona ha ba sebedisa to kelo ena.

src_text: and in exercising this right, we need to make sure that we do not place the rights or the lives of others at risk.
tgt_text: mme ha re sebedisa tokelo ena, re lokela ho etsa bonnete ba hore ha re behe ditokelo le maphelo a ba bang kotsing.

src_text: this is a principle that the religious leaders i met with fully support and appreciate.
tgt_text: ena ke pehelo eo baetapele ba bodumedi bao ke kopa neng le bona ba e tshehetsang le ho e ananela.

src_text: they understand the responsibility of all people of faith – indeed of all south africans – to observe the practical measures put in place to protect people’s health and save lives.
tgt_text: ba utlwisisa boikarabelo ba batho bohle ba ditumelo – hantlentle ba maafrika borwa kaofela – ho ikobela ditsela tse kgonehang tse behilweng bakeng sa ho sireletsa boitekanelo ba batho le ho boloka maphelo.

src_text: for more than a year, we have worked together as a society to contain this pandemic.
tgt_text: bakeng sa nako e fetang selemo, re sebeditse mmoho re le setjhaba ho ngotla sewa sena.

src_text: now as we work to overcome it, we need to reaffirm our shared determination to act responsibly and cautiously.
tgt_text: jwaloka ha re sebeletsa ho se hlola, re lokela ho tii setsa boikemisetso ba rona ba ho sebetsa ka boikarabelo le ka hloko.

src_text: in doing so, we will be giving practical effect to the universal messages of hope, salvation, freedom and solidarity that will be spoken of in the churches, synagogues, mosques and homes of our land in the days and weeks ahead.
tgt_text: badudi ba ditumelo tse fapaneng ba bohlokwa ntweng e kgahlanong le covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed moraorao tjena maafrika bo rwa a mangata a ipapisitse le ba bang ho phatlalla le lefatshe dike tsahalong tsa bohlokwa tsa bodumedi.

src_text: port of durban creates a sea of opportunities for sa vukuzenzele unnamed recently, i visit ed the port of durban to see for myself the work being done to make the port more efficient and competitive.
tgt_text: boemakepe ba durban bo thehela aforika borwa menyetla e thibang letsatsi vukuzenzele unnamed haufinyane tjena, ke sa tswa etela boe makepe ba durban ho ilo bona mosebetsi o etswang bakeng sa ho ntla fatsa tshebetso ya bona le ho bo etsa hore bo be le tlhodisano.

src_text: after a briefing with the senior management of transnet, i toured the harbour in a pilot boat, which is usually used to guide large ships through the entrance channel to the pier.
tgt_text: kamora ho buisana le balaodi ba phahameng ba transnet, ke ile ka hahlaula boemakepe ka seketswana se tsamaisang ba kganni ba dikepe, se atisang ho sebediswa ho tataisa dikepe tse kgolo ho kena moo di emang teng.

src_text: seeing the workings of the port from the water, one is reminded of its vast scale and complexity.
tgt_text: ho bona mosebetsi wa boema kepe o le ka metsing, o hopola ka moo o leng moholo le ho ra rahana ka teng.
